response: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). In a bowl, cream together butter and sugar until smooth. Add egg and mix well. Stir in flour, coffee granules, and almonds. Press mixture into a 13x9 inch baking dish. Bake in the preheated oven for 20 minutes. In a bowl, combine powdered sugar and almond extract until smooth. Pour glaze over baked crust. Bake for 20 minutes in the preheated oven. Cool completely. Cut into 2 inch squares.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a large skillet over medium heat, saut the sausage until no longer pink. Remove from pandrain fat. In the same skillet over medium heat, saute the mushrooms in the drippings until tender. Remove from skillet. In a large bowl, combine the bread cubes, sausage meat, mushrooms, celery, onion, butter, chicken broth, sage, salt, and pepper. Mix well. Stuff in chicken cavity. Place in a baking dish. Bake for 45 minutes. Serve.

Soak bread cubes in milk for 20 minutes or until soft. Drain and add turkey, onion, cheese, eggs, salt, pepper and poultry seasoning to bread cubes. Mix well. Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil. With wet hands form mixture into 2 loaf shaped rings. Bake on foil lined baking sheet at 350 degrees F for 45 minutes. Serve warm. Serves 4.

Cook spaghetti according to package directions. Drain and rinse with cold water. Drain. In a large bowl mix broccoli, spaghetti and peanut butter. Add soy sauce, stock, vinegar, red pepper flakes, pepper and garlic. Toss well. Serve garnished with scallions.

Cook macaroni in boiling water until tender. Rinse in cold water and drain well. Add vegan mayonnaise and nutritional yeast to macaroni and stir until evenly combined. Add non-dairy milk substitute and stir until macaroni is evenly coated. Add salt and pepper to taste. Spread mixture in an even layer on a baking pan. Bake in the preheated oven until lightly browned--about 20-25 minutes. Sprinkle with breadcrumbs and return to the oven for 5 minutes longer or until lightly browned.

Brown the sausages in a frying pan. Brown the onions in another pan. Cook the bacon in another pan until crisp. Drain. Add the french onion soup mix to a small amount of water in a saucepan. Bring to a boil. Add the frozen mixed vegetables. Cook for 10 minutes or until vegetables are tender. In a 13x9x2-inch baking pan, alternate layers of sausages, bacon and vegetables. Sprinkle with parsley. Pour soup mixture over the layers. Bake uncovered at 375 degrees for 30 minutes. Let stand for 5 minutes. Serves 6.

Spread 1 slice of white bread with a thin layer of crunchy peanut butter. Place a thin layer of jelly on the other slice of white bread. Stack the sandwiches together. Cut into triangles or squares. Serve with goldfish crackers.

In a small bowl, combine the first six ingredientsset aside. In a medium saucepan, cook rice according to package directions. Remove from heatcover and let stand for 5 minutes. Combine rice and next six ingredients. Combine chicken and soy mixture, and coat well. In a skillet coated with cooking spray, cook chicken in the soy mixture over medium-high heat for 5 to 7 minutes on each side or until a thermometer reads 170 degrees f. Serve with rice. Yields 4 servings.

Preheat oven to 350. Line baking sheets with parchment paper or silicone baking mats. In a medium bowl, cream the butter and sugar together until light and fluffy. Add the eggs and vanilla and beat until smooth. In a separate bowl, sift together the flour, baking soda, and salt. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet mixture until combined. Fold in the chocolate chips. Scoop the cookie dough onto the baking sheets with a 1-inch cookie scoop. Bake for 12-14 minutes or until the edges are just starting to brown. Remove from the oven and let cool for a few minutes before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely. Store in an airtight container at room temperature. Enjoy!
In a cocktail shaker with ice, combine vodka, ruby red grapefruit juice, and lime juice. Pour into an old fashioned glass filled with ice. Garnish with maraschino cherries and grapefruit.

In a large saucepan, combine sugar, water and juices. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer for 10 minutes or until thickened. Stir in almond flavoring. Serve hot or cold.

In a medium bowl, beat eggs with milk. Stir in cheese, green onions, jalapeno and seasonings. Heat a skillet over medium heat. Add butter. Pour in egg mixture. Cook until eggs are set. Serve immediately.

In a blender or food processor, puree strawberries and 1 cup of ginger ale until smooth. Add remaining ginger ale and stir. Combine milk and sugar and stir until sugar is dissolved. Add lemon juice and vanilla. Stir until well blended. Add the mixture to the blender or food processor. Mix until smooth. Serve cold. Garnish with sour cream and strawberry slices. Makes 6 servings.

Combine hoisin sauce, orange juice and honey. Spread salmon fillets with mixture. Broil 4 inches from heat 5 minutes per side or until fish flakes easily with a fork. Garnish with orange slices if desired.

Combine roasted red peppers, fresh cilantro leaves and balsamic vinegar in food processor until smooth and pureed. Stir in garlic clove and dry mustard. In another small bowl combine ground coriander and ground cinnamon. Stir in olive oil. Place chicken in resealable plastic bag along with almonds and spice mixture and marinate for at least 30 minutes or up to 24 hours in refrigerator. Grill over medium heat for 4 minutes per side or until cooked through and juices run clear. Serve with pepper pesto sauce and lemon wedges. Makes 4 servings.

Mix all together except vegetables in small bowl. Place vegetables on grill pan or grill basket. Brush with olive oil and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Cook for 10 minutes or until vegetables are tender. Remove vegetables from pan and brush with lemon juice butter mixture. Serve hot or cold. Serve with additional butter if desired.

Preheat the broiler. Mix the salt and pepper and rub the pork tenderloin. Heat the oil and garlic in a large skillet. Add the tenderloin and cook over high heat for 1 minute. Turn and cook for another minute. Add the onion and cook until the onion is soft. Transfer the pork and onion mixture to a broiler pan. Broil in the oven for about 5 minutes or until the pork is done. Makes about 4 servings.

Line the pie shell with the dried figs. Fill with the pears. Combine the pumpkin puree with the brown sugar and cinnamon. Spread over the pears. Bake for 45 minutes or until the crust is golden brown. Cool before serving.

Grease 8x8 pan. In a large bowl mix together brown sugar, butter and vanilla. Add flour. Press mixture into pan. Bake for 10 minutes. Let cool. Spread with marshmallows. Sprinkle with chocolate chips, walnuts and graham cracker crumbs. Bake for 5 more minutes. Cool completely before cutting into bars.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees F. Line a large baking sheet with wax paper and set aside. Mix together oats, almonds and wheat germ. In a small bowl combine honey, cinnamon, nutmeg and vanilla. Pour honey mixture over oat mixture and stir well. Spread mixture on baking sheet and bake for 30 minutes or until oats are lightly brown. Stir in dried fruit and bake 5 more minutes. Spread onto a wire rack and cool. Store in an airtight container. Serve with low-fat milk and fruit.

Cut the tops of the oranges off and carefully remove the white pith from inside the fruit. Cut the oranges into quarters and arrange in the base of the dish. Combine the sugar and water in a small saucepan and bring to the boil. Boil for about five minutes until the sugar has completely dissolved and then add the vanilla pods, or vanilla extract if using. Remove from the heat. Add the brandy or rum and stir well. Pour over the oranges and arrange the apricots around the edge of the dish. Sprinkle the remaining apricot halves over the top of the oranges and arrange the orange segments on top. Serve immediately or allow to cool completely before chilling overnight.

In a bowl combine margarine and sugar. Beat until smooth. Add eggs and vanilla. Combine dry ingredients. Stir into mixture. Fold in nuts. Spread in pan. Bake 350 degrees F for 25 minutes. Cool. Spread icing over. Cut into 16 bars. Yield: 16 brownies. Ingredients:1 box brownie mix1 cup chopped nuts2 tablespoons margarine2 tablespoons flour2 tablespoons sugar1 egg1/4 cup milk1/2 teaspoon vanilla1/4 teaspoon almond extract1/2 cup confectioners' sugar1/4 cup miniature chocolate chipsPreheat oven to 350 degrees F. Lightly grease and flour a 9 x 13 inch pan. Combine margarine and sugar in a bowl. Beat until smooth. Add eggs and vanilla. Combine dry ingredients. Stir into mixture. Fold in nuts. Spread in pan. Bake 350 degrees F for 25 minutes. Cool.

Cream together butter and splenda sugar substitute until light and fluffy. Beat in the egg substitute and crushed pineapple. Combine the flours and baking soda. Stir into the mixture alternately with the milk. Beat well. Pour into a greased loaf pan. Bake in a preheated oven at 350 degrees for about 1 hour, or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Cool in the pan for about 10 minutes before removing from pan. Makes one loaf.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Butter 8x8x2-inch baking pan. Melt butter in heavy small saucepan over low heat. Add sugar and cocoa powder. Stir over low heat until smooth. Stir in vanilla. Cool. Beat eggs in large bowl until frothy. Beat in sugar mixture and vanilla. Stir in flour, baking powder and salt. Spread into pan. Bake for 20 minutes or until firm to touch in center. Cool completely on rack. Sprinkle with chocolate chips. Makes 16 brownies.
Combine Miracle Whip and sugar in bowl. Add vinegar and mix well. Add cheddar cheese and bacon. Pour over broccoli and onions. Refrigerate overnight. Serves 4.
Mix lemonade and lemon concentrate in a pitcher. Add ice. Add bacardi limon. Add lime. Serve immediately.

In a blender or food processor, combine the red currant jelly and the port wine. Add the orange rind. Chill until ready to serve. In a large bowl, combine the cherries, red currants, blueberries, strawberries, raspberries, blackberries and mint. Fold in the chilled red currant mixture. Spoon into a 1-quart bowl or glass serving dish. Chill until ready to serve. Makes 10 to 12 servings.
In a blender combine the mangoes and orange juice. Blend until smooth. Add the lime juice and club soda. Mix well. Pour the mixture into 4 glasses. Garnish with a mango slice.

Combine first five ingredients in a large bowl. In a separate small microwave safe bowl combine sweetened condensed milk with 2 Tablespoons of water. Heat in microwave 1 1/2 minutes. Stir until smooth. Drizzle over dry ingredients. Stir well. Store in an airtight container. Makes 24 1/2 cup servings.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees. Whisk together flour, baking powder, sugar and salt in a large bowl. Add beer until batter reaches thick consistency. Stir in eggs. Add remaining ingredients. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Drop batter by 1/4 cupfuls into oil. Fry puppies until golden brown, about 3 minutes per side. Drain on paper towels. Serve warm with honey-mustard dip.

Slice challah in half horizontally and spread with butter on both sides. Spread one side with brie and top with basil and tomatoes. Cover with other half of bread and grill until golden brown. Serve with red wine if desired.

In a small bowl combine oil, vinegar, lemon juice and rosemary. Marinate lamb for at least 2 hours or up to 24. Grill or broil chops until desired doneness. Serve with extra marinade. Serve with your favorite pasta salad. Makes 6 servings.

Bring chicken broth to a boil in a medium saucepan. Add zucchini and return to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer until tender but still firm. Drain zucchini and set aside. In a skillet heat butter and garlic until butter begins to brown. Add zucchini and cook until heated through. Add lime juice and black pepper. Stir in dried oregano. Top with parsley. Serve warm. Serves 4. Serve with grilled chicken breasts and rice.

In a small bowl stir together all the dip ingredients until well combined. Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 2 hours to let flavors blend. Serve with pretzels or chips of your choice. Makes about 2 cups dip.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Cut each pear in half through the stem end to within 1/4-inch of the blossom end. Remove the stem, reserving 1/4 inch of the stem end for reattaching the pears later on. Cut out the core but leave about 1/4 inch of the core for stabilizing the pears in the baking dish. Cut each half into four wedges. Wrap each wedge with one piece of bacon (overlapping the ends) and secure the ends with toothpicks. Place the pears in a baking dish (a 13 x 9 inch glass baking dish works well) so that the pear wedges are standing upright and the toothpicks are on the bottom. Bake the pears for 1 hour or until they are fork tender but not falling apart (the bacon will get crispy during baking). Remove the pears from the oven and transfer them to a plate to cool. While the pears are cooling, mix together the salad greens and pecans in a large salad

Preheat oven to 350 F. Butter a 9 x 13 glass baking dish. Crush bread into breadcrumbs. Melt butter. Add crumbs and stir until well coated. Press into prepared baking dish. Top with cheeses and bacon. In a large bowl beat eggs. Add milk and spices and beat until well blended. Pour over bread mixture. Cover and refrigerate overnight. Bake for 60 minutes or until lightly browned.

Melt the butter in a small saucepan and add the lemon rind. Peel and slice the scallops. Add the scallops to the saucepan and saut until they are cooked through. Remove the scallops and set aside. Heat the same saucepan over a high heat and add the green peppercorn. Squeeze in the lemon juice. Stir in the fish fillets and continue to cook until the fish is cooked through. Season with salt and black pepper. Serve with the scallops.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Sift together flour, baking soda and salt in a small bowl. Set aside. In a large bowl, combine granulated sugar and brown sugar. Add butter and mix until smooth. Add egg yolks one at a time. Mix in vanilla extract. Stir in flour mixture. Add chocolate chips. Drop dough onto an ungreased baking sheet. Bake for 12 minutes or until edges are golden brown. Cool completely on a wire rack.

Place the prepared graham cracker crust in a pie plate and bake as directed on the box. Cream the cream cheese and sugar in an electric mixer. Add the frozen dessert topping and mix until combined. Add the cherry pie filling. Pour filling into the pie crust. Refrigerate until firm. Serve with whipped cream.

Cook rice according to package directions until done but still slightly firm. Add lemon juice, mix well, spread on a baking sheet and cool. In a small bowl combine butter, bouillon powder, garlic powder and onion powder. Sprinkle mixture over rice and toss gently until coated. Spread rice on baking sheet and cool completely. In a small bowl combine orzo pasta with warm water until soft. Drain orzo and spread on baking sheet. Cool completely. Stir orzo into rice mixture. Serve warm or at room temperature. Makes 6 servings.

In a medium bowl combine cabbage, carrots, onion & mayonnaise. In a small bowl whisk together vinegar, mustard, sugar & pepper. Pour over cabbage mixture & toss to coat. Let stand at least 1 hour before serving. Serve chilled.

Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).Wash sweet potatoes wellpat dry with paper towels. Cut into 1/4 inch thick slices. In a small bowl stir together the brown sugar and the low sodium soy sauce until the brown sugar has dissolved. Arrange the potato slices on a baking sheetdrizzle with the soy glaze. Bake for 10 minutes. Remove from the ovenstir the glaze. Return to the ovenbake for 10 minutes more. Remove from the ovenstir the glazesprinkle with the sesame oil and the garlic clovestoss to coat the potatoes. Return to the ovenbake for 5 minutes more.Remove from the ovensprinkle with the sesame seeds. Serve immediately with the nori strips as garnish.

Heat oil in a large saute pan over medium heat. Add tomatoes and saute until slightly browned and softened. Add clams and white wine. Cover and cook until clams open. Uncover and add the garlic. Add lemon juice and parsley. Serve with french bread. Serve with french bread.

Mix flour, garlic salt, celery salt, paprika and pepper in shallow dish. Dip each piece of chicken in flour mixture, turning to coat completely. Heat oil in deep-fat fryer or large skillet to 350 degrees f (175 degrees c). Fry chicken in hot oil about 10 minutes or until crisp and juices run clear. Drain on paper towels. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Combine the pears and raisins in a large bowl. Combine the maple syrup, butter, vanilla extract, and cinnamon in a small bowl. Add the cinnamon mixture to the fruit. Spray a 9x13 inch baking dish with cooking spray. Pour the fruit into the dish. Bake for 30 minutes. Serve warm.
In a large pot, combine the carrots, garlic, vegetable stock, thyme, and salt and pepper. Bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce the heat to medium-low and simmer 20 minutes. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Crumble the biscuits. Add the cream cheese, sugar and egg and stir until blended. Place in greased 13x9-inch baking dish. Bake for 30 minutes. Remove from oven. Sprinkle with cinnamon. Bake an additional 10 minutes. Cool slightly. Cut into 24 wedges. Serve warm.

Spray both sides of the foil with olive oil. Place onion and red potatoes on aluminum foil. Season with taco seasoning. Fold foil to create a packet. Bake at 350 degrees for 1 hour. Open packet to allow steam to escape. Return to oven for 30-45 minutes or until potatoes are tender. Sprinkle with cheese and return to oven for 5 minutes. Serve with taco shells or taco salad. May also serve with lettuce and tomatoes. Serves 8 as side dish.
Heat oatmeal with milk according to package directions. When cooked, add cinnamon and banana. Top with cereal before serving.

Heat olive oil in a large saucepan over medium-high heat. Add onion and cook for about 5 minutes or until onion is soft. Add ground turkey and cook for about 5 minutes or until turkey is browned and cooked through. Add cumin seed and cook for about 1 minute or until cumin seeds have lost their raw flavor. Stir in tomatoes, beans and chili powder. Add sazon goya and black pepper. Lower heat and simmer for about 20 minutes. Serve with tortilla chips. Makes about 6 servings.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Grease two baking dishes with butter or margarine. Peel potatoes and slice them into 1/4-inch thick slices. Add to baking dishes. In a small bowl, combine sour cream, milk, chives, salt and pepper. Pour over potatoes, spreading evenly. Sprinkle cheese over potatoes. Bake 15 to 20 minutes or until potatoes are just tender. Remove from oven. Sprinkle with corn flakes. Return to oven and bake 3 to 4 minutes or until cheese is melted and flakes are golden brown.

Soak lentils in cold water overnight or for 4 hours. Drain and rinse. Add bay leaves and cover with fresh cold water. Simmer over low heat for 20 to 25 minutes. Drain and rinse. Place lentils and orange juice in food processor. Add oil and onions. Process until smooth. Season with salt and pepper. Transfer to large bowl. Add orange segments. Stir gently until well combined. Serve at room temperature or chilled. Garnish with parsley. Serves 6.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).Line a 9x13 inch baking pan with foil, allowing excess to hang over edges of pan. Grease the foil.Mix flour, baking powder and salt in a medium bowl. Beat butter in a large bowl until smooth. Add sugar and beat until smooth. Beat in eggs and vanilla. Beat in flour mixture just until combined. Spread into prepared pan.Bake in preheated oven for 25 minutes.Remove from oven. Sprinkle with walnuts and chocolate chips. Drizzle with peanut butter.Return to oven and bake for 10 more minutes.Allow to cool in pan on a wire rack. Lift bars from pan using the foil edges.Cut into 24 bars. Store in the refrigerator.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Lightly grease an 8x8 inch baking pan. Spray tortillas with vegetable oil. Top each tortilla with 1/2 cup shredded cheese. Fold in half and place in prepared baking pan. Top each tortilla with 1/4 cup of onion. Pour enchilada sauce over the top of the tortillas. Cover with foil and bake for 30 minutes. Remove foil and sprinkle with chili without beans. Bake uncovered for 10 to 15 minutes longer. Serve with sour cream.

Combine hamburger, soup mix, onions, potatoes, carrots in a large bowl. Pour onto a large piece of heavy duty aluminum foil. Drizzle with olive oil. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Fold foil to form a tight packet and seal edges. Place on grill over medium heat and cook for 45 minutes or until potatoes are tender and meat is no longer pink. Serve immediately.

Melt butter in 10-inch nonstick ovenproof skillet over medium-high heatsauté bacon until crisptransfer to paper towel-lined platecrumble baconset aside. In same pansauté green onions, mushrooms, and garlic until tenderset asidein same panwhisk together eggs, light cream, seasoning salt, and white pepperadd reserved vegetablesmix wellpour mixture into pansprinkle evenly with bacon crumbles and cheesebake uncovered at 350 degrees F for 20 minutessprinkle with reserved green onion topsserve immediately.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Grease an 8x8 inch baking pan. Combine margarine and sugar in a large mixing bowl. Beat until smooth. Add eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition. Stir in the cocoa and flour. Stir in chocolate chips. Pour into prepared pan. Bake for 20 minutes in the preheated oven. Let cool. Cut into squares. Makes 16 squares.

Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Cook the pasta in the boiling water, stirring occasionally, until tender but still firm to the bite, about 10 minutes. Drain the pasta well and set aside. Meanwhile, in a large saucepan of boiling salted water, cook the green beans for 1 minute. Drain and set aside. Heat the oven to 400 degrees F. Combine the potatoes, butter and 1 tablespoon of salt in a bowl. Mash with a fork until smooth. Add the potato mixture to the pasta. Toss to coat well. Transfer the mixture to a baking dish. Pour the pesto sauce evenly over the pasta. Bake for 25 to 30 minutes, or until the top is browned and bubbly. Serve immediately.

Boil water in a large saucepan. Add the macaroni. Cook for 7-8 minutes or until tender. Drain the macaroni in a collander. In a medium bowl combine the egg and flour. Add to the macaroni and mix thoroughly. In a large bowl combine the milk and cheese. Add the macaroni mixture. Mix well. Pour the macaroni mixture into a 9-inch pie pan. Bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for 45 minutes. Cool before cutting. Serve warm.

In a large pot heat the oil. Add the onions and saute until soft. Add the ground beef and continue cooking until brown. Add the carrots, potatoes, tomato paste, beef bouillon and water. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium low. Simmer for 1 to 2 hours. Add corn when ready to serve. Makes 6 servings. Serve with bread.

Soak beans overnight. Drain and rinse well. Cover with fresh water and bring to a boil. Simmer until tender about 1 hour or longer depending upon the age of the beans. Meanwhile prepare rice according to package directions adding TVP during last minute of cooking time. Drain and rinse beans well. In a large Dutch oven add beans and chicken stock. Bring to a boil then reduce heat and simmer for about 1 hour or until beans are tender. Add rice and TVP and simmer until heated through. Season with chili powder cumin and sea salt Serve hot in bowls with shredded cheese and sour cream if desired

Bring 4 quarts water to a boil over high heat in a large pot. Add spaghetti and cook until tender, about 10 minutes. Drain spaghetti and set aside. Meanwhile, heat olive oil over medium heat in a large skillet. Add onion and saut for 1 minute or until tender. Stir in bacon and garlic and cook for about 1 minute or until bacon is browned and crispy. Add reserved spaghetti and peas and toss to combine. Stir in ricotta cheese and light cream and season to taste with pepper and salt. Sprinkle top of spaghetti with parsley and parmesan cheese.

In a large Dutch oven or pot over medium-high heat, add enough oil to lightly cover the bottom of the pan and warm for 2 minutes. Add the chicken thighs in a single layer so that they are not touching each other in the pan. Brown the thighs on both sides for a couple of minutes each, then remove the thighs to a plate lined with paper towels to drain while you prepare the rest of the recipe. Add the sliced onions to the Dutch oven and stir around with a spoon so that they are mixed into the oil and are coated with a light layer of it. Cook the onions over medium heat for 5 to 6 minutes or until they are translucent and beginning to brown slightly around the edges. Add the parsnips to the pan and stir to combine. Pour in the vegetable broth and bring to a simmer. Add the mustard, honey, thyme, and parsley to the Dutch oven along with the browned thighs. Stir to combine the flavors together and bring to a simmer again. Reduce the heat to medium low and simmer for 20

In a large mixing bowl combine granulated sugar, butter and milk. Cook over medium heat stirring constantly until mixture comes to a boil. Boil for 1 minute. Remove from heat. Stir in vanilla and cocoa. Stir in oats. Drop by rounded teaspoon onto ungreased cookie sheets. Bake at 375 degrees F for 5-7 minutes. Cool for 1 minute. Remove from cookie sheets and cool completely on wire racks. Makes 36 cookies.

Shake light rum with apricot brandy and triple sec in a cocktail shaker with ice cubes. Strain into glass and top with orange juice and pineapple juice. Drizzle with grenadine. Garnish with orange slice and pineapple wedge.

Slice carrots in half lengthwise. Place in a saucepan and cover with butter. Stir until butter is melted and carrots are coated. Add brown sugar and stir. Add cider and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 10 minutes. Add vegetable stock and dijon mustard. Add fresh parsley and season to taste. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C). In a large pot of boiling water, cook pasta until al dente, about 8 minutes.Drain and return to pot. In a large skillet, heat 2 tablespoons of the olive oil over medium heat. Add the onions, mushrooms, and garlicsaute until onions are translucent, about 5 minutes. Add the roasted red peppers, pesto, pasta, 1/2 of the parmesan cheese, 1/4 teaspoon of the onion powder, and 1/4 teaspoon of the peppertoss to coat. Sprinkle with remaining cheese and parmesan cheese. Roast until cheese is melted, about 10 minutes. Serve immediately.

In a medium bowl, combine the sausage with the beefadd the oregano, garlic powder and Worcestershire sauce. Form into 28 small meatballs. Place 3 meatballs on each round. Bake 15-20 minutes or until meatballs are done. Serve warm.

Cut the eggplant into 1/4 inch slices. Place on a baking tray and drizzle with olive oil. Roast for 10-15 minutes or until tender. In a small skillet saute onion and garlic in the olive oil. Add the roasted peppers, diced tomatoes and parsley and simmer for a few minutes. Assemble the sandwiches by placing the eggplant on the bottom half of the bread. Top with the roasted pepper and onion mixture. Sprinkle with cheese and cover with the top of the bread.
Place chicken into a food processor or blender. Add cheese, mustard, lemon juice and nuts. Process or blend well. Shape into balls. Bake at 350f for 15 minutes. Serve with toothpicks.

Mix together the beef with the seasoning mix. Add the water and mix well. Heat the refried beans in a saucepan. Scoop about 2 tablespoons of the beef mixture onto the bottom of each tortilla. Top with the beans and sprinkle with some of the cheese. Fold the sides of the tortilla up and roll the burrito tightly. Brown the burritos in a skillet over medium heat in a little bit of vegetable oil. Serve with taco sauce and onions.

In a large mixing bowl combine the carrots, onions and mayonnaise. Add water and horseradish and stir until evenly distributed. Set aside. In a small bowl combine the breadcrumbs and melted butter. Stir until crumbs are moistened. Sprinkle half of the crumb mixture over the carrot mixture and stir until evenly distributed. Spoon into a lightly greased baking dish. Sprinkle with the remaining crumbs and top with the cheese. Bake at 425 for 20 minutes or until golden brown.

In a large mixing bowl combine the butter, cheese and flour. Stir in Rice Krispies until well mixed. Place on wax paper and roll into a 10 inch log shape. Wrap in plastic wrap and freeze for 4 hours or until firm. Slice into 1/4 inch pieces and place on wax paper until ready to bake. Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Place cookies on ungreased cookie sheet and bake for 10 minutes or until slightly browned. Cool on wire rack. Makes about 100 cookies.

Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Add pasta and cook 10-12 minutes or until al dente. Drain and cool. Meanwhile heat the oil in a small skillet over medium heat. Add the garlic and cook 1 minute. Add the basil and cook 1 minute longer. Remove from the heat. Combine the pasta and basil mixture in a large bowl. Stir in the avocado and tomatoes. Add the basil mixture. Season with the salt and pepper. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350f. Lightly coat a shallow baking dish with cooking spray. Place fish fillets in dish. Heat 1 tablespoon butter in a small skillet over medium heat. Add dijon mustard and worcestershire sauce. Cook and stir until mixture is smooth. Spoon over fish. Drizzle with 1 tablespoon lemon juice. Combine breadcrumbs and parsley in a small bowl. Sprinkle over fish. Bake for 10 minutes. Remove from oven. Garnish with lemon wedge. Makes 6 servings.

Boil carrots 8 minutes. Drain and return to pot. Add lemon juice, orange juice, zest of lemon and orange, dark corn syrup, and cornstarch. Cook, stirring constantly, until thickened. Serve hot or cold.

Wash potatoes. Put in pot with cold water to cover. Bring to boil. Reduce heat to medium-low and cook for 15 minutes or until soft. Drain and mash together with butter, bay leaves and seasonings. Add frozen peas and heat through. Serve immediately.

In a saucepan saute the sausage and remove from heat. Drain all grease from the pan and place back on low heat. In a small bowl mix the flour and pepper. Slowly add the flour mixture to the sausage and saute for 5 minutes. In a medium bowl beat the eggs well. In a small bowl combine the sour cream and the milk. Stir in the egg mixture and sausage to the sour cream and milk mixture. Heat the mixture in a saucepan over low heat until thickened. Serve over omelets or pancakes. Makes 1 1/2 cups.

Cream butter, add in sugar and beat until light and fluffy. Add in egg and vanilla, beat on low until combined. In a separate bowl, sift flour and salt into the butter mixture and beat on low to combine. Chill dough for 30 minutes. Roll dough into 1" balls and place 2" apart on parchment paper-lined cookie sheets. Bake in a 350 degree F oven for 7-9 minutes or until edges are golden. Remove from oven and let cool on cookie sheets for 2 minutes. Transfer to wire racks to cool completely. Melt chocolate according to package directions and dip bottoms of cookies into melted chocolate and place on waxed paper to set. Let set for 10 minutes before decorating with sprinkles or nuts.

Place tea bag in each cup and add the whole cloves and cinnamon sticks. Pour the boiling water over the tea and allow to steep for 4 minutes. Remove the tea bag and cinnamon sticks. Add the Splenda and Sweet’N Low. Add the water and juices and stir well. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees F. Rinse potatoes under cold water. Peel and cut in half lengthwise. Place potatoes in a medium bowl and add butter and cajun seasoning. Stir well to evenly coat potatoes with butter and seasonings. Place potatoes in a single layer in a shallow baking pan and bake for approximately 45 minutes or until potatoes are crisp and browned. Sprinkle with coarse salt before serving.

Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Cook asparagus for 2 minutes. Remove from heat and drain. In a large skillet, fry bacon over medium heat until crisp. Remove bacon from skillet and drain on paper towels. Drain bacon grease from skillet. Add asparagus back to skillet and cook for 1 minute. Add sugar and worcestershire sauce. Cook for 1 minute. Remove from heat. Wrap 2 asparagus spears in each bacon slice. Place bundles on a baking sheet. Melt butter and drizzle over bundles. Bake at 350 for 15 minutes.

Place sugar and light corn syrup in a saucepan and heat until sugar is dissolved. Remove from heat and let cool 5 minutes. Beat in milk and unsweetened chocolate until smooth. Add vanilla. Beat in butter 1 Tbsp. at a time until smooth and fluffy. If frosting is too stiff, add more milk 1 tsp. at a time. Makes 1 cup.

In a saucepan bring 1 cup of water to a boil. Place spinach in a colander and pour the boiling water over the spinach. Let sit for 15 minutes or until tender. Drain the spinach and squeeze out all the excess water. Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Saute the garlic until golden, about 2 minutes. Stir in the drained spinach and raisins and cook until heated through about 5 minutes. Season with the salt and pepper and serve immediately.
Combine coffee with milk in blender. Add granulated sugar. Blend. Add ice cream, blend. Add fat free chocolate syrup. Blend. Pour into glasses.

Preheat the oven to 400 degrees fahrenheit. Cut the potatoes in half lengthwise. Place the potato halves on a baking sheet skin side down, brush the potatoes with the olive oil and sprinkle with the salt and pepper. Bake the potatoes until they are tender, about 45 minutes. Meanwhile, cut the ham into slices. In a saucepan over medium heat combine the cream of asparagus soup, milk, ham broth, sour cream, asparagus tips, asparagus spears, dill weed and pepper. Bring the mixture to a simmer and cook until the mixture is slightly thickened about 8 to 10 minutes. Remove the mixture from the heat and stir in the ham slices. Spoon the ham mixture onto the potato halves. Sprinkle with the cheddar cheese and bake until the cheese is melted, about 5 to 10 minutes. Makes 8 servings.

Preheat oven to 375F. In a bowl, mix together dry ingredients except the jalapenos. Add milk, egg, butter and bacon bits. Stir just to moisten the dry ingredients. Add jalapenos and gently stir to combine. Spoon the batter into muffin tins that have been coated with cooking spray or lined with paper muffin cups. Bake for about 18 minutes or until tops spring back when touched lightly. Remove from oven and cool for 10 minutes before removing from pan. Serve warm or cold.

Slice the eggplant into 1/2 inch thick slices. Dip the slices into the egg mixture then into the breadcrumbs. Heat the oil. Add the eggplant slices one at a time and fry until golden brown. Remove the eggplant to paper towels to drain. Serve immediately.

Drain sun-dried tomatoes. Chop finely. In a medium saucepan over medium heat, add tomatoes, garlic, oil, water, sugar and basil. Bring to a boilreduce heat. Simmer for 5-10 minutes. Add pastacook according to package instructions. Stir in chopped tomatoes, olives and feta cheese. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). In a small bowl, combine orange marmalade, soy sauce, and garlic. Rub half of the marmalade mixture over one side of each salmon fillet, then place the fillets in a baking dish. Bake uncovered for 10 minutes in the preheated oven. Turn the fillets over, spoon the remaining marmalade mixture evenly onto them, and continue baking until the salmon is opaque throughout (about 5 more minutes). Serve hot with lemon wedges.

In a large skillet, heat 2 tablespoons butter and 2 tablespoons oil over medium heat until sizzling. Add bacon and cook until crisp. Remove bacon from pan. Add lamb and brown on all sides. Sprinkle with flour. Add wine and vinegar. Add broth and simmer for 15 minutes. Add remaining 2 tablespoons butter and parsley. Makes 8 servings.

Cut acorn squash in half lengthwise. Scoop out seeds and discard. Place cut side down in a shallow baking pan. Bake at 375 degrees 20 to 25 minutes or until squash is tender. Meanwhile place apple in a saucepan and add apple juice. Cook and stir until tender. Combine maple syrup, cinnamon and nutmeg. Coat pork chops with this mixture. Broil 3 minutes on each side or until desired doneness. Serve with squash and apple.

Heat butter in nonstick skillet over medium heat. Add ham and red bell peppercook 3 minutes. Add eggs and heavy cream. Reduce heat to low and cook until almost set. Sprinkle with seasonings and cheese. Covercook 2 minutes. Serve with toast. Makes 2 servings.

In a large bowl combine porridge oats, muscovado sugar and butter. Place a baking sheet in the oven. Melt butter. Add golden syrup and honey. Add to oats mixture. Stir to combine. Spoon into a baking sheet. Bake for 30 minutes. Remove from oven and cool for 5 minutes. Serve warm with honey.

Prepare cookie mix as directed on package for drop or bar cookies. Drop by rounded teaspoonfuls 2 inches apart onto ungreased cookie sheets. Bake 11-13 minutes or until edges are light golden brown. Cool 1 minute. Remove from cookie sheetscool completely on wire racks. Beat cream cheese and milk with electric mixer until blended. Gradually beat in powdered sugar until smooth. Spread over cooled bars. Top with white chocolate chips and raspberry jam. Store tightly covered in refrigerator. Yield: 24 servings.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease and flour two loaf pans. In a large bowl, combine flour, sugar, baking powder and salt. In a separate bowl, combine orange peel and juice. Beat together the butter and eggs. Stir in the orange juice mixture. Stir into the flour mixture just until combined. Stir in the cranberries. Spoon batter into the prepared pans. Bake for 1 hour in the preheated oven, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean. Cool in pans for 10 minutes before removing to wire racks to cool completely.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease and flour a 9x13 inch pan. In a medium bowl, combine crushed chocolate chip cookies and pecan pieces. In a separate bowl, combine yellow cake mix and kahlua. In a third bowl combine half-and-half and egg (or egg substitute) until well blended. Pour crushed candy bar mixture into bottom of prepared pan. Pour cake mixture over crushed candy bars. Bake 30 to 35 minutes or until cake tests done. Cool 5 minutes in pan. Drizzle with Kahlua and top with coconut. Cut into squares and serve.
Wash the asparagus. Place in a baking dish. Drizzle with olive oil. Roast in the oven at 375 degrees for approximately 20 minutes. Sprinkle with toasted almonds. Season with salt & pepper.
Cook rice as directed on box. Combine all ingredients. Cook in 1 1/2-quart casserole in 350 degree F oven for 40 minutes. Serve warm or cold.

Combine breadcrumbs, flour, paprika and margarine in small bowl. Set aside. In medium bowl combine salt and pepper and poultry seasoning. In another bowl beat eggs. Dip chicken pieces in beaten eggs then roll in breadcrumb mixture and place in prepared baking dish. Bake uncovered at 425 for about 45 minutes until chicken is brown. Serve with your favorite vegetables.

Place the pork tenderloin in a 9x13-inch pan. In a skillet over medium heat melt the butter and add the onion. Cook the onion for about 2 to 3 minutes or until soft. Add the cranberries and cook for 2 minutes more. Add the porto wine and stir to combine. Bring the mixture to a boil and add the honey. Reduce the heat and simmer for 2 to 3 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in the rosemary. Pour the sauce over the pork tenderloin and cover with foil. Bake in a 350 degree oven for 35 minutes. Remove the foil and continue to cook for 5 to 10 minutes more or until the pork tenderloin reaches an internal temperature of 155 degrees F. Remove from oven and let stand for 5 minutes before serving.

In a large saucepan combine chicken with enough water to cover the chicken completely and the rice blend. Bring to a boil and reduce heat. Cover and simmer gently for 25-35 minutes or until rice is tender and chicken is cooked through (check chicken with a fork). Stir occasionally to prevent rice from sticking to the pan. Remove chicken and set aside. Add the vegetables and butter and cook, uncovered, over medium heat for about 5 minutes or until vegetables are heated through. Add the chicken and pour the mixture into a lightly greased 2 quart casserole dish. Cover and bake at 350 degrees Fahrenheit for about 30 minutes or until bubbly and heated through. Serve hot. Serves 4.

To make salad dressing combine maple syrup, apple cider vinegar, mustard and olive oil. Season with salt and pepper. Place salad greens in a bowl. Top with apples, pecans, blue cheese and dried cherries. Toss with dressing before serving.
Mash together butter with garlic. Add all other herbs. Mix well. Taste. Add more seasoning if desired. Refrigerate.

Cook the pasta in a large pot of boiling water according to package instructions. Drain the pasta and set aside. Melt the butter in a large pot over medium heat. Add the cream and seasonings and bring to a boil. Lower the heat and cook for 3 minutes. Stir in the pasta and cheeses. Cook for an additional 3-5 minutes until the cheeses have melted and the pasta is coated with the sauce. Serve immediately.

Place 2 slices of bacon in the bottom of a crockpot. Put in 1 pound of beef stew meat cut into cubes. Add 1 can of tomato sauce 1 can of tomato soup 4 diced carrots 3 diced potatoes. Add 1 package of onion soup mix. Mix all together in the crockpot. Add 2 cups of water cover with lid. Cook on high for 4 hours cook on low for 6-8 hours. Serve with corn bread or biscuits. Makes 6-8 servings.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. Lay out a slice of ham for each chicken breast. Layer a few pieces of cheese over ham. Place chicken breast over cheese. Fold sides over and roll up. Secure roll with toothpicks. Place in casserole dish. Cover with spaghetti sauce. Bake for 30 minutes. Sprinkle with mozzarella cheese. Bake for 5 more minutes. Uncover and bake for another 5 minutes or until browned. Makes 6 servings.
In a large bowl combine all the ingredients. Add salad dressing and mix well. Divide the salad mixture between two lettuce leaves. Garnish each salad with a hardboiled egg.

Heat oil in large skillet over medium heat. Add onion, celery and bell peppercook 2 minutes or until softened. Add ground turkeycook until browned. Add barley and next 5 ingredients (through tomato paste). Bring to a boil. Reduce heatcover and simmer 20 minutes or until barley is tender. Stir in basil. Remove from heatstir in vinegar. Serve immediately.

In a food processor combine the chickpeas, garlic, extra virgin olive oil, sesame oil, lemon juice, turmeric, chili powder, cilantro, paprika, salt and process until smooth. Transfer to a serving bowl. Serve with pita bread, vegetable sticks or raw vegetables for dipping.

In a small bowl combine garlic through paprika. Rub on both sides of chicken. In a shallow baking pan combine remaining ingredients. Place chicken in pan. Bake for 45 minutes. Turn and bake for an additional 20 minutes. Serve with crusty bread.

Wash watermelon and cut into bite-sized pieces. Add strawberries and sugar to bowl. Chop the strawberries. Add the watermelon. Chop the lemon into wedges and add to bowl. Place bowl in refrigerator. Prepare frozen lemonade according to package directions. Add lemonade to bowl and stir until all ingredients are thoroughly combined. Serve in glasses over ice cubes. Garnish with lemon wedges. Makes 4 servings.

Preheat the oven to 375 F. In a small bowl mix the cereal with the all-purpose flour and seasonings. Set aside. In a large bowl combine the chicken breasts with the cereal mixture and melted butter. Season with salt and pepper. Spray a baking dish with nonstick cooking spray and place the chicken in the dish. Bake until browned and cooked through, about 1 hour.

Heat oil in skillet over medium heat. Add onions and pepper and saute until tender. Add eggs and saute until set. Stir in picante sauce. In a large bowl combine tortillas with egg mixture. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake in a 350F degree oven for 30 minutes. Serve with sour cream.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease and flour 8x4 inch square baking pan. In a large bowl, cream together the butter and white sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in almond extract. Add eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition. In another bowl, whisk together the flour and baking powderstir into the creamed mixture alternately with sour cream. Pour into prepared baking dish. Bake for 40 minutes in the preheated oven, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean. Remove from oven and cool in the baking dish for 5 minutes before removing to a wire rack to cool completely. To make the icing, mix powdered sugar and almond extract together in a bowl. Pour icing over the top of the cake while it is still warm to let it soak inallow cake to cool completely before serving. Garnish with red glazed cherries. Serves 10 to 12.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In large mixing bowl combine tater tots and ground turkey. Add mushroom soup and milk. Mix well. Spray casserole dish with non stick spray. Place half of mixture into dish and top with green beans. Top green beans with remaining mixture. Cover and bake uncovered for 45 minutes or until bubbly. Sprinkle with cheese and bake an additional 5 minutes. Serve immediately.

Combine ground beef with barbecue sauce, teriyaki sauce, chipotle chile in adobo and salt in a bowl until thoroughly combined. Cover and refrigerate for at least 3 hours or overnight. Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Place the hoagie rolls on a baking sheet and place a piece of foil on top of the rolls. Bake for 10 minutes or until heated through. To assemble sandwiches, spread the rolls with the barbecue beef mixture. Top with lettuce, tomatoes and onions. Serve immediately. Makes 6 sandwiches.

In a bowl cream together the butter and sugarbeat in the egg. Add the extract and almonds and mix well. In another bowl combine the flour and baking sodastir into the creamed mixturemix well. Form the dough into small balls about 1 inch in diameterplace on an ungreased baking sheet about 2 inches apart. Bake at 400 degrees F (200 degrees C) for 7 minutes. Dissolve the egg white in the water and brush over the cookies while they are still hotsprinkle the cookies with the almonds and let stand until they are dry. Store in an airtight container.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Butter a 9 by 13 inch baking dish. Layer half the bread in the baking dish. Sprinkle with half the tomatoes and half the cheese. Repeat layering. In a medium bowl, whisk together the remaining milk and eggs. Season the mixture with garlic salt and pepper. Pour the egg mixture over the bread and cheese. Cover the dish with foil and bake for 40 minutes. Remove the foil and bake for 10 minutes more. Sprinkle the basil on top and serve.
In a large bowl combine rice mix, artichoke hearts, tomatoes, bell pepper, parsley, capers, lemon rind and juice. Add sugar, salt and pepper, toss well. Cover and chill before serving. Serves 6.
Combine all ingredients in small bowl. Store in airtight container for up to 3 months. Makes 2 cups.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper. In a medium bowl, whisk together the water and egg white. Add the sugar, salt and cinnamon and stir to combine. Place the pecans in a single layer on the prepared baking sheet. Pour the egg white mixture over the pecans. Bake in preheated oven for 1 hour. Remove from heat and allow to cool for 10 minutes. Stir and separate pecans. Store in an airtight container. Makes about 6 cups.

In sauce pan combine crushed pineapple and juice, sugar and zest. Bring to a boil over medium heat. Stirring constantly, add gelatin and cook until gelatin is dissolved. Remove from heat and stir in vanilla. In large bowl combine eggs and cheese with pineapple mixture. Pour into pie shell. Bake at 350 degrees for 40-45 minutes. Let cool and chill in refrigerator. Top with fresh strawberries and/or whipped cream before serving.

Combine cream cheese, imitation crabmeat, garlic powder and pepper. Divide evenly into 4 portions. Wrap each portion in a wonton wrapper. Heat the butter in a skillet over medium heat. Add the wontons. Fry for 1 minute on each side or until golden brown. Drain on paper towels. Serve with sweet and sour sauce for dipping.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Combine crumbs and butter. Press into bottom and up sides of 10-inch pie plate. Beat cream cheese until smooth. Add splenda and lime juice. Beat until smooth. Add eggs 1 at a time. Mix well after each egg. Pour into crust. Bake 50 to 60 minutes or until center is almost set. Cool and chill. Beat heavy cream until stiff peaks form. Add sugar and beat again. Spoon whipped cream over top of cheesecake. Store covered in refrigerator.

Pour the cooked wild rice into a large bowl. Add the fresh corn kernels. In another bowl whisk together the eggs, heavy cream, kosher salt, and cayenne pepper. Pour the egg mixture over the rice. Stir together well. Pour the rice mixture into a greased 9x13x2 inch baking dish. Bake at 350 degrees for 40 minutes or until golden. Cool for 20 minutes before serving.

Remove the tops and seeds from the peppers and set aside. Slice peppers in 1/4 inch thick rings. Heat olive oil in skillet over medium heat. Add garlic and sauté until garlic is golden brown. Add the rings. Saute until tender. Add pepper and sea salt to taste. Serve hot or cold. Makes 4 servings.

Toss cabbage, bell pepper, oil, cumin seed, celery seed, and 1/4 teaspoon salt in a large bowl. Sprinkle with 1 teaspoon chili powder, 1/2 teaspoon balsamic vinegar, and 1 tablespoon mayonnaisetoss again. Sprinkle with 1/4 teaspoon white sugar, 1/4 teaspoon salt, and 1 tablespoon mayonnaisetoss again. Transfer to a serving bowl or platter. Garnish with 1/4 cup peanuts and serve.
Combine sugar, dry mustard, salt and cider vinegar in a bowl. Slowly stir in oil until well blended. Stir in poppy seeds. Serve over fresh fruit salad. Makes 2 cups.

Preheat oven to 400F. Line a 9-inch pie pan with pie crust. In a saucepan over medium-high heat, combine sugar and cornstarch. Cook until thickened and bubbly. Stir in apple pie spice. Stir in peaches and spoon into pie crust. Dot with butter. Cover edge of crust with strips of pie crust. Bake in oven for about an hour or until crust is golden brown. Makes 8 servings.

Heat oven to 400f. Spread chilies in a single layer in a 9x13x2-inch baking pan. Bake chilies 5 minutes. Spread chicken in an even layer over chilies. Pour soup evenly over chicken and chilies. Combine cream cheese, cumin, and garlic in a bowlstir in cheese until melted. Spread mixture over chicken and chilies. Bake 5 minutes until mixture is lightly browned. Sprinkle with pepper. Serve with tortilla chips. Makes 8 servings.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Spray mini muffin pan with cooking spray. In a large bowl, combine ricotta and spinach. Season with cracked black pepper. Place a heaping tablespoon of ricotta mixture into the center of each wonton wrapper. Fold wrapper over and press edges together to seal. Place 1 wonton at a time into the muffin cups. Bake at 350 degrees F for 10 minutes or until puffed. Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese. Serve warm.
Season salmon with salt and pepper. Combine dressing and lemon juice. Coat salmon with dressing mixture. Sprinkle with paprika. Bake for 10 minutes at 350 degrees F. Serve with capers.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f (200 degrees c). Rinse chicken and pat dry with a paper towel. Rub both sides of chicken with olive oil. Place potato, red onion, tomato and garlic in the cavity of the chicken. Tuck in olives and lemon zest. Season with salt and pepper. Tie legs together with kitchen twine. Place chicken in a roasting pan and roast for one hour. Increase oven heat to 450 degrees f (230 degrees c). Continue roasting chicken for another half hour. Let the chicken rest for at least ten minutes before serving. Cut into quarters. Yields one serving.

Sauté bacon in a large skillet or dutch oven. Remove bacon from pan and set aside. Add onion and cook until soft. Add garlic and cook for 1-2 minutes. Add bacon to pan and stir. Add black beans and cumin. Stir well. Add hot sauce to taste. Serve with sour cream and fresh chopped cilantro. Serves 6.

Brown ground beef and drain. Stir in beans and seasonings. Place in pie shells and top with polenta and cheese. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes or until polenta is cooked through and browned. Serve with lettuce, tomato and avocado. Serves 4-6.

Peel and wash the potatoes. Cut into small cubes. In a large pot of boiling water cook the potatoes for about 20 to 25 minutes or until tender. Drain. Place in a bowl. Add butter, half-and-half and goat cheese. Mash with a potato masher. Season with fresh basil and garlic to taste. Serve with a salad. Serves 4.

Combine teriyaki sauce and olive oil. Drizzle steaks with mixture and refrigerate for about 1 hour. Place steaks on a rack on a baking sheet and roast for about 10 minutes or until desired doneness is reached. Sprinkle with cracked black pepper and serve with oysters or other shellfish.

In a saucepan combine the sugar, water, maple syrup, and butter. Stir until butter is melted and mixture is well blended. Bring to a boil over medium heat, stirring constantly. Remove from heatstir in the half-and-half cream and vanilla extract. Pour into a small plastic food baggy or pastry bag with a plain round tip. Store in the refrigerator until needed. Remove the frozen ice cream from the freezer 10 minutes before serving. Scoop into small dishes or glassesspoon the sauce on top of the ice cream. Garnish with walnuts. Serves 8.
In a medium bowl whisk together frozen lemonade concentrate, honey and poppy seeds. Add fruittoss to coat. Serve chilled. Serves 4.

Preheat oven to 180C. In a large bowl beat butter until light and fluffy. Add sugar and beat until creamy. Add eggs one at a time beating well after each addition. Add milk. Stir together flour and cocoa. Blend into butter mixture. Stir in chocolate chips. Roll into 1-inch balls. Place 2 inches apart on ungreased baking sheets. Bake for 10 to 12 minutes or until edges are light brown. Cool for 2 minutes before removing to wire racks. Makes about 5 dozen cookies.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).Wash potatoes thoroughly, then cut into 1/4-inch slices. In a large bowl, toss slices with vegetable oil until coated. Sprinkle evenly with Cajun seasoning and toss again to coat evenly. On baking sheet, arrange potatoes in a single layer. Bake for 10 minutes. Turn potatoes over and bake for an additional 15-20 minutes or until crisp and golden brown. Season with additional cajun seasoning and salt and pepper to taste.

Mix artichoke hearts with 1/2 cup parmesan cheese in medium bowl. Place chicken breasts between 2 sheets of plastic wrap. Pound with a meat mallet or rolling pin until 1/4 to 1/2 inch thick. Spoon artichoke mixture down the center of each breast. Fold sides over filling and roll up tightly. Place on a baking sheet. Drizzle with the remaining 2 tablespoons parmesan cheese. Bake at 375f for 30 minutes or until the juices run clear when center of chicken is cut with a knife. Serve immediately. Serves 4.
Place asparagus in a 13x9-inch baking dish. In a medium bowl combine remaining ingredients. Pour dressing over asparagus. Bake for 40 minutes. Stir occasionally. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 350. Grease an 18 x 13 x 1 baking pan or line with parchment paper. In a large bowl combine oats with pecans, walnuts, pumpkin seeds, sunflower seeds and raisins. Set aside. In a medium saucepan combine butter, honey, cinnamon and brown sugar. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Reduce heat to low. Cook 30 seconds or until mixture is slightly thickened. Remove from heat. Stir in vanilla extract. Pour cinnamon mixture over oat mixture. Mix well. Spread granola into prepared baking pan. Bake 30 minutes or until lightly toasted. Cool completely before stirring in dried cranberries. Store at room temperature for up to 2 weeks. Makes 6 servings.

In a microwave-safe bowl, cover edamame with water. Microwave 2 minutes. Drain, rinse with cold water. Drain again. Pat dry with paper towel. In a bowl, mix edamame with the lemon juice. Let stand 10 minutes. Add the cajun seasoning and cayenne. Mix well. Makes 4 servings.

Cut braunschweiger into thin slices. Mix with cream cheese and worcestershire sauce in food processor until smooth. Add onions, parsley and chivesprocess until combined. Refrigerate for at least one hour before serving with crackers or veggies.

Preheat oven to 375f. Place tilapia fillets in a lightly greased 13×9 pan. Brush with oil. Sprinkle with thyme and pepper. Bake for 12-15 minutes or until fish flakes easily with a fork. In a small skillet combine chicken broth, mushroom and pepper. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat. Simmer for 5 minutes or until mushroom is tender. Combine whipping cream and mustard. Stir into broth mixture. Pour over fish. Bake 5 minutes longer or until cream is heated through and fish is bubbly. Serves 6-8.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Cream together butter and sugar. Add in barbecue sauce, eggs and vanilla extract. Combine dry ingredients in a separate bowl and add to creamed mixture. Drop by teaspoon onto ungreased cookie sheets. Bake for 12-14 minutes or until lightly browned. Makes 25-30 cookies.

In a large saucepan heat 1/2 cup of champagne over medium heat. Add cornstarch and cook stirring constantly until thickened, about 2-3 minutes. Add cheeses and cook stirring constantly until melted about 2-3 minutes more. Remove from heat and stir in almond extract and ground nutmeg. Ladle fondue into a fondue pot. Serve with apple slices and french bread cubes or breadstick.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease an ovenproof frying pan or casserole dish with olive oil. In a bowl, mix together the tuna and the beans. Spread the mixture evenly in the baking pan. Bake for 30 minutes in the preheated oven, until the beans are tender. Sprinkle the spinach leaves over the top of the tuna mixture. In a bowl, beat the eggs with the oregano, salt and pepper. Pour the egg mixture evenly over the top of the tuna mixture. Bake for 30 minutes more in the preheated oven, or until the eggs are set. Sprinkle the cheese evenly over the top of the frittata. Bake for an additional minute, or until the cheese is melted. Serve immediately.

Preheat grill. Cut the top off each bread loaf. Place the bread loaves cut side down on the hot grill and brush the tops with the olive oil. Place the eggplant slices between the loaves. Season the eggplant slices with the salt and pepper. Grill the sandwiches for about 3 minutes or until the eggplant is soft. Remove the sandwiches from the grill and slice each bread loaf into 4 pieces. Arrange the pieces of bread around the sandwiches. Top the sandwiches with the slices of mozzarella and the fresh basil leaves. Serve immediately.

Combine cream cheese and sugar in a large bowl. Beat until creamy. Add eggs one at a time. Mix until smooth. Beat in frozen orange juice concentrate. Pour into pie crust. Bake 55-60 minutes or until filling is set in center. Cool completely. Drain mandarin oranges. Arrange them over pie. Combine light brown sugar with water until smooth. Pour over mandarin oranges. Chill. Serve with whipped topping.

Cook carrots in boiling water to cover in medium saucepan 5 min or until tender-crispdrain. Add pears, pineapple, water, lemon juice, cinnamon, nutmeg, and cloves to panbring to a boil. Stir in sugarcook until sugar is dissolvedremove from heat. Stir in pectin. Ladle into hot jarsseal. Makes about 6 (1/2-pint) jars.

Brown chicken and drain. Add kidney beans and tomato sauce. Bring to a boil. Add chili powder and cayenne. Mix well. Pour into a 13x9 casserole dish. Top with salsa and cheese. Bake at 350 for 15 minutes.

Preheat oven to 375. Grease or spray two cookie sheets. Combine butter, sugar and eggs. Beat until smooth. Stir in the flour, cornstarch and baking powder. Divide into two balls. Roll each ball into a ball about 1 1/2 inches wide. Place 1/2 teaspoon of jam in the center of each ball. Seal the jam inside the cookie by pinching the edges together. Bake at 375 for 15 minutes or until golden brown. Cool on wire racks. Makes 4 dozen.

Preheat the oven to 400f. Rinse the potatoes. Cut them into 1/2-inch cubes. Place the potato cubes on a large plate. Add the olive oil, sea salt, black pepper, garlic cloves and rosemary. Toss to coat. Spread the potatoes in an even layer on a large rimmed baking sheet. Roast for 1 hour. Stir the potatoes halfway through roasting. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Trim off and discard the stem end of the brussels sprouts. Slice in half lengthwise and then into 1/4 inch pieces. Place the brussels sprouts into a bowl and add 1 tablespoon sriracha sauce and the honey. Stir well. Add the lime juice and salt. Taste and add more sriracha if you like a spicy dish. Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the brussels sprouts and cook for 2-3 minutes until they have lightly browned. Transfer the pan fried brussels sprouts to a plate and add the remaining tablespoon of sriracha sauce. Toss well. Serve warm. Makes 4 side dishes.

Preheat the oven to 180 degrees C. Cream together the butter and icing sugar. Beat in the eggs, one at a time, then the kirsch. Sift the flour and anise seeds together. Stir into the creamed mixture. Turn the mixture out onto a lightly floured surface. Knead gently until the mixture comes together. Roll out to about 1 cm thick. Cut into shapes and place on baking trays. Bake for about 10 to 15 minutes.

Place the water in a small pot over medium heat. Bring to a boil. Add the sugar and stir until the sugar is dissolved. Add the cream of tartar and the salt. Reduce the heat and let simmer for 3 minutes. Remove from the heat. Let cool to room temperature before using.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit. Grease a 9×13″ baking pan with non-stick cooking spray. In a large bowl, combine flour, sugar, baking soda and salt. Set aside. In another large bowl, mash bananas and mix with egg, oil and vanilla until well combined. Add banana mixture to flour mixture and mix until just blended. Fold in chocolate chips. Spread batter into prepared baking pan. Bake for 35 to 40 minutes or until a wooden toothpick comes out clean when inserted into the center of the cake. Cool on a wire rack for 10 minutes before cutting and serving.

Mix soup mix with water. Pour half over the beef and place the remainder in a baking dish. Bake for 1 hour. Remove beef and cover with the sauce remaining in the baking dish. Bake an additional 30 minutes. Remove beef from the oven. Drain fat. Slice beef and pour remaining sauce over the beef. Serve. Serves 6.

Heat olive oil in a skillet. Add veal and butter. Brown both sides. Remove veal from skillet and set aside. Add tomato sauce. Sprinkle with oregano. Return veal to skillet. Cover and simmer over low heat for 15 minutes. Turn veal over once. Stir in white wine. Simmer 5 minutes longer. Top with parsley. Serve with spaghetti. Serves 4.

Melt margarine in a skillet. Add onions and saute until light brown. Add mushrooms and saute 3 minutes. Stir in flour and cook 1 minute. Add soymilk and cook 10 minutes. Add garlic powder and pepper. Stir in green beans and heat through. Pour into a casserole. Top with french-fried onions. Bake at 350 degrees F until heated through. Sprinkle with additional soymilk before serving if desired. Serves 4.

Heat oven to 400 degrees F. Lightly spray a shallow roasting pan with cooking spray. In a small bowl mix broccoli florets and garlic cloves. In another bowl mix teriyaki sauce and pepper to taste. Drizzle broccoli mixture with teriyaki sauce mixture and toss to coat evenly. Spread out broccoli mixture evenly in pan. Roast for 20 minutes or until broccoli is crisp-tender and lightly browned. Serve hot. Makes 6 servings.

In a medium saucepan heat the heavy cream over medium-low heat until just warm. Add the sugar and stir. Stir in the vanilla. Pour the mixture into the bowl of an electric mixer. Beat on medium speed until the cream forms stiff peaks. Set aside. In a medium saucepan bring the rice, marshmallows, pineapple and cherries to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer until the rice is tender and the marshmallows are melted. Remove from the heat and stir in the almonds. Fold in the cream mixture and pour into individual serving dishes. Cover and refrigerate until cold. Serve at once.

Heat oil in large skillet. Add onion, bell peppers, and mushrooms. Cook and stir over medium heat until tender. Add chicken stock and cook until almost evaporated. Stir in tomatoes and spinach. Bring to a boil. Remove from heat. Stir in cheese until melted. Spoon 1 1/2 cups chicken mixture onto each of 4 ungreased 1-quart casserole dishes. Top each with 1 cup pasta. Pour remaining chicken mixture over pasta. Bake uncovered at 350 degrees for 20 minutes.

Slice potatoes into 1/4-inch thick slices. Slice onions into 1/4-inch thick slices. Peel brussels sprouts. Cut off stem end and discard. Halve brussels sprouts. Toss potatoes and brussels sprouts together in a large bowl. In a large nonstick pan over medium heat, melt butter. Add potatoes and brussels sprouts. Add bay leaf. Cook for about 10 minutes or until potatoes are tender. Add stock. Cook for 5 minutes or until potatoes are tender. Add pepper. Cook for 2 minutes. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Top each serving with a sprig of parsley.

Prepare vegetables by washing and scrubbing them well. Dice the beets and the parsnips into bite-size pieces and place them in a bowl. Chop the carrots into bite-size pieces and add them to the bowl. Combine the vegetables with the brown sugar and olive oil. Place in a roasting pan and bake for approximately one hour or until the vegetables are softened and have caramelized. After removing the vegetables from the pan and placing them in a bowl, drizzle the cider vinegar over the top and toss well. Serve warm or at room temperature.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. Combine soy sauce, honey and garlic in small bowl. Place chicken in shallow dish or plastic bag. Add soy sauce mixture. Marinate at least 1 hour or up to 1 day. Heat oil in skillet over medium heat. Add chicken. Brown on both sides. Transfer chicken to baking dish. Bake 30 minutes or until no longer pink in center. Meanwhile combine green onion, sesame oil and pepper in small bowl. Drizzle chicken with dressing. Garnish with green onion. Serve with rice.

Brown sausage patties. Lay an english muffin on a plate. Spread margarine on half the muffin. Sprinkle with cheddar cheese. Break a sausage patty in half. Lay half on the muffin. Break an egg into a small bowl. Beat egg slightly with a fork. Pour egg over the sausage. Spread remaining margarine on the other half of the muffin. Place on top. Fry in a skillet with oil over medium heat. Cook until the bottom is browned. Flip. Cook until done. Serve with ketchup.

Spray a skillet with cooking spray. Heat the skillet over medium heat. Season the steak with salt and pepper. Sear the steak for about 4 or 5 minutes a side. Remove from heat. Cut the steak into bite-sized pieces. Add the mushrooms, onion, soup and water to the skillet. Simmer for about 8 to 10 minutes. Mix the steak and mushroom mixture with the mustard and parsley. Serve over the cooked rice. Serves 6.

In a saucepan combine potatoes with enough water to cover. Bring to boil. Reduce heat to low, cover, and cook for about one hour or until potatoes are tender. Drain potatoes and add to a mixing bowl. Add onion, cucumber, radishes and all-purpose flour. Stir until flour is dissolved. Add vinegar, water, salt, and pepper. Mix well. Cover. Refrigerate until ready to serve. This salad can be served cold or at room temperature.

Mix together garlic powder, basil, salt and pepper in small bowl. Rinse chicken well and pat dry with paper towels. Rub chicken with olive oil. Sprinkle with seasoning mix. Place chicken in a 3-quart slow-cooker. In a large skillet, saute garlic in oil until lightly browned. Stir in minced onion. Stir in vinegar. Bring to a boil. Remove from heat. Pour vinegar mixture over chicken. Covercook on low for 7-8 hours or on high for 3-4 hours. Sprinkle with parsley. Serve immediately.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees f. Grease a 9-inch round cake pan. In a medium bowl stir together the flour, salt and baking powder. In another bowl combine the dates, walnuts, cherries, sugar and 1/2 cup water. Beat the butter, eggs and vanilla in a large bowl. Beat in the flour mixture. Add the date mixture. Beat well. Pour the batter into the prepared pan. Bake for 40 minutes, until firm in the center. Cool on a rack for 10 minutes. Unmold the cake. Cut into wedges. Drizzle with the icing. In a small bowl combine the confectioners' sugar, milk, vanilla extract and salt. Whisk until smooth. Drizzle over the cake. Cut into wedges. Serve immediately.

Cook bacon till crispy. Lay bacon out on paper towels to cool. On one slice of bread lay bacon on top. Place tomato on the bacon. Next place cheese on the tomato. Spread butter on the second slice of bread. Place buttered bread on top of the cheese. Grill or fry until the cheese melts. Cut and eat.

In a large bowl, combine rhubarb, sugar, flour, nutmeg and salt. Toss well. Let stand 20 minutes. Pour into pie crust.Bake at 425 for 15 minutes.Reduce heat to 350 and bake an additional 45 minutes or until a knife inserted in the center comes out clean.Cool completely before serving.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Grease a 9 inch pie plate. In a medium bowl mix together the soup, corn, chicken and milk. In another medium bowl mix together the corn muffin mix and egg. Pour half of the mixture into the pie plate. Spoon half of the soup mixture over the corn bread mixture. Sprinkle evenly with cheese. Repeat layers. Bake for 45 minutes or until crust is golden. Let stand for 5 minutes. Makes 6 servings.

Heat olive oil in large skillet over medium heat. Add garlic and cook for 1 minute. Stir in broccoli floretscook 2 minutes. Remove from heat. Stir in chicken, lemon juice and pepper. Reheat. Divide spaghetti among 4 plates. Top each plate with broccoli mixture. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Serve with tomatoes.

Trim the top and the bottom of each stalk of lemongrass. Place the lemongrass and peanut oil in a small saucepan over medium heat. Cook until the lemongrass is just tender and the oil is fragrant, about 15 minutes. Strain and discard the lemongrass. In a small bowl combine the lime rind and the coriander leaves. Rub the chicken breasts with the mixture. Add the lime juice and the birds eye chiles and marinate for 30 minutes. Thread the marinated chicken breasts onto the lemongrass stems and brush all over with the macadamia nut oil. Grill the skewers over medium high heat until cooked through. Drizzle with the raw sugar and serve. Serves 4.

Cook the pasta according to package directionsdrain in a colander. Heat oil in a Dutch oven over medium heat until hot. Add the sausage to pancook 10 minutes or until no longer pink, stirring occasionally. Add the tomatoescook 4 minutes or until thickened. Stir in the oregano, 1/4 teaspoon pepper, and the pasta. Stir in the cheese until melted. Transfer to a 9-inch square baking dish coated with cooking spray. Sprinkle with the breadcrumbs. Bake at 350° for 20 minutes or until the breadcrumbs are golden. Sprinkle with the parsley. Serve immediately. Makes 4 servings.

Steep tea bags in boiling water for 5 minutes. Remove bags. Add 4 cups ice cubes and 1 cup honey to a pitcher. Add tea to pitcher and stir well. Add lemon and orange juice. Top with ginger ale. Garnish with orange and lemon slices.

Put all ingredients in the bread machine pan in the order suggested by the manufacturer. Set the machine on the dough cycle. When the cycle is completed, remove the dough to a lightly floured surface. Knead for 1 to 2 minutes until dough is smooth. Shape into a loaf. Place in an oiled 9-inch loaf pan. Cover with a kitchen towel and let rise 30 to 45 minutes until doubled in bulk. Bake in the preheated oven for 40 to 45 minutes until the loaf is nicely browned. Remove from the oven. Remove from the loaf pan. Cool on a wire rack.

Place a large piece of butcher paper on a clean work surface. Rub pork with 1 tablespoon kosher salt. Place pork on top of butcher paper. Using a mallet or the bottom of a heavy skillet, pound the roast until it is about 1/2 inch thick. Wrap roast in butcher paper. Place in a large plastic bag. Refrigerate overnight. The following day, preheat oven to 275 degrees F. Remove pork from bag. Set aside. Remove butcher paper from pork. Place pork in a large roasting pan. In a large bowl combine onion, ginger ale, barbecue sauce, ketchup and 1 tablespoon kosher salt. Pour mixture over pork. Bake 16 hours. Remove pork from oven. Using 2 forks shred meat. Return shredded meat to roasting pan. Add barbecue sauce, 1/4 cup ketchup and 1 tablespoon kosher salt. Mix well. Remove roasting pan from oven. Place a large piece of butcher paper

In a large bowl cream margarine and sugar. Add eggs and vanilla. Add chocolate chips and nuts. Shape into a ball and chill for 30 minutes. On a floured surface roll out the dough to 1/8 inch thick. Cut out shapes. Place on a cookie sheet. Bake at 350 degrees F for 10-12 minutes. Cool on a wire rack. Melt marshmallows with butter. Add 1/4 cup of water and stir until smooth. Brush over the top of the cookies. Let stand for 5 minutes before cutting.

Brown the meat in a skillet. Add the onions and cook 3 minutes. Place in a crock pot. Add bouillon cubes. Mix cornstarch and water and add to crock pot. Add salt and pepper. Mix well. Add red wine. Cook 4-6 hours. Serve over noodles.

To a heavy-bottomed saucepan over medium heat, add sugar and corn syrup. Stir until melted and mixture starts to boil. Add cream and bring mixture back up to a rolling boil. Add butter, blanched almonds and vanilla. Stir until mixture boils and thickens. Drop by spoonful onto a wax paper covered plate. Let cool. Roll into balls. Wrap each hard candy in a paper cone or cellophane. Store in an airtight container. Makes about 50 candies.

In a blender combine the egg yolk with the 1/4 cup of water and whisk. Then add the garlic and whisk. Add the wine vinegar and whisk. Add the salt and the pepper and whisk. Add the olive oil and whisk until the dressing is smooth. Add the Worcestershire sauce and whisk. Serve over romaine lettuce. Add the bacon bits and parmesan cheese.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Place chicken breasts in a single layer on a baking sheet, and sprinkle with seasoning. Bake for 45 minutes in the preheated oven, or until no longer pink in center of thickest portion, and juices run clear when pierced with a knife. Remove chicken from oven and allow to cool for about 10 minutes. In a small bowl, whisk together the onion, jalapenos, and lemon juice. Pour over chicken and toss to coat. Cover and refrigerate for about 2 hours. In a small bowl, stir together honey and thymedrizzle over chicken. Chill until ready to serve.

Preheat oven to 180 degrees C. Lightly grease 12 muffin cups. Beat butter and sugar in a large bowl with an electric mixer until blended. Beat in the eggs one at a time. Beat in the milk and baking powder. Combine the flour and cornmeal. Add to the batter and beat until just combined. Spoon into the prepared muffin cups. Bake for about 15 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center of a muffin comes out clean. Makes 12.

Preheat oven to 250 degrees. Cut eye round into 1 inch cubes and place in slow cooker. Combine tomato paste, Marsala wine and red wine vinegar and pour over meat. Add warm water and brown sugar. Cover and cook on high for 3-4 hours. Add garlic and onion soup mix. Cover and cook for another 1 1/2 hours. Sprinkle with thyme and pepper. Serve over mashed potatoes.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. In the bowl of an electric mixer fitted with the paddle attachment, beat the butter and both sugars on medium-high speed for 3 minutes or until pale and creamy. Add the eggs and vanilla and mix on medium speed until well incorporated. In another bowl, sift together the flour, baking soda and salt. With the mixer on low speed, add the flour mixture to the creamed mixture in 3 parts, alternating with the milk and mixing just until incorporated. Fold in the chocolate chips and nuts by hand using a large spoon. Drop the dough by heaping tablespoons onto the prepared baking sheet, leaving 3 inches between cookies. Bake for 9 to 11 minutes or until the cookies are puffed and set at the edges. Remove from the oven and let cool for 1 minute on the baking sheets before transferring to wire racks to cool completely. Store in an airtight container for up to 1 week.

Grease a 10-inch tube pan or two 9-inch round pans. Combine the eggs, bananas and sugar. Beat until smooth. Add the potato flour, cinnamon, baking powder and salt. Beat well. Pour into pans. Bake in a preheated oven at 350 degrees F for 45 to 50 minutes. Remove from oven. Cool completely. Unmold. Frost if desired.
In crock pot combine cheese spread and cream cheese. Add Rotel and mix well. Cook on low for 2 hours. Serve with your favorite crackers.

Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the onion, saute until softened about 5 minutes. Add the beet greens. Add the wine and bacon bits. Cook until the liquid has evaporated. Salt and pepper to taste. Serve with bread.

Mix together the ice cream topping and milk. Stir until smooth. Let sit for 5 minutes. Stir again. In a separate bowl combine the pudding and milk. Beat until smooth. Add the Cool Whip and the topping mixture. Beat until smooth. Pour into pie crust. Cut the toffee bars into pieces. Place them on top of the pie and press down into the pie. Cover and place in the refrigerator to set up for 2 hours or until set.

Prepare barbecue (medium-high heat). Sprinkle chicken breasts with ginger. Grill 4-5 minutes per side or until no longer pink in center (170 degrees F). Cool slightly. Cut into strips. In a shallow bowl combine pineapple juice concentrate, soy sauce and butter. Add chicken strips and turn to coat with glaze. Microwave 1 minute or until glaze is warm. Garnish with almonds if desired. Serve with rice.

Combine barley, salt and water in a medium saucepan. Bring to a boil. Cover, reduce heat to low and simmer 30 minutes. Drain and rinse under cold running water. Transfer to a large bowl. Add vinegar and basil. Toss gently. Add olive oil to taste. Add corn kernels and tomatoes. Toss gently. Serve at room temperature or chilled.

In a crock pot, place sweet onions and garlic. In a bowl, add beef brisket, garlic salt, salt-free lemon pepper, spicy brown mustard and hickory and brown sugar barbecue sauce.
