Wrap brisket in plastic wrap and place over onions. Add bourbon. Cover with lid. Cook on high for 6 hours or low for 8 hours. Serve with mashed potatoes or rice. Serves 8-10

Preheat oven to 375f. In a large bowl mix together all dry ingredients. Add olive oil and mix well. Transfer to a 13x9x2-inch baking pan. Bake for 1 hour stirring every 15 minutes. Remove from the oven and add golden raisins and honey. Mix well. Return to oven and bake for an additional 15 minutes. Cool and serve. Makes 12 servings.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Grease a 9x13 inch baking pan. In a medium bowl, mix together the flour, powdered sugar, margarine, eggs, sugar, baking powder, and lemon juice concentrate. Spread in the prepared pan. Bake for 25 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Sprinkle with the coconut. Cool. Cut into bars. Makes 16 bars.

In bread machine add 1 cup fresh blueberries to the bread pan. Add all remaining ingredients and set bread machine for the jam cycle. When jam is done remove bread pan and stir in lime zest. Serve warm with bread or toast.

Wash and dry berries. Hollow out berries and chill berries with hollowed out sides. In a small bowl combine cream cheese and splenda. Divide mixture and place into berry halves. Chill for 1 hour. Place nuts in a small bowl. Combine orange extract and 1/2 cup water. Drizzle over nuts. Chill for 1 hour. Serve berries topped with nuts. Serves 8.

In a large skillet, brown the ground beef. Drain. Add onion and green bell pepper. Cook until tender. In a medium bowl, stir together butter, tomatoes and rotel. Add to meat mixture. Simmer for 5 minutes. Add cabbage and simmer for 10 minutes. Season with salt and pepper. Makes 6 servings.

Soak the chiles in the hot water to rehydrate. Drain the chiles and remove the seeds and stems. Chop the chiles and place them with all remaining ingredients into the blender or food processor. Puree well. Place the marinade into a sealable plastic bag. Add the chicken breasts to the bag and refrigerate for at least 1 hour or up to overnight. Remove the chicken from the marinade and grill, broil or pan-fry for about 4-5 minutes per side or until the chicken is cooked through. Serve with your favorite sides.

In a salad bowl, toss together lettuce, spinach, hearts of palm, cucumber, carrot, tomatoes, red onion, peas, and capers. In another bowl, combine mayonnaise, mustard, vinegar, sugar, and poppy seeds. Add salt and pepper to taste. Add dressing to saladtoss well. Serves 4.

Heat the oil in a medium pot over medium heat. Saute the onion until softened, about 3 minutes. Stir in the ginger and cook 1 minute. Stir in the carrots and saute until just tender, about 6 minutes. Add the broth and honey and bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Reduce the heat to low and simmer until the carrots are tender, about 5 minutes. Season with salt to taste and serve hot or chilled.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Pierce the squash skin several times with a sharp knife and bake for about 40 minutes or until tender. When squash is tender remove from oven and cut open. Melt the butter in a small pan and stir in the brown sugar and ground cinnamon. Pour over the squash and serve.

Cut beef into 1/2-inch cubes. Season with salt & pepper. Dredge beef cubes in flour and shake off excess. Brown beef cubes in butter. Add beef stock and tomatoes. Cover and simmer for 30 minutes. Add onion and mushrooms. Cover and simmer for 10 minutes. Stir in mustard. Cover and simmer for 10 minutes. Spoon over rice and serve with sour cream.

In a large skillet, fry the Canadian bacon until crisp. Set aside. In a large skillet over medium high heat, melt the butter. Sprinkle the flour over the melted butter and stir constantly until well blended and bubbly. Slowly add the milk, whisking constantly until smooth. Add the salt, white pepper and oregano and whisk until thickened and smooth. Remove 2 cups of the sauce and set aside for later use. In a skillet over medium high heat, brown the chicken fillets on both sides. Place the browned chicken fillets in the skillet with the reserved sauce and simmer until done, about 20 minutes. Sprinkle the tops with the Canadian bacon and cheese. Place under broiler for about 3 minutes or until cheese is melted and bubbly. Serve with the remaining sauce spooned over the top. Serves 4.

Heat butter in large skillet. Add celery and green onioncook and stir over medium heat until tender. Add ricestir until lightly browned. Stir in orange juicebring to boil. Coverreduce heat. Simmer until rice is tender, about 20 minutes. Remove from heat. Stir in almondstoss well. Serve immediately.

Brown ground beef with onion. Add taco seasoning. Add water. Stir well. Add corn. Add soup. Stir well. Add cheese. Add noodles. Stir well. Add veggies. Stir well. Bake uncovered at 375 degrees for 20 minutes.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease a 10-inch tube pan. In a large bowl cream butter and sugar. Add eggs and beat well. In a medium bowl combine flour, baking powder, salt. Mix into creamed mixture. Pour into pan. Bake for 50-60 minutes or until a cake tester comes out clean. Cool in pan for 10 minutes. Remove from pan and cool. Dust with confectioners'sugar. Store in air-tight container.

Mix shallots with vinegar. Marinate mushrooms for 1 hour. Drain well. Saut mushrooms for 5 minutes or until tender. Add shallot mixture. Stir gently. Cook until liquid evaporates. Add thyme to taste. Makes 4 servings.

In a large skillet, saute the garlic cloves in olive oil over medium-high heat. Add the tuna and cook until lightly browned. Add the chicken broth and cook until reduced by half. Add the linguine and the parsley and cook until the linguine is tender. Add the cayenne pepper and cook until blended. Serve immediately.

Peel and dice cucumber. Thinly slice yellow pear tomatoes and cherry tomatoes. In a large bowl toss together cucumber, yellow pear tomatoes and cherry tomatoes. In a small bowl combine remaining ingredients. Pour over cucumber mixture and toss until well combined. Chill for 1 hour before serving. Makes 4 servings.
Place all of the smoothie ingredients in a blender and blend until smooth. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Grease a 12-cup muffin pan or line with paper baking cups. In a medium bowl, combine the flour, baking powder, sugar, and saltset aside. In another bowl, beat together the egg, milk and oilstir into the dry ingredients just until combined. Fold in the berries. Spoon the batter into the prepared muffin cupsbake for 20 to 25 minutes in the preheated oven, or until a toothpick inserted near the center comes out clean. Remove from the ovencool for 5 minutes before removing from the pan to a wire rack. Makes 12 servings.

In a large mixing bowl, combine the bread cubes and the cheese. In a medium mixing bowl, combine the eggs, milk and dry mustard and pepper. Add the milk mixture to the bread and cheese and mix well. Pour into a greased casserole dish. Bake at 350 degrees F for 40 to 45 minutes until set. Serve hot.

Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). In a bowl, stir together the stuffing mix and cheese. Place the chicken in a 9x13 inch baking dish. Brush the stuffing mixture over the top of the chicken. Bake in the preheated oven for about 1 hour. Serve. Makes 6 servings.
In small bowl, combine all seasonings and mix well. Spread over fish fillet and bake at 350 for 20 minutes or until fish flakes easily with fork.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Toss together pears and butter in a shallow baking pan. Bake for 30 to 40 minutes or until pears are soft. Transfer pears to a plate and keep warm. In a small skillet combine the water and cornstarch. Bring to a boil and cook for 1 to 2 minutes or until thickened. Stir in pumpkin pie spice. Drizzle over pears. Sprinkle with almonds. Makes 4 servings.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. Brown sausage. Drain sausage. In a large bowl, combine sausage, sweet potatoes and apples. Combine flour, cinnamon and salt in a small bowl. In a medium bowl, combine water and egg. Pour over sausage mixture. Spread into a 13 x 9 inch baking dish. Sprinkle with cinnamon mixture. Bake for 45 minutes or until bubbly. Serve warm. Serves 4.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Place salmon fillets in an ungreased baking dish. Pour dressing over salmon. Mix together tomatoes, mushrooms and green onions. Lay over salmon fillets. Bake for 25 minutes. Serve with rice or noodles.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Toss shrimp with olive oil and lemon juice. Season with salt and pepper. Stuff with green onion. Bake in a single layer on a shallow baking dish for 5 minutes. Remove shrimp from oven. Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese and green onions. Bake for another 5 minutes or until shrimp are done. Serve with warm pasta.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease a 1-1/2-quart casserole dish. Melt butter in a non-stick skillet over medium heat. Add leeks and cook for about 10 minutes or until leeks are softened. Stir in eggs and continue to cook for about 3 more minutes or until eggs are cooked through. Remove from heat and add flour, nutmeg and paprika. Stir to combine. Gradually add milk and cook over medium heat until mixture thickens and comes to a boil stirring constantly. Add salt and pepper. Pour mixture into prepared casserole dish. Bake for about 30 minutes or until casserole is set. Serve immediately.

In a medium saucepan of boiling water, blanch the ginger for 2 minutes. Drain the ginger and immediately immerse it in ice water to stop the cooking process. When the ginger is cool, slip off the skin and finely grate the root. In a medium bowl, combine the ginger and the remaining ingredients. Cover and refrigerate for at least 3 hours and up to 2 days. Drain off the ginger and discard the liquid. Makes 1 cup.

Cream butter and sugar. Beat in egg. Sift flour and bicarbonate of soda together. Mix with butter mixture. Stir in dates and crystallized ginger. Pour into a 20cm round cake tin lined with paper. Bake in a moderate oven 180C for 30 to 40 minutes. Cool in the tin. Serve with whipped cream. Makes 12 servings.

Heat olive oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add the green bell peppers and mushrooms and cook and stir for 4 to 5 minutes or until the vegetables are tender. Stir in the tomatoes and garlic powder and continue cooking and stirring for 2 to 3 minutes. Stir in the rice, broth and water. Bring the mixture to a boil over medium-high heat. Cover the saucepan and reduce the heat to low. Cook for 15 minutes or until all the water is absorbed. Remove the cover and stir in the peas and corn. Cook for 5 minutes or until the rice is tender and the mixture is heated through. Sprinkle with the almonds. Yield: 4 servings.

Thaw spinach well and squeeze out excess moisture. Chop bacon and cook in a large skillet until browned. Remove bacon from pan, leaving drippings behind. Cook onion and garlic in drippings until tender. Stir in spinach, jalapenos and vinegar and cook 2 minutes or until heated through. Stir in bacon. Season to taste with salt and black pepper. Serve on a bun or over rice or noodles.

Preheat the oven to 375f. Cut the sprouts in half lengthwise. Place in a large mixing bowl. Drizzle with olive oil. Toss to coat. Spread on a baking sheet and sprinkle with salt. Bake for 20 minutes or until golden brown and cooked through. In a separate pan cook the onions and garlic in the butter over low heat until soft. Add the sprouts and balsamic vinegar. Cook for a few minutes until the sprouts are heated through. Serve immediately.
Combine the seeds and oil in a food processor and blend until smooth. Add the sugar and salt and process again until thoroughly blended. Refrigerate for up to 1 week. Makes about 2 cups.

Microwave popcorn according to package directions. While popcorn is still hot, add butter and nuts. Stir until butter and nuts are evenly distributed. Combine corn syrup and sugar in a small saucepan. Bring to boil over medium heat. Boil 1 minute. Remove from heat. Stir in vanilla. Stir caramel sauce into popcorn until evenly coated. Spread popcorn out to cool. Makes 8 servings.

Heat the oven to 350 degrees F. In a large bowl combine the first 5 ingredients. Transfer to a 9-inch pie shell. Bake for 45 minutes or until the crust is golden brown. Cool for 10 minutes before cutting into wedges. Serves 6.
Mix the vodka, cranberry juice cocktail and orange juice. Add the lime juice. Chill. Serve in a tall glass with ice. Garnish with fresh lime.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease and lightly flour two 8x4 inch loaf pans. In a food processor combine the beans, eggs, granulated sugar, canola oil and vanilla extract. Blend until smooth. In a medium bowl combine baking powder and salt. Sift into bean mixture. Stir until just combined. Fold oats into bean mixture. Pour into prepared pans. Bake for 30 to 40 minutes in the preheated oven. Cool for 10 minutes before removing from pans. Serve.

Preheat oven to 350 F. Season cutlets with salt and freshly ground black pepper. Place cutlets in a baking dish. Spread jam evenly over each cutlet. Cover with a layer of breadcrumbs. Bake for 20 minutes. Meanwhile heat chicken stock with the apricot jam until heated through. Spoon over the cutlets. Bake for 15 minutes more. Remove from oven. Sprinkle with parsley. Serves 4.

Combine broth and cream in a medium saucepan over medium-low heat until hot but not boiling. Stir in pumpkin, brown sugar, cumin, cilantro, coriander, and nutmeg until well blended. Stir in cheese until melted. Garnish with cilantro leaves and serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Prepare tortillas by cutting each in half. Spread 1/2 teaspoon cream cheese on each half. Place 1/2 cup shredded cheese over cheese-covered half of each tortilla. Fold each half over filling and press together to seal. Lay sealed side down in a shallow baking pan. Repeat procedure with remaining tortillas. In a skillet, melt butter. Saute onion and green pepper over low heat until tender. Stir in chicken breasts. Cook and stir until chicken is no longer pink. Add sour cream and milk. Heat through. Pour over tortillas. Bake uncovered for 15 minutes. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).Beat egg substitute with skim milk, spices, salt, and vanilla extract in a large bowl. Place 1 slice of bread into the bowl. Turn to coat both sides with the egg mixture. Remove from bowl, allowing excess egg mixture to drip back into bowl. Repeat procedure with remaining bread slices. Place 4 bread slices into a greased 13×9-inch baking dish. Top with remaining bread slices. Combine cereal with remaining egg substitute mixture. Spread over the top of the bread slices. Bake for 10 minutes in the preheated oven. Makes 4 servings.

Cut off stems from olives. Scoop out seeds. Mix cream cheese and Italian dressing together. Stuff each olive with mixture. Arrange olives in a 1-quart casserole dish. Sprinkle with parsley and serve with pita bread or crackers.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Grease cookie sheets or spray with nonstick cooking spray. Cream margarine and Eagle Brand Condensed Milk together. Gradually add flour and baking powder. Add graham cracker crumbs and raisins. Shape into balls on prepared cookie sheets. Bake for 15 minutes or until light brown. Roll balls in coconut. Makes 3 dozen.

Heat oil in skillet over high heat. Season steaks with garlic salt and pepper. Brown on each side for 2-3 minutes per side or until cooked through. Slice across the grain of meat into thin slices. Heat tortillas in skillet over medium heat for 15 seconds per side or until warm. Spread mayonnaise on each side of tortilla. Spread cheese on one side of tortilla. Place meat on cheese. Top with lettuce, tomatoes, parsley and onions. Roll up tortillas and wrap in foil. Serve with water to drink.

Preheat oven to 350. Rub inside of peppers with coarse salt. Stuff with mixture of beef, Tabasco and seasonings. Place in greased baking dish. Bake for 45 minutes. Cut open pepper and put in breadcrumbs. Add butter and sprinkle on cheese. Bake until cheese is melted.

Heat oil in a wok or large frying pan. Add pork and cook until no longer pink. Remove meat to a plate and add green beans to wok and cook for 3 minutes. Add pork to wok with stock, fish sauce and sugar. Bring to a boil and cook until sauce has thickened. Stir in lime leaves. Serve with rice. Makes 4 servings.

Cut the bacon in half crosswise. Layer the cheese on 4 of the chicken breast. Divide the bacon evenly between the chicken breasts and place them on the bacon. Wrap each chicken breast with 1 slice of bacon and secure with toothpicks. Sprinkle with garlic salt. Grill over medium heat for 5 to 10 minutes or until juices run clear when chicken is pierced. Garnish with parsley. Serve with lettuce leaves if desired.
In a large bowl, combine limeade concentrate, lemonade concentrate, water, tequila, orange extract and 7-up soda. Chill before serving. Serve with lemon slices and lime slices.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Roll out the pie crusts and line 2 pie plates. Mix together the broccoli, salmon, cheese, chives, eggs, cream, pepper, and dill. Divide evenly between the two pie crusts. Bake for 40 to 45 minutes in the preheated oven, or until the crust is golden. Serve warm or cold.

Whisk eggs and milk together in a large bowl until smooth and pour into breadcrumbs. Stir until all breadcrumbs are moistened and let stand for five minutes. Meanwhile, melt butter in skillet over medium heat. Dip each slice of bread in egg mixture and then in cinnamon-sugar mixture and place in buttered skillet. Cook until golden brown on each side (about three minutes each side). Place in single layer on wire rack. Melt butter in skillet over medium heat and cook fruit for two minutes or until tender-crisp. Serve over toast. Serves four.

In a small bowl combine butter and lemon juice. Place shrimp in a single layer in a shallow baking dish. Pour butter mixture over shrimp and sprinkle with parsley, garlic and pepper. Broil in the oven for 10 to 12 minutes or until shrimp are pink. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).Prepare pastry as directed. Line a 9-inch deep-dish pie plate with pastry. In a large bowl, combine raspberries, sugar, tapioca, lemon juice, cinnamon, and salt. Pour mixture into prepared pie shell. Bake 10 minutes in the preheated oven. Reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C), and bake an additional 45 minutes. Let cool completely before slicing.

Grease a 9-inch square pan with copha. Crush biscuits until finely crumbled. Mix together biscuit crumbs and butter. Press mixture into prepared pan. Bake at 180 for 20 minutes. Cool. Melt butter and syrup in a saucepan. Add condensed milk. Cook over low heat, stirring constantly until the mixture thickens. Spread on cooled base. Sprinkle with chopped nuts and chocolate. Refrigerate. Cut into 30 bars. Serve cold.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. In large bowl, combine egg whites, mayonnaise and Italian seasoning. Add zucchini and onions and mix to combine. Add Old Bay seasoning to taste. Add breadcrumbs and combine. Shape the mixture into eight patties. Place in baking dish. In separate bowl combine melted margarine and 1/2 cup of breadcrumbs. Sprinkle on top of patties. Bake for 10 minutes or until golden brown. Serve on bun with crab. Serves 4.

Beat butter, sugar and egg together. Stir in flour. Add vanilla. Press dough into a 9x13-inch baking dish. Bake at 350 degrees F for 25 minutes or until dough is set. Combine all filling ingredients in a saucepan. Heat to boiling. Reduce heat to medium low. Simmer for 4 minutes. Remove from heat. Spoon over warm pudding. Cool completely. Cut into 2-inch squares. Makes 6 servings.

In large bowl combine butter and granulated sugarbeat until light and fluffy. Stir in milk and cocoa until combined. Add oatsstir well. Add coconutmix well. Add nuts and saltmix well. Drop by rounded teaspoonfuls onto ungreased baking sheets. Bake at 350 degrees for 8 to 10 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool on baking sheets for 1 minuteremove to wire racks to cool completely. Store in tightly covered containers. Makes about 5 dozen cookies.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). In a medium bowl, cream the butter, brown sugar, and treacle until light and fluffy. Beat in the eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition. In a small bowl, combine the flours, spices, and bicarbonate of sodastir into the butter mixture. Spread batter into greased and floured 13x9-inch baking pan. Bake for 30 minutes in the preheated oven. Remove from oven and cool for 10 minutes before cutting into 2-inch squares.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. In a large bowl, combine corn kernels, salt and pepper. In a medium skillet over medium heat, heat the vegetable oil until hot. Add the onions and cook until the onions are soft and beginning to brown. Remove onions from the skillet and place in the bowl with corn kernegs. In the same skillet, heat the milk until hot. Add the eggs and cook until scrambled. Stir into the corn mixture and combine well. In an 8x8-inch baking dish, spoon half of the mixture into the dish. Top the mixture with the onion rings. Spoon the remaining mixture over the onions and sprinkle with the cheese. Bake for 25 to 30 minutes or until the onions are browned and the cheese is melted.

In a large pan add cauliflower, carrots, onions and mushrooms. Add margarine and stir until well coated. Add lemon juice and herbs and season with salt and pepper. Cover with a tight fitting lid and steam until cauliflower is tender.

Combine cream, milk, sugar and honey in a heavy medium saucepan over medium heat. Bring just to a simmer. Remove from heat. Gradually whisk in yolks. Return mixture to medium heat. Whisk constantly until custard thickens and coats the back of a spoon. Remove from heat. Strain through fine-mesh strainer into another medium bowl. Refrigerate until cool. Stir in gingerroot and freeze in an ice-cream freezer according to manufacturers instructions. Serves 8.

In a medium saucepan over medium heat, combine milk, honey, ginger and cloves. Cook 5 minutes or until hot, whisking occasionally. Stir in cocoa and vanilla. Cook 5 minutes longer. Remove from heat and let cool. Pour into mugs. Top with whipped cream and sprinkle with red pepper.

Boil the pasta according to the package directions. Drain and return to the pot. Heat the butter in a medium skillet over medium heat. Add the mushrooms and cook until tender and lightly browned, 6-8 minutes. Stir the turkey into the pasta, add the mushrooms and their juices, soup, sour cream, salt and pepper to taste. Pour into a greased 3-quart casserole dish or 13 x 9-inch glass baking dish. Top with the parsley. Bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes or until heated through.

Line a baking sheet with wax paper. Spread the cereal in a single layer. Bake in preheated oven for about 10 to 12 minutes or until lightly toasted and fragrant. In a small bowl, combine spaghetti sauce mix and parmesan. In a small bowl, combine pretzels and oil. Add toasted cereal and stir to coat. Add the spaghetti sauce mixture. Stir to combine. Spread in an even layer on wax paper. Refrigerate until cool and firm. Store in an airtight container. Makes about 10 cups.

Season the pork chops with salt and black pepper. In a heavy skillet heat 1 tbsp of oil over medium high heat. Add the pork chops and cook until brown on both sides. Remove from heat. Pour the soup into the skillet. Add the mixed vegetables and rice and stir until combined. Add the broth. Stir. Cover and cook in the oven for 45 minutes. Remove from heat. Serve hot.

Heat the oil and butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add mushrooms and saute until tender and liquid has evaporated. Add garlic and saute until fragrant. Sprinkle mushrooms and garlic with chives and salt and pepper. Serve warm.
Combine all the ingredients into a pot or a large saucepan. Bring to a boil over medium heat. Remove from heat and let stand 5 minutes. Serve hot in bowls topped with cinnamon.

In a small bowl, combine the turmeric powder, garam masala powder, green cardamom seeds, water and salt and set aside. Heat 1 tablespoon of the vegetable oil over medium-high heat in a Dutch oven or other heavy pot with a tight-fitting lid. Add the onion and garlic to the pot and cook for 2 minutes or until lightly browned. Add the turmeric mixture to the pot and stir to combine. Add the passata and cook for 3 minutes or until slightly reduced. Stir in the remaining 1 tablespoon of vegetable oil. Add the salt to taste.

Melt the butter in a large skillet over medium-low heat. Stir in the shallots and cook for 1 to 2 minutes until soft and translucent. Add the paprika and cook for another 1 to 2 minutes. Stir in the tomatoes and 1/3 cup of the chicken stock, and season with salt and pepper to taste. Cook for 20 minutes, stirring occasionally until thickened and the liquid has evaporated. Stir the sour cream into the paprika mixture and continue to cook for 10 minutes more, stirring occasionally until the sour cream is heated through. Meanwhile, boil the potatoes for 25 to 30 minutes or until tender. Drain the potatoes and mash them with the remaining 1 cup of chicken stock and 1/4 cup of the parsley. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Spoon the potatoes on top of the paprika mixture and garnish with the remaining parsley and cheese. Serves 4.

Brown ground beef and onion together and drain fat. Spread 1/3 of the beef mixture over each tortilla. Place tortillas in an ungreased 9x13-inch baking dish. Pour enchilada sauce over tortillas. Sprinkle with 1 cup cheese. Top with remaining beef mixture. Sprinkle with remaining cheese. Bake at 350 degrees F for 20 to 25 minutes or until cheese is melted. Serve with lettuce and tomatoes if desired.

Remove the stalks from the broccoli. Chop into medium pieces. Cut chili pepper in half lengthwise. Remove seeds and white pith. Chop into thin slices. Grate the garlic. Heat 1 tablespoon of the vegetable oil in a wok or frying pan. Add broccoli. Stir-fry over high heat until crisp-tender. Add chili peppers. Stir-fry 1 minute. Add dark soy sauce. Stir-fry until broccoli is coated. Serve immediately. Makes 4 servings.

Spray chicken with vegetable oil spray. Season chicken with garlic salt and paprika. Brown chicken in butter. Remove from pan and place on cookie sheet. Bake at 400 degrees for 30 minutes. Combine sour cream soup and mushrooms and heat through in saucepan. Spoon mixture over chicken breasts. Top with swiss cheese. Return to oven for 5 more minutes or until cheese is melted. Serves 4.

In a mixing bowl, beat the double cream until thickened and starting to form soft peaks (it will take at least 5 minutes). Gradually add the sugar and lemon zest and beat until well mixed (about 30 seconds). Sift the lemon juice into the mixture and beat until well mixed (about 30 seconds). Spoon the mixture into serving glasses or bowls and chill for at least 2 hours. Just before serving, add the cream cheese and beat until smooth and well combined. Serve immediately.

In a skillet, melt the butter over medium heat. Add garlic and parsley and cook until the garlic is golden. Add the wine and cook until the liquid is reduced. Add the scallops and cook until the scallops are opaque. Add the scallions and season with salt and pepper. Add the cream and heat through. Serve over pasta.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. In a large bowl, cream together cheese and butter. Add egg and vanilla. Mix in cake mix until dough forms. On a lightly floured surface, roll out dough to a thin rectangle. Wrap around refrigerator and let sit overnight. Cut into strips. Bake for 8-10 minutes or until just set. Makes approximately 60 cookies.

Preheat oven to 350 F. Prepare an 8×8-inch baking dish by spraying with cooking spray. Cut each tomato in half lengthwise. Arrange in baking dish. In a shallow bowl combine breadcrumbs, cheese, chives, basil and butter. Toss to combine. Evenly sprinkle over tomatoes. Bake for 15 minutes. Sprinkle with salt and pepper to taste.

In a large bowl toss together pineapple chunks, mandarin oranges, marshmallows and coconut. Place a lettuce leaf on each of four plates. Top each with a scoop of sour cream, banana slices and maraschino cherries. Mound the pineapple mixture on top of the banana slices and sour cream. Serve immediately.

Mix pork with soy sauce, ginger and pepper in a small bowl. Heat oil in wok or skillet over medium-high heat. Add pork mixture to the wokcook 1 minute or until browned stirring to crumble. Add broth stirring to scrape up browned bits. Add cabbagecook 1 minute or until tender-crisp stirring constantly. Add noodlescook 1 minute or until heated through stirring constantly. Serve immediately.

Heat 1 tablespoon of the oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Add the onion and garlic. Cook for 2 minutes. Stir in the spinach. Cook for 2 minutes. Transfer the spinach mixture to a bowl. Add the creme fraiche and feta. Stir well. Stir in the remaining 1 tablespoon of the oil. Season to taste. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Butter a shallow 2-1/2- to 3-quart baking dish. In medium bowl, beat chicken breasts to break them up. Stir in butter and seasoned dry bread crumbs. Press lightly to form an even layer on bottom of dish. Lay chicken thighs over bread crumbs, then spread romano cheese over thighs. Cover chicken with remaining bread crumbs and sprinkle with parsley. Drizzle with olive oil. Bake uncovered 45 minutes. Sprinkle with parsley if desired. Serve immediately with pasta or rice. --------------------------------------------------------------------------------.

Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain and rinse with cold water to stop cooking. In a large bowl, combine pasta, broccoli floret, celery, black olives, red onion and ham. Mix with Italian dressing until combined. Serve immediately or chill for a few hours before serving. Makes 4 to 6 servings.

Slice the bread about 1/2 inch thick and butter both sides of each slice. Sprinkle the onion salt over the buttered side and place the other slice on top of it, buttered side down. Melt margarine in a frying pan and brown the sandwiches in it for 2 to 3 minutes on each side or until lightly browned. Remove the sandwiches and place on paper towels to drain. Sprinkle the garlic salt on the corn flakes and mix thoroughly. Spread evenly over the top and sides of the sandwiches and bake in the oven for 10 to 15 minutes or until the crumbs are lightly browned and the cheese is melted. Cool slightly, cut into strips and serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees fahrenheit. Grease a 1-1/2-quart casserole dish or ramekin dishes. In a heavy medium saucepan heat milk over low heat just until hot. Add egg, maple syrup, salt and nutmeg and stir until combined and smooth. Pour into casserole dishes and bake for 15 minutes or until slightly set around the edges. Serve warm.
Sauté ground beef and vegetables in a skillet or Dutch oven over medium heat until meat is no longer pink. Add remaining ingredients and cook until heated through. Serve in hot dog buns.

In a medium bowl, combine ground pork, green onions, hoisin sauce, soy sauce, water chestnuts & eggmix well. Lay out wonton wrappers on a flat surface. Place a heaping teaspoon of pork mixture in the center of each wrapper. Dab edges with water to seal. Fry in hot oil until golden brown. Serve with soy sauce. Makes about 35.

Place chicken breast halves in a plastic bag. Add soy sauce, vinegar, sugar, oil, chilies. Marinate 2 hours or overnight. Remove chicken from marinade. Thread chicken breast halves onto skewers. Grill or broil 5-6 minutes. Spread bottom half of roll with mayonnaise. Place chicken breast halves and 1/2 teaspoon cheese onto bottom half of roll. Sprinkle with lettuce. Spread top half of roll with mayonnaise. Top with remaining chicken breast halves. Sprinkle with remaining 1/2 teaspoon cheese. Serve. Makes 4 servings.

In a large skillet, cook the penne according to package directions in plenty of boiling salted water. Drain in a colander. In the same skillet, heat the butter over medium heat until foamy. Add the garlic and cook for 1 minute, stirring constantly. Stir in the flour and cook for 2 minutes, stirring constantly. Add the milk and cook for about 5 minutes or until the sauce is creamy and thickened. Add the chicken and the parsley and mix well. Add the drained penne and cook for 1 minute over medium heat until the pasta is coated with sauce. Stir in the parmesan and season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve immediately. Serves 6.

Slice onion and garlic cloves in small dice. Cook with olive oil and cayenne pepper. Cook bacon and crumble. Saute mushrooms in butter. Saute oysters in bacon fat until done. Remove from heat. Place one oyster in each of twelve ramekins. Sprinkle with bacon, mushrooms and parsley. Add a little of the oyster sauce and a scant teaspoon of bread crumbs and sprinkle with cheese. Bake at 350 degrees for 10-12 minutes. Serve immediately.

Melt the butter with the oil in a large stockpot over medium heat. Add the onions and stir for 3-5 minutes until the onions begin to brown. Add the flour and stir for 1 minute. Slowly pour in the milk while continuing to stir. Add the chicken broth and mace, bring to a boil, reduce heat to medium-low, and simmer for 10 minutes. Remove from heat and add the parsley, egg yolks, and nutmegbeat to combine well. Season with pepper and salt to taste. Serve hot.

Line a baking sheet with wax paper. In a small bowl, beat together butter, orange liqueur and orange rind. Pour into a small microwave-safe dish. Microwave on high for about 30 seconds or until melted. Dip each pecan into the glazeplace on prepared baking sheet. Sprinkle with salt. Refrigerate until set. Store in an airtight container. Makes about 2 dozen.

Mix together brown sugar, vinegar, cumin, red pepper in a small bowl. Coat pork chops on both sides with mixture. Grill or broil until done, about 10 minutes per side for medium. Serve with fresh sliced tomatoes and melted colby jack cheese or on a soft bun with spicy mustard.

Cut bread lengthwise into 3 strips. Arrange tomatoes and pepper slices on the bottom half of the bread. Sprinkle with cheese and olives. Top with second half of bread. Butter one side of the bread and grill until toasted and cheese is melted. Serves 1.

Heat oven to 350 degrees F. Grease a 1 1/2-quart casserole dish. In a large skillet over medium heat, combine carrots and butter. Cook and stir 4 minutes or until carrots are crisp-tender. In a small bowl, combine flour, salt and dry mustard. Stir into carrotsmix well. Cook and stir 1 minute or until thickened. In a small bowl, combine milk and breadcrumbsmix well. Stir into carrot mixture. Place in the prepared casserole dish. Bake at 350 degrees F for 25 minutes or until bubbly. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake 5 minutes longer or until cheese is melted. Yield: 6 servings.

Mix together all the seasonings in a small bowl. Pat the chickens dry with a paper towel. Brush each piece with olive oil. Sprinkle each piece with the seasonings. Heat grill to a medium heat. Grill chickens until done. Meanwhile, combine preserves and sauces in a small bowl. Just before serving, grill the scallions. Brush each piece with soy sauce. Grill 1 minute per side. Place each chicken piece on a platter. Top each piece with the scallions and a scoop of the preserves mixture. Garnish with ginger. Makes 4 servings.

In a large bowl, combine the beef, sausage, breadcrumbs and spices until well blended. Stir in the eggs. Shape into meatballs and place in a large baking dish. Bake for 30 minutes or until no longer pink in the center. Serve with your favorite pasta and sauce.

Rinse the pheasants and pat them dry. Brush the pheasants lightly with the olive oil. Combine the honey, salt, pepper, garlic powder, thyme, tarragon, and lemon juice in a small bowl. Rub the mixture over the pheasants and place them in a single layer in a baking dish. Bake in the oven for about 45 minutes, basting once or twice. Serve warm.

Heat the butter and olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the edamame. Stir occasionally for about 5 minutes or until the edamame is tender. Stir in the corn. Cook for 5 more minutes. Stir in the onion. Cook for 3 minutes longer or until the onion is tender. Stir in the sherry wine. Cook until the wine is completely absorbed. Stir in the fresh basil. Serves 4.

Pit the plums and cut into small pieces. Cover with water and cook until soft. Drain off water, reserving the plums. Bring the water to a boil over high heat. Add the sugar and stir until dissolved. Add the lemon juice and rind. Stir well to combine. Cook until the mixture is clear. Add the plum pieces and cook until the mixture thickens slightly. Cool slightly. Spoon into hot, sterilized jars. Seal the jars. Store in the refrigerator. Makes about 4 cups.

Spread peanuts evenly in bottom of a 13 x 9 inch pan. In a saucepan over low heat combine butter, peanut butter chips and sweetened condensed milk. Cook, stirring frequently until melted and well blended. Remove from heat. Stir in marshmallows. Spread marshmallow mixture evenly over peanuts. Refrigerate until firm. Makes 20 servings.

Beat egg whites until foamy. Add nuts and spices. Mix well. Spread on a greased baking sheet and bake at 325 for 30 minutes. Stir frequently. Remove and cool completely. Store in an airtight container.

In a Dutch oven over medium heat, saute chicken in oil until brown. Add onion and carrot. Stir until tender. Add water, sour cream, milk, and pepper. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low. Cover and cook for 1 hour. Serve over rice or pasta.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 9x13 inch baking dish. Combine 1 egg and 1 cup milk in a medium bowlstir well. Combine the crackers, sugar, baking powder, and flour in another medium bowlstir well. Add the liquid mixture to the dry mixture, stirring until thoroughly moistenedspread in the prepared dish. Bake for 25 minutes in the preheated oven, or until lightly browned and set. Remove from the oven and sprinkle evenly with coconut and cherriesbake for another 10 minutes. Cool before cutting into squares.
Preheat oven to 350f. Cut the poblanos in half and remove seeds. Fill with cheese, enchilada sauce and potatoes. Bake for 30 minutes. Top with chorizo sausage and serve.

In a small saucepan saute mushrooms in butter for about 5 minutes, seasoning lightly with pepper and a little salt. Add wine and continue to cook for a further minute or so until the wine is nearly evaporated. Add a little water if the mushrooms begin to stick to the bottom of the saucepan. Lay the salmon on top of the mushrooms in the saucepan and poach for about 5 minutes or until the salmon is just cooked through. Remove the salmon from the saucepan and keep warm while you make the tarragon sauce. In a small bowl combine the cream and freshly squeezed lemon juice and whisk until thickened. Taste the sauce and add a little more lemon juice and/or freshly ground pepper if necessary. Put the salmon on a plate and spoon the tarragon sauce over the top. Garnish with a sprig of fresh tarragon and serve immediately.

Place potatoes in bottom of crock pot. In small bowl combine soup, skim milk, cheese and pimiento. Pour over potatoes. Cook on low 8 hours. In small bowl combine sour cream and black pepper. Spoon over potato mixture. Cook on high 2 hours or until heated through. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350°. Grease an 8 x 8 cake pan with butter. In a large mixing bowl cream together 3/4 cup of butter with 1 cup of sugar. Add 2 eggs to mixture. Add 1/2 teaspoon of vanilla extract. Sift 1 1/2 cups of flour and 1/2 teaspoon of baking powder together. Stir into mixture. Spread mixture into prepared pan. Sprinkle 1/2 cup of toasted sliced almonds over batter. Bake for 25 to 30 minutes or until cake is golden brown. Cool completely. In a small bowl stir together 2 tablespoons of strawberry jam with 3 tablespoons of heavy cream. Spread over cake. Dust with additional sliced almonds. Serves 8.

wash potatoes and prick with a fork. place potatoes in a pan with enough water to cover. add 1 tsp. of salt. boil for 20 minutes. drain water and add margarine, onion and green pepper. stir until well blended. add onion soup mix. pour over potatoes. bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes. serve.

Boil the peas until tender but still firm in the center. Drain and cool. In a large bowl, combine the eggs and the mayonnaise. Add the peas and the onion and toss gently but thoroughly. Season with the salt and pepper and the pimiento. Serves 4 to 6.

In a large saucepan over medium heat, melt butter. Add onion and saute until softened. Add soups and milk. Stir until well blended. Add half-and-half, sherry, crabmeat, and seasoning. Cook over medium heat until hot and bubbly. Makes 4 servings.

Mix pomegranate and orange juices in a blender. Add sugar and lemon juice. Mix well. Pour into an ice tray. Freeze until solid. In the meantime blend strawberries with ice cubes. Add pomegranate mixture and mix well. Pour in glasses and serve. Garnish with mint leaves.
In a glass filled with ice cubes combine the whiskey and lime juice and add sugar and stir well. Garnish with lime wedge and serve.

In a small saucepan combine the mint leaves, rosemary and granulated sugar and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 1 minute. Stir in the balsamic vinegar and simmer for 1 minute longer. Remove from heat and let cool for 20 minutes. Strain the sauce and refrigerate until ready to serve. Makes 1 cup. Serve warm or chilled with grilled meat or poultry or fresh vegetables.

Lightly spray a 9-inch square pan with non-stick cooking spray. In a large skillet over medium-low heat, combine hamburgers with milk and eggs until combined. Add cheese and chilies. Stir until cheese is melted. Pour mixture into pan. Bake for 45 minutes or until bubbly and golden brown. Serve with salsa or ketchup.

In a large bowl, mix the flour, sugar, salt and baking powder. Set aside.In a medium bowl beat butter until light and creamy. Beat in the eggs one at a time. Beat in the orange extract and orange zest. Add the flour mixture and beat until combined. Spread into a greased 13x9 inch baking pan. Bake for 25-30 minutes or until edges are brown. Cool on wire rack for 10 minutes.In a small bowl mix powdered sugar, cream cheese and orange juice until smooth. Spread over the top of the bars. Cut into bars and serve.

Cut tomatoes into quarters and place in a food processor. Add onion and process until finely chopped. Transfer to a bowl and stir in sugar and seasoning. In another bowl, mix together flour and baking powder. Stir into tomato mixture until well combined. Divide into 8 equal portions and shape into patties. Heat oil in a frying pan and fry patties until browned on both sides. Garnish with mint sprigs.

In a large bowl combine shrimp and next 6 ingredients. Spread shrimp mixture evenly onto waxed paper to dry. In a small bowl combine the next 3 ingredientstoss well. Spread shrimp mixture evenly onto waxed paper to dry. In a small bowl combine the next 3 ingredientstoss well. Dip shrimp into egg mixturesprinkle with coconut. Place shrimp on a baking sheet coated with cooking spray. Bake at 350° for 10 minutes or until shrimp turn pink. Garnish with parsley.

Place carrots, water, sugar, salt and butter in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil and boil 5 minutes. Stir occasionally. Stir in brown sugar and bourbon. Boil over medium-high heat until thick. Add parsley. Pour into a bowl or individual serving dishes. Let stand at room temperature for 1 hour.

Heat olive oil in pan. Add the prosciutto. Fry for 2 minutes. Remove prosciutto. Add mozzarella slices. Fry until golden brown. Serve immediately. Garnish with balsamic vinegar. Serve with salad greens. Makes 2 servings.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). Cut the cauliflower into florets. Heat margarine in a skillet over medium-high heat. Add the cauliflower florets and sautÃ© until tender. Drain the cauliflower well. Place the cauliflower in a large bowl. In another bowl combine the italian seasoning breadcrumbs, garlic powder, dried basil, and oregano. Add to the cauliflower and toss until well coated. Place in a 9×13 inch pan. Bake for 30 minutes in the preheated oven. Serve hot.

Shred the vegetables in a food processor fitted with the grating blade. Place in a large bowl and add the rest of the ingredients. Mix together and refrigerate for 1 hour before serving. Serve with New York Deli Dressing.

Heat oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add sausage and cook until browned. Add onion and cook until tender. Add carrot and cook 1 minute. Stir in italian seasoning. Add chicken broth and bring to a boil. Add kale and cook until tender. Reduce heat to medium. Stir in ditalini and cook 1 minute. Serve with parmesan cheese. Makes 4 servings.

Heat a non-stick fry-pan over medium heat. Add the pine nuts and toast until light golden brown (about 3 minutes). Remove from heat. In a large pot over medium heat, combine vegetable stock with couscous. Bring to a simmer for 5 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in pine nuts. Combine red onion with chopped mint. Set aside. To serve, place 1/4 cup cooked couscous in a serving bowl. Top with a piece of cooked chicken. Sprinkle with apricots, sultanas and mint. Garnish with french dressing. Serve with lemon wedges. Makes 4 servings.

Place salmon fillets in a baking dish. Drizzle with 1/4 cup of italian salad dressing. Bake for 20 to 25 minutes. In a bowl add the remaining italian dressing and the water. Whisk well and pour over the salmon. Sprinkle with lemon juice. Sprinkle with mushrooms and cook for 2 minutes more. Serve immediately. Serves 4.
In a blender combine melon and lime juice. Add honey and blend until smooth. Pour into serving bowls and top with honeydew balls and yogurt. Serve chilled. Serves 4-6.

Heat 1 tablespoon oil over medium-high heat in a wok or large frying pan, add onion and cook until softened but not browned. Add capsicum and broccoli florets and cook for 2 minutes or until vegetables are crisp-tender. Add prawns to pan and stir-fry for 1-2 minutes or until just cooked through. Add noodles, remaining oil and teriyaki marinade to wok or large frying pan and mix well. Transfer to serving plate or bowl and serve immediately.

Heat margarine in a pan over medium heat. Add shallots and saute until soft. Add beans and cook for 5 minutes stirring often. Add broth and parmesan cheese. Cover and cook until beans are tender about 10 minutes. Salt to taste and serve immediately.

Combine buttermilk, catfish fillets & cornmeal in a large bowl. Allow to sit for about an hour. Combine flour & sea salt & black pepper in a separate bowl. Dredge catfish in flour mixture & fry in hot oil for 5 minutes on each side or until fish is golden brown & flakes easily when tested with a fork.

Wash the strawberries and cut off the tops. Remove the seeds. Mix together the strawberries, sugar, and sour cream. Divide the mixture among six dessert dishes or bowls. Top each dish with a dollop of the reduced-calorie whipped topping.

Wash rice under running water. Bring 2 cups water to a boil in a saucepan. Add rice, reduce heat to low cover and simmer for 15 minutes, until rice is tender. Drain off water. Add 2 cups hot water to rice. Stir in 1/2 tsp salt. Let stand 5 minutes. While rice is standing, wash mushrooms under running water. Slice mushrooms in half lengthwise. Slice onions. Melt butter in a saucepan over medium heat. Add mushrooms and onions. Cook 3-4 minutes, until mushrooms are tender. Drain off excess liquid from mushrooms. Add 1 cup milk. Cook 3-4 minutes, until liquid thickens slightly. Remove from heat. Stir in 1/2 cup cream cheese until melted and smooth. Stir in eggs. Stir in rice, 1/2 tsp salt and 1 tsp pepper. Place in a baking dish. Bake at 350 degrees for 20-30 minutes, until lightly browned. Serve warm.name

Combine the dry ingredients in a saucepan. Add water. Bring to a boil over medium heat, stirring constantly. Boil for 1 minute. Remove from heat. Stir in vanilla, cinnamon stick and milk. Heat over low heat for 2 minutes or until hot. Serve with whipped cream.

Boil pasta in salted water until al dente. Meanwhile cook bacon in a frying pan until crisp. Add zucchini and cherry tomatoes and continue to cook until tender but still crisp. Drain pasta and add to the bacon and vegetables. Drizzle with pesto and top with parmesan cheese. Serves 2 to 4.

In a large skillet, cook the bacon over medium heat until crisp. Remove bacon from the pan and set aside for serving. Add the onion, green peppers and red peppers to the bacon drippings in the pan. Saute until tender-crisp. Whisk the eggs in a small bowl until well blended. Add the cheese. Stir the egg mixture into the bacon drippings. Cook until the egg mixture begins to set. Stir in the bacon. Serve on toasted English muffins. Makes 4 servings.
Blend chickpeas in food processor until smooth. Add remaining ingredients and blend until smooth. Serve with cut up red peppers.

Pour coffee beans into a coffee maker and fill with water to brew coffee as usual. Remove from machine once brewed. Remove coffee beans and cloves, then place coffee pot back onto the heating element and allow to boil. Add in coconut milk and honey, then stir until well blended. Pour into mug and sprinkle with red pepper flakes to serve.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Cook the bacon in a large skillet over medium-high heat until crisp. Drain on paper towels. Peel the potatoes and cut them in half or quarters. Spray a baking dish with cooking spray. Place the potatoes in the dish in a single layer. Bake in the preheated oven until tender when pierced with a fork, about 30 minutes. In a bowl, combine the bacon drippings or oil, chicken broth, mustard, vinegar, and spices. Whisk until the dressing is smooth. Drain the potatoes on paper towels to remove excess fat. Combine the potatoes with the dressing and toss to coat. Garnish the salad with the bacon, green onions, and parsley just before serving. Serves 8.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Spray 13 x 9 pan with cooking spray. In a large bowl mix together the flour, baking powder and salt. Set aside. In a medium bowl mix together the butter and sugar. Add the vanilla and eggs. Combine well. Add the flour mixture. Stir just until combined. Spread in the pan and sprinkle with the Nestle Semi-Sweet Chocolate Chips. Bake 25-30 minutes or until set. Cool completely before cutting. Store in airtight container. Makes 18 brownies.

Prepare couscous according to package directions. Add vegetables and peas and heat through. Pound chicken breast between sheets of plastic wrap until 1/4-inch thick. Cut into strips about 1 inch wide. Heat oil in skillet over medium-high heat. Add chicken strips and cook until no longer pink on outside. Add broth and curry powder. Bring to a boil and reduce heat. Cover and simmer for about 15 minutes or until chicken is tender. Add more broth as needed during cooking. Serve chicken and vegetables over couscous. Makes 4 servings.

Toast the bread on one side. Butter the other side of the bread. Layer the provolone cheese on the buttered side of the bread. Next layer the olive salad and top with the ham, mortadella and salami. Top with the remaining provolone cheese. Toast the sandwich until the cheese is melted and the bread is golden brown.

In a small saucepan combine the almonds and the water. Bring to a boil then cover and reduce heat to medium low. Cook for 15 minutes, stirring occasionally until the water is almost gone. Add the honey and sugar, stirring until the sugar dissolves. Bring to a boil over medium high heat, stirring constantly. Once it boils lower the heat to medium-low and let simmer for about 15 minutes or until the mixture coats the back of the spoon. Stir in the almond oil and salt to taste. Pour the mixture onto wax paper to cool and harden. Break apart and enjoy!

Preheat the oven to 180c/350f/gas 4. Break up the amaretti biscuits into the base of a 20cm x 30cm baking tin. Mix the rice and sugar together in a large bowl. Add the milk and egg yolk and mix well. Pour the mixture over the amaretti biscuits in the tin. Bake for 25-30 minutes until the rice is tender. When cooked remove from the oven. Whisk the white chocolate with 1 tbsp hot milk until the chocolate has melted. Add the rest of the hot milk to the tin and stir well. Leave to cool slightly before cutting into squares. Serve warm.

In a large skillet cook beef and onion until beef is no longer pink. Add water and cook 10 minutes. Stir in pasta sauce and pasta. Bring to a boil. Cover and simmer for 10 minutes or until pasta is tender. Add sliced mushrooms. Cover and cook an additional 2 minutes. Remove from heat. Sprinkle cheese on top of each serving.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Season steak with salt and pepper. Heat oil in a saucepan over medium heat. Add steak and cook until browned on both sides, about 5 minutes per side. Remove steak from pan. Add onions and carrots to pansaute until onions are translucent, about 3 minutes. Add steak back to pan along with potatoes and green pepper. Stir in beef broth. Cover and bake for 1 hour 15 minutes, or until steak is tender. Remove steak from pan and shred into bite sized pieces. Add gravy mix and simmer for 3 minutes. Serve steak over rice or noodles. Serves 4.

Cook bacon in skillet until crisp. Drain on paper towels. Combine brown rice, onion, celery and chicken broth in a medium saucepan. Cover and cook over medium heat for 20 minutes. Stir in dried chervil. Add corn and parsley. Cook for another 5 minutes. Serve hot. Makes 4 servings.
Mix all together in a bowl. Spread on waxed paper and bake at 250 degrees for 40 minutes or until golden brown. Let cool before eating. Makes about 2 cups.

Heat oil in a large saute pan over medium-high heat. Add the spinach and saute for 1-2 minutes or until wilted. Add the garlic and cook for about 1 minute. Add the hot pepper flakes and bell peppers. Cook for 5-6 minutes or until the bell peppers are tender. Season with salt and pepper. Serve warm.

Boil ziti in salted water until al dente (firm but still chewy). Drain water and place ziti in a greased baking dish (9 x 13). In a saucepan over medium heat, melt butter and stir in cream cheese until melted. Stir in garlic powder, milk and parmesan cheese. Add to ziti. Top with parsley flakes and more parmesan cheese (optional). Bake in 375-degree F oven for 15 minutes. Remove from oven, sprinkle with more parmesan cheese (optional) and serve hot.

Preheat the oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C). Bring the water to a boil in a medium saucepan. Add the corn and boil until it is soft but still firm, about 10 minutes. Drain the corn and put it into a blender. Add the milk and half of the chipotle chiles. Blend until smooth. Transfer the mixture to a clean saucepan and heat over medium heat. Add the remaining chipotle chiles and the salt. Taste and adjust the seasoning with additional salt or chipotle chiles as needed. Ladle the soup into 4 bowls. Garnish each bowl of soup with feta cheese and serve immediately.
Mix refried beans and Monterey Jack cheese. Spread on corn tortilla chips. Top with chili and onion. Top with cheddar cheese. Top with sour cream. Garnish with green onion and tomato.

Heat oil in large skillet over medium high heat. Add mushrooms and onions and saute until onions are tender. Add pork and sprinkle with pepper and salt. Cook until done. Add red wine and parsley. Cover. Simmer for 10 minutes. Serve over rice. Serves 6.

Heat oil in a large pan over medium heat. Saut the okra and onion for 5 minutes or until lightly browned. Add ginger and green chilies. Cook for about one minute or until the chilies are tender. Add cumin and coriander, and cook for about a minute more. Stir in water, cover, and simmer for 10 minutes or until okra is tender. Stir in lemon juice. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Serve hot.

In a large bowl, beat egg yolks. Beat in condensed milk until smooth. Add key lime juice and mix well. Pour into pie crust and bake for 15-20 minutes or until set. Cool for 2 hours. Serve with whipped cream or ice cream and garnish with lime slices.

Preheat oven to 350F. In large bowl combine flour, baking powder, salt and sugar. Stir in eggs and oil. Stir in rhubarb, oats and cinnamon. Pour into greased and floured 8-inch square pan. Bake for 30 minutes or until done. Serve warm.

In a medium bowl cream together the sugar and butter. Add eggnog and vanilla extract. Mix well. In a small bowl combine the egg yolks and nutmeg. Stir into the creamed mixture. Sift together the dry ingredients. Gradually stir into the egg mixture. Shape into 1 inch balls and roll in the cinnamon sugar. Place 1 inch apart on ungreased cookie sheet. Bake in a 350 degree oven for 10 to 12 minutes or until the edges are lightly browned. Remove from the oven and allow them to sit on the pan for 1 minute. Remove from the pan and place on a wire rack. When cool, store in a covered container. Makes about 2 dozen cookies.

Bring milk and butter to a boil in a medium pot. Cook pasta in milk until al dente. Drain pasta into a large bowl. Stir in evaporated milk. Melt Velveeta cheese in a small saucepan over low heat. Stir in cayenne pepper and salt to taste. Stir in milk mixture. Pour cheese mixture over pasta and stir to combine. Pour into a 9x13-inch glass dish or another ovenproof dish. Sprinkle with cheddar cheese and Monterey Jack cheese. Bake uncovered in 350 degree oven for 30 minutes or until hot and bubbling. Remove from oven and let stand for 5 minutes. Cut into squares to serve.

Cut chicken into 2 inch pieces. Combine all other ingredients in a shallow dish. Place chicken pieces in the dish and cover. Marinate in the refrigerator for at least 2 hours or overnight. Drain chicken and place in a single layer on the grill. Grill for 10-15 minutes or until cooked through, turning once. Serve hot.

In a skillet, brown sausage and beef until no longer pink. Drain fat. Stir in onion and celery. Cook until onion is transparent. Add cayenne and black pepper and salt and cook 1 minute more. Stir in rice and water. Bring to a boil and reduce heat. Cover and simmer 10 minutes or until rice is tender. Remove from heat and stir in green bell pepper. Serve immediately. Makes 6 servings.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Butter two 9-inch round cake pans. In a bowl combine flour, sugar, cardamom and baking powder. Cut in butter until mixture is crumbly. Add egg and mix to form soft dough. Divide dough evenly between prepared pans. Bake for 15 minutes. Meanwhile make streusel topping. In a bowl combine brown sugar, butter, oatmeal and vanilla. Stir well. Spread over cooled cakes. Serve at room temperature.

Remove the tops from the pickles. In a small bowl mix the sugar, Tabasco sauce and garlic. Stuff each pickle with the mixture. Replace the tops on the pickles. Refrigerate overnight. Serve with deviled eggs, sandwiches or barbecued meat.

Boil potatoes until tender. Drain and mash. Add heavy cream and butter. Add salt and flour and knead until smooth. Place in a covered bowl. Let stand 20 minutes or longer. Knead again and roll out on a floured surface to 1/8 inch thick. Cut into 4 by 4 inch squares. Place on a floured cloth. Let dry 15 minutes. Cook on a lightly floured skillet or griddle until lightly browned. Repeat with remaining dough. Makes approximately 40 lefse.

In a medium mixing bowl, combine the pumpkin, evaporated skim milk and brown sugar. Stir in the cinnamon, ginger and nutmeg. Add the egg and egg white. Beat well. Spoon the mixture into four custard cups. Place the cups in a microwave oven. Bake the custards for 5 minutes. Remove the cups from the microwave. Run a knife around the edges of each custard to loosen it. Turn each custard over onto a dessert plate. Serve warm.

Place the chicken breasts between 2 sheets of plastic wrap and pound to 1/2 inch thickness using a meat mallet. In a small bowl, combine the soup and sour cream. Stir in flour until smooth. Place the chicken in a shallow pan. Pour the soup mixture over the chicken and turn to coat. Cover and refrigerate for at least 2 hours. Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Place the green onions in the bottom of a shallow 2-quart baking dish. Top with the chicken. Bake for 40 to 50 minutes in the preheated oven, until the juices run clear when a knife is inserted into the thickest part of the chicken. Pour the wine and 1/2 cup of water into a small saucepan and bring to a boil. Stir in the seasoning salt and paprika. Simmer for 1 to 2 minutes until the mixture thickens and turns light brown. Spoon over the chicken.

Prepare cod according to package directions. In a large skillet heat oil over medium heat. Add zucchini, onion and garlic and cook until soft. Add tomatoes, roasted red peppers and salt and fresh ground black pepper. Stir in cod and fresh parsley. Serve over lettuce.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees fahrenheit. Spread graham cracker crumbs in the bottom of an 11 by 17 inch jelly roll pan. Melt 4 ounces of chocolate in the microwave for 30 seconds at a time, stirring in between each time, until smooth. Pour evenly over graham cracker crumbs and spread with an offset spatula or spoon to evenly coat the bottom of the pan. Bake for 4 minutes until set, then remove and allow to cool completely on a cooling rack. Meanwhile, combine eggs, sugar and cocoa in the bowl of an electric mixer and beat on medium speed until well blended. Beat in the milk and vanilla extract. Beat in the heavy cream on low speed. Scrape the mixture into the cooled chocolate and graham cracker crust and freeze for at least 4 hours before slicing and serving.

In large pot bring 4 cups of water to boil. Add oysters and butter. Reduce heat to medium. Add worcestershire sauce and 1 tsp of salt. Stir to combine. Bring to simmer. Cover pot and cook 15 minutes. Stir to combine. Add potato and cook covered 10 minutes or until potato is tender. Add milk and nutmeg. Heat to boiling. Add remaining salt. Simmer uncovered 10 minutes. Remove from heat. Stir to combine. Sprinkle with white pepper.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Cut squash in half lengthwise and scoop out seeds and pulp. Rub insides with garlic and salt and pepper. Place squash in a shallow pan and fill with 1/2 inch water. Bake for 20 minutes or until tender. In a small bowl, combine 1/2 cup olive oil and 2 tablespoons basil. Set aside. Drain squash and place in a serving dish. Pour basil oil over squash and serve.

Wash beans and trim ends. Cut into 3/4 inch pieces. In a saucepan, combine sugar, butter, and beans. Cook uncovered for 3 minutes until tender crisp. Combine mushrooms with remaining ingredients. Add beans and mushrooms. Heat through. Serve over hot rice or noodles. Makes 4 servings.
Add 2 tea bags and 1/2 cup sugar to a gallon of boiling water. Stir in 1/2 teaspoon baking soda. Remove tea bags and serve over ice. Serves 4.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Lightly spray a 2-quart baking dish with cooking spray. In a large skillet melt the butter. Add the cabbage and cook over medium heat until soft, about 20 minutes. Stir in the apples and cook 5 minutes. In a bowl combine the cabbage mixture with the breadcrumbs, cinnamon and brown sugar. Pour into the baking dish. Bake for 20 minutes in the preheated oven.

Separate eggs, beat well. Melt a little margarine in a frying pan. Add eggs. Stir constantly with a wooden spoon. Add a few drops of water if they start to stick. Pour in cream halfway through cooking. Stir well. When eggs are ready, pour them out onto a plate. Add Worcestershire sauce to taste. Garnish with chopped parsley. Serve hot.

Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F. Mix together the white wine and paprika and set aside. Place the halibut in a shallow dish and sprinkle with the salt. Put the wine mixture in a shallow bowl and dip the halibut in the mixture. Place the halibut in a lightly greased 13x9x2-inch baking dish. Combine the breadcrumbs and mayonnaise in a shallow bowl and sprinkle over the halibut. Bake for 10 minutes. Spread the sour cream over the halibut and bake an additional 5 minutes. Garnish with the onions. Makes 6 servings.

In a food processor or blender, place garlic cloves, green chilies and pine nuts. Pulse until coarsely chopped. Add parmesan cheese and pulse again. Then add parsley and cilantro leaves and pulse again. With the food processor or blender running, slowly pour the olive oil into the mixture through the opening. Continue to process until the mixture is blended well. Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator. Serve over shrimp or your favorite seafood.

In a small bowl combine reduced sodium soy sauce, vinegar and chili sauce. Set aside. In a large skillet heat sesame oil over medium heat. Add ginger and radish and cook for 2 minutes or until tender. Add the snow peas and cook for 3 minutes or until tender. Add the scallions and cook for another minute. Add the sauce and cook for 1 minute. Remove from heat and sprinkle with the cashews. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Spray a baking dish with nonstick spray. Season the fillets with the thyme, lemon peel, green onions, panko bread crumbs and dried cranberries. Melt the butter in a large skillet over medium high heat. Add the fillets, skin side down and brown for 2 minutes. Transfer the fillets to the prepared dish. Bake for about 20 minutes or until cooked through. Serve with rice or noodles. Makes 4 servings.

In a medium bowl combine mayonnaise with lemon juice and rind. Add celery, radishes and red onion. Toss to combine. Add the apples and cranberries. Toss gently to coat. Sprinkle with cashews. Serve immediately.

In a large bowl, combine the marzipan and flour. Using a pastry blender or two knives, cut the butter into the flour mixture until it resembles coarse crumbs. Add the sugar and egg and stir until the mixture comes together. Divide the dough in half and roll each portion into a ball. Wrap each ball tightly in plastic wrap and refrigerate for 30 minutes. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. Lightly flour a work surface and roll the dough to about 1/4-inch thickness. Using a 2-inch round cutter, cut out as many circles as possible and place them onto a cookie sheet. Bake for 10-12 minutes until set. While the cookies are baking, combine the poppy seeds and jam in a small bowl. Spread a little jam onto the bottom of each cookie and sprinkle with a few poppy seeds. Cool completely before storing in an airtight container. Makes about 4 dozen.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Sift together flour, baking powder, baking soda, ginger, thyme, salt and pepper. In a large bowl, stir together sweet potatoes, onion, garlic, cream style corn, milk, egg, melted butter and flour mixture until well blended. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heatdrop batter by 1/4 cupfuls into hot oil, flattening to 3/4-inch thickness with the back of a spoon. Cook until golden brown on both sides, about 2 minutes per side. Place on baking sheets lined with paper towels to drain. Repeat with remaining batter, adding oil as necessary to pan. Bake in preheated oven until golden brown and heated through, about 15 minutes. Serve warm with sour cream or salsa. Yield: 12 fritters

Peel fennel bulbs and cut in 1/2-inch thick rounds. Heat 1 tablespoon of the olive oil in a large saute pan over medium heat. Add garlic and fennel and cook for 5 minutes. Add the wild fennel and cook for another 3 minutes. Add the anchovy fillets and cook for another minute. Pour in the remaining 3 tablespoons of olive oil and cook for another minute. Stir in the pasta and cook for 2 minutes. Add the red pepper flakes and fresh ground black pepper and sea salt and mix well. Serve immediately.
Place all into food processor and blend. Spread mixture between 4 crackers. Top with stuffed olive. Serve immediately.

In a small bowl combine mayonnaise, cilantro, green onion and chile. Blend well. Dip tortillas in mixture. Place lettuce leaves in center of each tortilla. Top with turkey and roll up. Slice in half and serve. Serves 2.

Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain. Drain and rinse peas. Drain and rinse cucumber. Drain and rinse roasted red pepper. In a large bowl combine tuna, pasta, peas, cucumber and roasted red pepper. In a small bowl combine mayonnaise and vinegar. Add salt and pepper. Stir in parsley and mix well. Add to pasta mixture. Chill for several hours and serve.
Heat oil in large skillet over medium high heat. Add onion and saute until softened. Add green beans and season with salt and pepper. Saute until crisp-tender. Stir in parsley and serve.

In a large bowl combine cooked chicken, mayonnaise, paprika, cranberries and celery. Fold in green onions and bell pepper. Sprinkle with seasoning salt and pepper. Add pecans. Refrigerate 1 hour before serving. Serve on lettuce leaves with whole wheat bread. Makes 4 servings.

Combine 1/2 cup water with 1/2 teaspoon of the salt in a small saucepan over high heat. Cook until the water boils. Stir in lentils and reduce heat to medium. Simmer, covered, for about 20 minutes. Stir in vegetables. Simmer uncovered until lentils are tender about 25 minutes more. Add pork and simmer for 10 minutes or until pork is heated through. Taste and adjust seasoning with salt and pepper. Serve with a side of warm crusty bread.

Preheat oven to 375. In a large bowl, combine potato, tomato, onions, margarine and herbs. Toss to mix. Transfer mixture to a large casserole dish. Bake 45 minutes or until potato is tender. In a medium bowl, combine flour, milk and salt & freshly ground black pepper. Bring to a boil over medium heat. Cook and stir for 1-2 minutes or until thickened. Stir in cheese. Pour over potato mixture. Bake 15 minutes. Serves 6.

In a large saucepan combine sugar and hot water. Stir until sugar is dissolved. Boil until syrup reaches soft ball stage (238 degrees) on a candy thermometer. Remove from heat and add egg whites and vanilla extract. Beat until mixture is stiff and glossy. Stir in salt and continue to beat until mixture is stiff and glossy. Spread on wax paper to cool and harden. When cool break into pieces and sprinkle with marshmallow sauce. To make marshmallow sauce, combine corn syrup and water in a saucepan. Bring to a boil over high heat. Remove from heat and stir in mayonnaise and vanilla until mixture is thick and spreadable. Spread on fruit and serve. Serves 4.
Combine all the above together in a medium bowl and mix well. Serve with crackers.

Preheat oven to 400f. In a medium bowl combine Bisquick mix and the marmalade. Cut in the butter until it is the size of small peas. Pour in the cold water and stir until a soft dough forms. Turn onto a lightly floured surface and knead 10 times. Roll out to 1/2 inch thickness. Cut with a floured 3 inch round biscuit cutter. Place on lightly greased baking sheet. Bake for 12 to 15 minutes. Serve warm. Makes 8.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Grease an 8x8 inch baking pan. Beat butter and sugar until creamy. Beat in the eggs one at a time. Stir in the flour, baking soda and cinnamon. Fold in the oatmeal. Spread into prepared pan. Bake for 30 minutes in preheated oven. Cool completely before cutting. --------------------------------------------------------------------------------.

Place chicken in a 5-quart slow cooker. In a medium bowl combine the marmalade, lime juice, pineapple, soy sauce, mustard, gingerroot and cayenne. Pour over the chicken. Cover and cook on low for 6 hours. Stir in the minced garlic. Cook for an additional 30 minutes. Remove chicken and discard skin and bones. Place chicken in a serving bowl. Pour the sauce over the chicken.

Butter a large baking dish. Layer bread in dish. In a large bowl, combine apples, sugar, wine, cinnamon and nutmeg. Add the egg and milk. Spread mixture over bread. Dot with butter and bake in the preheated oven for one hour. Cool for 10 minutes. Whip the cream with zest. Serve with the pudding.

Brown ground beef with onion gravy mix and salt. Drain off fat. Add biscuit mix to meat and stir to mix well. Add milk and stir well to combine. Pour into greased 1 1/2 quart baking dish. In another bowl combine brown gravy mix, hot water and butter. Pour over meat mixture. Bake at 350 for 45 minutes. Cool 10 minutes before serving. Serves 6-8.

In a saucepan, combine ketchup, cider vinegar, orange juice and pineapple juice. Bring to a boil. Mix cornstarch and water in a small bowl. Stir into the saucepan. Bring back to a boil. Lower heat. Stir in mustard. Cool before serving. Makes 2 cups.

Combine 2 cups flour, 1 cup cornmeal, baking powder, baking soda, and salt in a large bowl. Beat together egg and canola oil in a small bowl. Add egg mixture to flour mixture stirring just until moist. Stir in enough water to make a soft dough. Turn out onto a lightly floured surface. Knead until smooth and elastic about 10 minutes. Divide dough into 2 equal portions. Roll each portion into an 8-inch square. Cut each square into 4 triangles. Place 1 inch apart on greased baking sheets. Bake at 400 for 10 minutes or until lightly browned. Remove from pans to wire racks. Cool completely. Makes 16 servings.

Combine sugar, flour and cinnamon. Use pastry blender to cut in butter until mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Combine 2 tablespoons sugar, 1 teaspoon flour and 1/2 teaspoon cinnamon. Place blueberries in 9-inch pie plate. Sprinkle with sugar mixture. Pour orange juice over all. Top with crumbs. Bake at 350 degrees for 40 - 50 minutes or until crust is golden brown. Cool on rack.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).In a large bowl, mix together the ricotta cheese and the sugar substitute. Add the beaten eggs and stir gently. Stir in the cinnamon and the nutmeg.Place the egg mixture into a greased 11x17 inch baking pan.Bake in the preheated oven for about 40 minutes. Let cool slightly before serving.

In a medium bowl, cream butter, sugar, vanilla and corn syrup. Add egg whites. Beat until thoroughly combined. In a large bowl, combine cocoa powder, flour, baking powder, salt and rolled oats. Add vanilla mixture. Stir until well combined. Stir in the Rice Krispies. Drop by rounded tablespoonfuls 2 inches apart on baking sheet. Bake 10 minutes. Cool on wire racks. Makes 48 cookies.

Heat olive oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium heat. Add garlic and cook until fragrant. Add peppers and onion and cook until peppers are tender, about 5 minutes. Add cumin and oregano and cook 1 minute more. Add chicken and cook until browned. Add hot pepper and cook 1 minute more. Add water and lemon juice and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for about 5 minutes. Serve over white rice. Makes 4 servings.

Rinse lentils in cold water. Place in saucepan with 4 cups of water. Bring to boil. Cover and reduce heat to simmer. Simmer until lentils are tender. Drain and set aside. In another saucepan, bring 2 cups water to boil. Add the rice. Simmer until rice is tender. Add lentils, salt and pepper to taste. Heat through. In a small skillet, heat the olive oil. Add onions. Cook until onions are golden brown. Add to rice mixture. Mix well. Serve immediately. Serves 4.

In a large skillet cook onion in oil until soft. Add tomatoes with liquid, green chilies and spinach. Heat through. Stir in cheese. In a bowl combine cream cheese with half-and-half cream, vinegar, salt and pepper. Stir into skillet mixture. Transfer to baking dish. Bake at 350 degrees F for 15 minutes or until bubbly. Serve with chips and pita bread.

Heat oven to 375 degrees F. Lightly spray 13x9x2-inch baking pan with cooking spray. Mix breakfast sausage, egg, cheese, salt, pepper and garlic powder in large bowl until well blended. Unroll crescent rollsseparate at perforations. Cut each sheet into four rectangles. Layer over bottom of baking pan. Top evenly with sausage mixturepress to cover bottom of pan. Beat milk and egg in small bowl until blendeddrizzle over sausage mixture. Bake uncovered about 25 minutes or until crescent rolls are golden brown and edges are bubbly and set. Cut into squares to serve. Makes 8 servings.

Combine rice, milk and coconut milk in a medium pot. Cook over medium heat until rice is tender. Add sugar and salt and stir until well combined. Remove from heat and stir in coconut extract. Serve warm and top with coconut.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Crush graham crackers into fine crumbs. Mix graham cracker crumbs and vegan margarine in a small bowlset aside 2 tablespoons for topping. Press remaining crumb mixture into a 9 inch springform pan. Beat cream cheese and pumpkin together until smooth. Add brown sugar and beat until combined. Beat in soy milk until smooth, then add rum extract and spices. Pour filling into springform pan and spread evenly. Sprinkle with remaining crumb mixture. Bake in preheated oven until filling is set, about 1 hour. Let cool 1 hour in pan before removing outer rim of pan. Refrigerate several hours or overnight before serving. Makes 8-10 servings.

Combine 2 eggs, water, 2 packets biscuit mix, 1/4 c. milk, 1/4 c. melted butter, 1/2 c. grated cheddar cheese. Beat well. Drop by tablespoon onto greased cookie sheet. Bake at 350 degrees for 10-12 minutes.

In a medium bowl combine the pure maple syrup, dijon mustard, molasses, cider vinegar and ground cumin. Whisk well and set aside. Season the pork chops with the salt and pepper. Place the pork chops on a baking pan and pour the maple glaze over them. Bake for 45 minutes in the preheated oven, or until the pork chops are done and the glaze is bubbly and thick. Serve the pork chops with your favorite side dishes.

In a medium mixing bowl, combine the potato starch and milk and beat until smooth. Add the eggs and continue to beat. Add the potato mixture to the butter and sugar mixture. Combine well. Stir in the coconut, almonds and vanilla. Place the dough on a well floured surface and roll out to about 1/4 inch thick. Cut the dough into desired shapes. Place the dough shapes onto greased baking sheets. Bake for about 20 minutes in preheated oven. Remove from oven and allow to cool. Sprinkle the Needhams with powdered sugar and dark chocolate.

In a large skillet over medium heat cook chicken in butter until browned all overdrain and set aside. In a small bowl combine soup and milk stirring with a whisk until smoothpour over chicken and stir until coated. Spoon filling into each crescent roll triangles and sprinkle with cheese. Bake on a greased cookie sheet at 400f for 10-12 minutes or until golden brown. Serves 6-8.

Melt butter in a frying pan and add onion. Cook for approx 1 minute until softened. Add courgettes and cook for approx 1 minute until softened. Add walnuts and cook for approx 1 minute until browned. Add pasta and cream and cook until heated through and all mixed together. Season with salt and pepper and parsley and serve sprinkled with parmesan cheese.

In blender container place strong coffee, brown sugar, vanilla bean. Process until sugar is dissolved. Add bananas and almonds. Process until smooth. Pour into glasses. Garnish each serving with 1 tablespoon almonds. Serve immediately. Makes 2 servings.
