Combine the turkey, soup and eggs. Add the oats, minced garlic and onion and mix thoroughly. Form into loaf shape and place in loaf pan. Bake at 350 degrees f for an hour and a half or until thoroughly cooked through. Serve with your favorite vegetable and bread.

In a medium saucepan combine the rice, water, tomato sauce, onion powder, chicken bouillon, salt, garlic salt, paprika and pepper. Cook over medium heat until the liquid is absorbed and the rice is tender. Stir in the beans and corn. Heat through. In a skillet heat the oil over medium high heat. Add the turkey and cook stirring occasionally until browned and no longer pink in the center (about 5 minutes). Add the cumin and cook and stir for one minute more. Stir the turkey into the rice. Serve immediately or refrigerate and reheat later.

Place ham in cooker with 3 cups water. Coverlock lid in place and cook on high pressure 50 minutes. Remove from heatlet pressure release naturally 10 minutes. In small bowl, combine butter, flour, pepperblend well. Add to cooker and stir. Add potatoescook on high pressure 10 minutes or until tenderlet pressure release naturally 10 minutes. Add carrotscook on high pressure 5 minutes or until tenderlet pressure release naturally 10 minutes. Add cabbagecook on high pressure 5 minutes or until tenderlet pressure release naturally 10 minutes. Cut ham into 1/2 inch slicesplace on serving plattergarnish with parsley sprigs.

In a medium saucepan, bring the water to a boil over high heat. Add the spinach and cook until wilted, about 1 minute. Remove from the heat and let cool slightly. In a large bowl, combine the spinach, potatoes, egg yolks, cheese and season with the salt and pepper. Add the flour and mix well. Turn the dough out on a lightly floured surface and knead until smooth and elastic, about 5 minutes. Divide the dough into four pieces and roll each into a 3/4-inch-thick log. Using a sharp knife or vegetable peeler, cut the logs into 1-inch-thick strips. Using a gnocchi board or a fork (or your hands if you don't have the other tools), roll the strips into gnocchi and transfer to a plate. Bring a large pot of lightly salted boiling water to a boil. Add the gnocchi and cook until tender to the bite, 5 to 7 minutes. Remove the gnocchi from the boiling water with a slotted spoon and drop into the sauce. Serve hot

Make a basic sugar syrup with 1/3 cup sugar and 1/2 cup water. Heat and stir until the sugar is completely dissolved. Let the syrup cool completely. Melt 1/4 cup of the syrup along with the remaining sugar in the microwave for 1 minute stirring once or twice to prevent the sugar from burning. While the mixture is still hot and liquidy but not dripping from the spoon add the corn starch and rice flour one tablespoon at a time mixing well after each addition. Once all the flour is added use your fingers to pull and stretch the mixture as you would hair. This will give it a very delicate and fluffy texture. Dust the mixture with the remaining sugar and shake off any excess into a bowl. Place the mixture in a shallow bowl and press into shape with the palm of your hand and then use your fingers to create hair like strands and knots. Store the candy in an air tight container for up to 5 days or freeze for up to 3 months. This recipe makes about 1/4 pound of candy.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees. Lightly coat 2 popover pans (or 4 cups) with nonstick spray. Whisk together flour, baking powder and salt. Melt butter in microwave. Stir in milk. In a large bowl mix together flour mixture, milk mixture, eggs, and vanilla. Spread batter in the popover pans. Bake 20-25 minutes until the popovers are golden brown. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. In an ungreased 8-inch square dish, combine the beans and tomatoes. In a skillet, brown the beef and onion over medium heat. Drain and add to the tomatoes. Add the green pepper and cooked meat. Sprinkle the top with cheese. Melt the butter and mix in the paprika. Pour over the top and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Bake for about 45 minutes or until the cheese is melted and the casserole is bubbly. Cool for about 5 minutes before serving. Makes 6 servings.

In a large skillet brown turkey over medium heat until no longer pink. Add onion and cook until tender. Stir in remaining ingredients. Bring to a boilreduce heat and simmer 10 minutes. Serve with shredded cheddar and sour cream. Makes 4 servings.

In a large pan over medium-high heat, combine the pine nuts, garlic, chard stems (with the leaves) and red chile flakes (if using) with the oil, season with salt and cook for 1 minute or until the garlic is fragrant. Add the pasta and cook for 1 minute more. Add the broth, sun-dried tomato packed in oil and chard leaves (if using) and cook until the pasta is cooked through, about 2 minutes longer. Add the vinegar, parsley and parmesantoss until the pasta is coated. Serve immediately.

Trim fat from chicken thighscut into bite-size pieces. Place in a resealable plastic bagadd oil, scallions, soy sauce, brown sugar, gingerroot, and garlicseal bagmix to coat well. Refrigerate 2 hours or overnight. Remove chicken from marinadereserve marinade. Thread chicken onto skewers, leaving 1/2 inch between pieces. Grill skewers 5 minutes, turning frequentlybrush with reserved marinade during the last 2 minutes of grilling. Remove from grillserve warm.

In a medium saucepan of boiling water, cook brussels sprouts until crisp-tender, about 2 minutes. Drain. In a large skillet over medium heat, melt 1 tablespoon butter. Add sprouts and cook 2 minutes. Add the remaining 2 tablespoons butter and lemon juice. Cook 2 minutes more. Season with kosher salt and fresh ground black pepper. Serve hot.

In a large pot combine buttermilk with dijon mustard, salt and granulated sugar. Bring to a boil and cook 1 minute or until slightly thickened. Stir in shrimp and cook for 1 minute. Stir in the cucumber and green onions. Serve hot. Serves 4.

Place dried apples in the bowl of a food processorpulse until coarsely chopped. Pour into a medium saucepan with enough cold water to cover the apples by 1 inch. Add orange juice and zest, cinnamon, and sugarbring to a boil over medium-high heat. Reduce heat to lowcover and simmer for 5 minutes. Add butterremove from heat, and stir well to combine. Let cool to room temperature. Roll out the pie doughs on a lightly floured surface to fit the bottoms of 4 (9-inch) pie plates with 1/2-inch overhangtransfer to the pies. Spoon the apple mixture into the pies, dividing the mixture evenly among the pies. Brush the edges of the pies with the egg washfold the overhang over the apples to seal the edges. Bake until the pies are golden brown, 45 to 55 minutes. Cool the pies on wire racks until slightly warm, about 1 hour.
In large bowl, toss spinach leaves with sesame oil, sugar, rice wine vinegar, soy sauce and Dijon mustard. Sprinkle with sesame seeds. Makes 2 servings.

In a large bowl, combine lime juice and sugar. Sprinkle over gelatin and let stand until soft. Stir in condensed milk and green food coloring. Pour into pie crust. Refrigerate overnight or at least 6 hours. Whip whipping cream until stiff. Spread over pie filling. Garnish with lime rind. Chill until serving time. Makes 12 servings.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a small saucepan combine butter and chocolate and melt over low heat. Set aside to cool slightly. Beat eggs with sugar until light and creamy. Stir in flour and vanilla. Stir in cooled chocolate mixture. Pour into a greased 9 x 13-inch pan. Bake for 35 minutes. Sprinkle with chopped walnuts if desired. Cool and cut into squares. Makes 2 dozen.

In a small saucepan combine 1/4 cup lavender with 4 cups water. Bring to a boil. Remove from heat and steep for 5 minutes. Strain the tea and discard lavender. In a large pitcher combine the tea with 2 cups lemonade and 1 cup lemon juice. Stir in the sugar and lemon slice. Refrigerate for up to 1 week. Serve over ice or warm. Makes 16 servings.

Crush graham crackers in a food processor or place them in a plastic bag and crush with a rolling pin. Mix graham crackers with margarine until crumbs form. Press into the bottom of a 9x13 inch pan. Mix brown sugar, sugar, flour, eggs and vanilla in a bowl. Pour over graham cracker mixture. Bake at 350 for 20 to 25 minutes. Sprinkle with nuts. Let cool. Cut into bars.
Cut carrots into sticks. In a large skillet heat cooking spray. Add carrots and onion. Cook and stir until crisp. Drain on paper towels. Serve with salad dressing for dipping.

Combine cornstarch with lemon juice. Beat in egg whites until foamy. Add breadcrumbs and parsley. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Dip chicken breasts in egg white mixture, then coat with breadcrumbs. Heat olive oil in large skillet over medium heat. Add chicken breasts. Cook until chicken is tender and no longer pink in center, 5 to 10 minutes per side. Drizzle with lemon juice.

1) Soak gelatin in boiling water for 5 minutes, stirring frequently. 2) Drain well. Stir in lemonade concentrate until well blended. 3) In a large bowl combine the gelatin mixture, cream cheese, whipped topping, food coloring and lemon juice until well blended. 4) Spoon into 8 individual serving dishes. Refrigerate until set. Makes 8 servings.

Preheat the oven to 425°F. Line a rimmed baking sheet with foil and spray with non-stick cooking spray. In a large mixing bowl, combine the potatoes, olive oil and kosher salt and pepper and toss well. Spread the potatoes in an even layer on the baking sheet. Roast for 45 minutes or until the potatoes are golden brown and crispy on the outside and tender and cooked through on the inside. Remove from the oven and sprinkle with the minced garlic. Return the pan to the oven and roast for a few minutes until the potatoes are warm and the garlic is fragrant and golden. Remove from the oven and serve hot or at room temperature.

Preheat oven to 350f. Cream butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Add molasses and egg. Beat until well mixed and smooth. Add flour, cloves, ginger and cinnamon. Beat until well mixed and smooth. Add baking soda and salt. Mix until well combined. Drop by teaspoons onto ungreased baking sheet and bake for 8-10 minutes or until golden brown. Let cool on sheet for 5 minutes and then transfer to cooling rack. Makes about 2 dozen cookies.

Cook orzo in boiling water until tender but firm. Drain the orzo. Meanwhile, cook the spinach in a large saucepan with the lemon juice over medium heat until the spinach wilts. In a small saucepan combine the butter, oregano and oregano. Stir until the butter melts. Add the garlic and cook for an additional minute. Stir in the spinach mixture, parmesan cheese, onion powder and the cooked orzo. Season with salt and pepper. Serves 2-4.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Slice bread lengthwise. Spread a thin layer of sour cream over bread. Top with onion and oregano. Sprinkle with bacon and tomatoes. Top with mozzarella cheese. Bake until cheese is melted and bread is browned. Serve warm. Serves 4.
Pour all into blender and blend until smooth. Add ice and serve immediately.

Heat canola oil in a non-stick skillet over high heat. In a small bowl whisk together the eggs. In another small bowl stir together the soy sauce and garlic powder. Dip the bok choy in the soy sauce mixture. Place in the hot pan and cook for 2 minutes on each side or until the bok choy is crisp. Remove the bok choy from the pan. In the same pan add the onion. Cook for 1 minute or until the onion is soft. Add the shrimp to the onion pan. Cook for 2 minutes or until the shrimp are cooked through. Stir in the bamboo shoots. Cook for 1 more minute. Pour the egg mixture over the shrimp mixture in the pan. Cook for 2 minutes or until the egg is set. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. Lightly spray a baking sheet with nonstick spray.In a large bowl, beat the egg whites until stiff peaks form.Add the sesame seeds and pecans and stir gently with a wooden spoon until well-combined.Dip the chicken breasts into the egg white mixture and shake off the excess.Place the chicken on the baking sheet and bake for 18 to 20 minutes or until no pink remains and the juices run clear.In a small bowl, stir together the hoisin sauce and Dijon mustard until well-blended.Stir in the apricot preserves and blend thoroughly.Serve the chicken with the dipping sauce.Serves 4 (2 tenders each).

In a large soup pot or Dutch oven over medium heat, combine chicken broth, green onions and garlic. Bring to boiling. Reduce heat. Add avocados. Cook until avocados are very soft, about 10 minutes. Add lemon juice. Using an immersion blender or regular blender, puree soup in batches until smooth. Stir in crabmeat. Refrigerate for 30 minutes. Ladle into bowls. Stir in yogurt.

Dissolve gelatin in boiling water in large bowl. Refrigerate until almost set. Add raspberries. Set aside. In a small saucepan, cook pretzels and sugar in boiling water for 5 minutes. Cool completely. Beat butter until creamy. Gradually add cream cheese. Beat until smooth. Add cooled pretzels. Beat until well blended. Spread evenly in a lightly greased 9-inch round cake pan. Chill until firm. Spoon gelatin over top of crust. Chill until firm. In a large bowl, beat whipped topping until stiff peaks form. Spread over gelatin layer. Garnish with additional berries if desired. Refrigerate. Cut into wedges to serve. Makes 8 servings.

In 9x13 baking dish spray with nonstick cooking spray. Layer in bottom of pan shredded hash browns. Next layer 1 pound of ground beef. Next layer 1 can of black beans. Next layer 1 can of thick & chunky salsa. Next layer 1 can of nacho cheese soup. Bake at 350 degrees for 25-35 minutes or until hot. Serve with shredded lettuce and chopped tomatoes.

Heat oven to 375 degrees F. Melt butter in a medium saucepan over low heat. Add celery and parsley. Cook 3 minutes. Stir in chicken. Add chicken broth. Heat through. Arrange chicken and celery mixture in the bottom of 13 by 9-inch baking dish. In another bowl, mix together breadcrumbs and egg. Sprinkle on top of chicken mixture. Bake 20 minutes or until golden. Serve hot. 3 points per serving.

In a medium saucepan over high heat, melt 4 tablespoons of the butter. Add the garlic and cook for 1 minute. Add the shallots and cook for 1 minute more. Add the dried herbs and cook for 1 minute. Add the mussels and toss to coat. Add the ale. Cover and cook over high heat for 2 minutes. Toss in the mussels and cook for 1 minute more. Remove from heat and season with the pepper. To serve, spoon the mussels over the bread and garnish with the parsley, chives, and the remaining 2 tablespoons of the butter. Serves 4.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Combine salad dressing mix with wine in 2-quart casserole dish. Place chicken on top of dressing mix. Sprinkle with half of the cheese. Cover with remaining dressing mix. Sprinkle with remaining cheese. Bake 1 1/2 hours or until tender. Pour soup into dish. Mix until smooth. Bake uncovered 10 minutes longer. Serve with pasta.

Stir together sour cream, lemon juice, sugar, salt and 1/4 cup pineapple juice in a large bowl. Divide mixture among 12 paper cups. Freeze until firm. Slice bananas. Remove cups from freezer about 30 minutes before serving. Put 1 banana slice in each cup. Sprinkle each with 1 tablespoon pecans. Put 1 tablespoon cherries in each cup. Drizzle each with 1/2 teaspoon red food coloring. Makes 12 servings.

Preheat oven to 350. Cream together butter and sugar. Beat in vanilla and bananas. Add eggs one at a time beating well after each. Add soda and flour to banana mixture. Stir to blend well. Fold in pecans. Bake in two 8x4 inch loaf pans for 1 hour 10 minutes. Cool on wire rack.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Sift together the cocoa and flour. Sift together the sugar, salt and baking soda. Beat the eggs and add to the cocoa mixture. Add 1/2 of the sugar mixture and 1/2 of the buttermilk. Stir well. Add remaining sugar mixture and buttermilk. Add vanilla and wesson oil. Add boiling water. Stir well. Pour into well greased and floured 9-inch tube pan. Bake for 30 minutes or until wooden toothpick inserted comes out clean. Remove from oven and cool for 10 minutes. Remove from pan and cool completely. To make frosting: Beat sugar and margarine until light and fluffy. Add vanilla. Spread on cake. Yield: 20 servings.

In a small bowl combine the cheese whiz, sour cream and milk. Set aside. In a large skillet cook the broccoli and butter over medium heat until tender. Add the cooked rice and onion. Pour over the sauce. Put into a baking dish. Top with cheese. Bake at 350 degrees f for 20 minutes. Serves 6.
Spread cream cheese mixture on bread. Top with turkey and provolone. Top with roasted sweet peppers. Top with spinach leaves. Cut sandwich in half.

Toss apples with sugar, salt, and spicespour into pie shelldot evenly with butter. Mix together brown sugar, flour, cinnamon and nutmegsprinkle over top. Bake at 375 degrees for 40 minutes or until browned and bubbly. Cool 15 minutesserve warm or at room temperature.

Heat oven to 350 degrees. In 10-inch skillet, heat 2 tablespoons soy sauce. Add mushroomscook until tender. Add celerycook 5 minutes. Stir in vegetables. Remove from heat. Drain vegetables. In small bowl, stir together almonds, water and remaining 2 tablespoons soy saucepour over vegetable mixture. Cover with lid or foil. Bake 20 minutes or until vegetables are tender. Uncover. Bake 5 minutes longer or until almonds are golden brown. Serve immediately.

Heat butter in skillet over medium-low heat. Add onions, garlic, fresh mushrooms to skillet. Saute mushrooms about 7-8 minutes. Stir in fresh ground black pepper. Remove from heat. Cook pearl barley in chicken broth in skillet over medium-low heat about 20-25 minutes. Stir in onion mixture. Cook an additional 5-10 minutes. Stir in salt to taste. Serve immediately. Serves 4.

Preheat the oven to 400 degrees f. Unroll crescent rolls. Separate triangles into individual squares. Place a small slice of apple on the bottom of each square. Wrap up the dough around the apple slice, pinching the edges to close. Place the dumplings on an ungreased cookie sheet. Mix together butter, cinnamon and sugar. Brush the butter mixture over the dumplings. Bake for 10 minutes or until golden brown. Serve warm with mountain dew soda for dipping. Makes 4 servings.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Prepare pie crust. Beat together evaporated milk, light brown sugar, kahlua and corn syrup. Stir in pumpkin pie spice and salt. Add pumpkin and eggs. Pour mixture into prepared pie crust. Bake for 40 to 45 minutes. Let cool. Serve with whipped topping.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Lightly spray a 9 by 13-inch baking dish with cooking spray. Arrange fillets on dish. Sprinkle with oregano. Combine remaining ingredients in a bowlpour evenly over fillets. Bake for 20 minutes or until fish flakes easily with a fork. Serve with lemon wedges. Serves 4. Recipe courtesy of the mccormick spice company.

Heat olive oil in medium size pot. Add leeks and cauliflower. Cook until tender. Add chicken stock. Cook for 15 minutes. Add nutmeg. Salt and pepper to taste. Cook for another 10 minutes. Serve hot. Serves 6.

Cut the chicken into cubes. Add the soup and the broth. Add the butter. Sprinkle the soup with the salt and pepper. Cook the noodles according to package directions. Drain the noodles. Add the noodles to the crockpot. Cook on low for another hour or until the noodles are done.
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Lightly butter each bagel. Crack 1 egg into each bagel. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Bake for 8-10 minutes. Sprinkle with cheese. Serve warm.

Peel and core 3 apples and cut them into 1/4" slices. Toss the apples with the oats and cinnamon and set aside. Heat soymilk and raisins in saucepan over medium heat for 1 minute stirring constantly. Pour over apple/oat mixture and stir to coat. Pour into an 8" square baking pan and bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes or until apples are tender. Top with walnuts if desired.

Preheat grill to medium high heat. Combine chicken breasts and relish in plastic bag and marinate for 2-4 hours. Prepare grill. Grill chicken on both sides until done. Cut chicken into 1/2 inch cubes. Place in bowl and add remaining relish and salt and pepper to taste. Chill. Serve on bread.

In a large skillet over medium heat heat the oil. Add the onion and garlic and saute until softened. Add the tomatoes and continue sauteing until thickened. Season with salt and pepper and chili pepper flakes to taste. Stir in the balsamic vinegar and sugar. Toss with the fresh basil.

Bring broth to a boil in a medium saucepan over high heat. Add rice, cover, reduce heat to low, and simmer for 45 minutes or until all of the liquid has been absorbed. In the meantime, heat oil over medium heat in a medium saute pan. Add onion, garlic, carrot, frozen peas, corn, and seasonings. Cook until vegetables are tender. Serve over rice.

Cook pasta in boiling salted water for 8-10 minutes or until tender. Meanwhile, cook beef in skillet over medium heat until no longer pink. Drain beef, reserving 1/2 cup fat. Stir in spaghetti sauce and beef. Simmer for 5 minutes. Meanwhile, in a medium bowl, combine pasta with cheeses. Pour beef mixture over pasta and toss. Serve immediately. Makes about 6 servings.

Preheat oven to 350F. Grease an 8-inch square baking dish. Cook macaroni according to package directions. Drain well. In a large bowl, combine macaroni, tuna, cheese, bread crumbs, potato chips, and peppertoss well. Spread mixture in prepared baking dishcover with foil. Bake for 25 minutes. Uncoversprinkle with more cheese. Bake an additional 10 minutes or until top is lightly browned.
Combine tofu and mayonnaise and refrigerate for 1 hour. Drain the liquid from the tofu mixture and add the remaining ingredients. Serve on a bed of lettuce or on whole-wheat bread. Serves 2 to 4.

Peel and devein shrimp. In a large skillet over medium heat, saute garlic and red pepper in olive oil. Add shrimp and continue cooking until shrimp turn pink. Stir in sherry. Add parsley and Old Bay seasoning. Serve hot.

Cut bread into 1/2" cubes. Place in a 9x13" baking pan. In a small saucepan combine cream, milk, vanilla and sugar. Scrape seeds from vanilla pod. Whisk in egg yolks. Pour custard over bread. Cover tightly with foil. Bake for 30 minutes. Remove foil. Sprinkle with golden raisins. Bake for 20 minutes more or until golden. Let stand 10 minutes. Dust with nutmeg. Serve with whipped cream.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees f. Peel sweet potatoes. Cut into 1/2 inch slices. Place in a large pot. Cover with water. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat. Cook until potatoes are tender. Drain. Mash potatoes. Add butter, milk, brown sugar, pumpkin pie spice and blanched slivered almonds. Mix well. Using an ice cream scoop drop mixture onto a greased baking sheet. Bake for 10 minutes. Turn heat off. Let stand for 5 minutes. Serves 8.

In a medium saucepan over medium-high heat, add the leeks and carrots. Cook for 3 minutes. Add the garlic. Cook for 1 more minute. Add the wine. Cook for 2 minutes. Add the broth. Bring to a boil. Cover. Reduce to low. Cook for 15 minutes. Serve with brown rice.

In a large bowl combine broccoli, bacon, cheddar cheese, mayonnaise, raisins, pineapple tidbits, red onion, sugar and vinegar. Stir well to combine. Chill for two hours or overnight. Garnish with additional chopped red onion if desired. Serve with crackers or lettuce leaves for dipping.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Line 2 cookie sheets with waxed paper. Place chocolate wafers in food processorpulse until fine crumbs form. Add almonds and pulse until combined. Add cocoapulse until combined. Add coffeepulse until combined. Add sugarpulse until combined. Add liqueurpulse until combined. Using hands or small spoon, form mixture into balls. Place balls on prepared cookie sheets. Bake for 15 minutes or until slightly softened. Remove from ovenlet cool on cookie sheets. In small bowl, combine cinnamon and sugar. Roll balls in cinnamon sugarplace on waxed paper-lined tray. Store in tightly covered container. Makes about 12 servings.

In a shallow bowl combine the butter and brown sugar. Mix until smooth. Place the biscuits in the bowl and toss to coat each one. In a shallow bowl combine the cinnamon and nuts and set aside. Melt the butter in a large skillet and add the biscuits. Cook for 5 minutes or until lightly browned on each side. Spoon the remaining brown sugar mixture over the biscuits and toss to coat evenly. Sprinkle with nuts. Bake for 10 minutes or until the topping is lightly browned. Serve warm or at room temperature. Makes 12 servings.

Pierce kohlrabi with a fork in several places. Heat a non-stick pan on the stove over medium heat. Melt the butter in the pan. Add the kohlrabi. Sprinkle with the salt and sugar. Cook until softened, about 8-10 minutes. Sprinkle with the parsley. Prepare a bechamel (white) sauce. Make a roux with the butter and flour. Slowly add the chicken broth and stir until the mixture boils. Lower the heat and let the mixture simmer until thick. Add the kohlrabi, parsley and seasonings. Stir. Serve.

Beat butter in a mixer until light and fluffy. Beat in icing sugar. Add cornstarch and flour and mix until smooth. Add vanilla and mix again. Divide dough into 4 portions. Shape each portion into a 3/4-inch thick square. Place the squares on an ungreased baking sheet. Bake in a preheated 350F oven for 20 minutes or until golden. Cool on the pan for 5 minutes. Remove from pan to cool completely on wire racks. Store in an air-tight container. Makes about 60 shortbreads.

Preheat oven to 375f. In a large pot add carrots and enough cold water to cover. Cook over medium high heat until tender. Drain well. In a large bowl combine butter, brown sugar and apple cider vinegar. Add carrots and cook over low heat until heated through. Stir in tarragon. Serve warm.

Cut broccoli into medium pieces and slice green beans into 2-inch pieces. Cook in boiling water for 1 minute. Drain and set aside. Heat oil in large skillet. Add broccoli and green beans. Cook over medium heat for 2-3 minutes. Add cashews and almonds. Toss to coat. Add lemon juice and season with salt to taste. Serve immediately.

In a large saucepan over medium heat, combine the egg yolks, condensed milk, and vanilla. Stir the mixture continuously for 10 minutes, until the mixture is smooth. Stir constantly while gradually adding the heavy cream, one cup at a time. Continue to stir the mixture for 5 minutes after all of the cream has been added. Stir in the chocolate sandwich cookies. Transfer the mixture to a freezer-safe container. Freeze the mixture for 4 hours or overnight before serving.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Beat butter in a medium saucepan over medium heat until it melts. Add sugar and cocoa to butter. Stir in milk until smooth. Continue stirring until mixture begins to boil. Remove from heat. Add eggs one at a time, stirring constantly. Add vanilla. Stir in graham cracker crumbs. Pour filling into an 8-inch pie dish. Bake for 30 minutes. Cool. Sprinkle whipped cream over the pie. Garnish with nuts or chocolate curls.

In a shallow dish, combine coconut milk, orange juice, zest, fish sauce, chili sauce, garlic clove, ginger and cilantro stems. Add fish to dish and turn to coat both sides evenly. Cover tightly with plastic wrap and refrigerate overnight. Bring liquid to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat to low and simmer, covered, for about 45 minutes. Remove salmon from liquid and keep warm. Increase heat to medium-high, bring liquid to a boil. Boil until mixture is reduced to about 1 cup, about 45 minutes. Taste and adjust seasonings with additional fish sauce or chili sauce as needed. Serve salmon with sauce, mint and cilantro sprigs. Serves 4.

In a medium saucepan combine butter and light brown sugar. Heat over medium heat until a dark amber syrup is formed. Add 2 1/2 teaspoons of maple syrup and whisk in. Continue cooking until caramel reaches a darker amber color. Pour into a bowl and let cool. Whisk in 1/4 cup of maple syrup. Store in refrigerator. Serve over ice cream.

Cut bread into 2-inch cubes. Toss bread cubes with sausage in 13×9-inch baking dish sprayed with cooking spray. In medium bowl, whisk eggs, milk, salt and pepperpour over sausage mixture. Sprinkle with cheese. Cover and refrigerate overnight. Bake, uncovered at 350° for 40 minutes or until knife inserted in center comes out clean.

Remove stem and seeds from jalapeno peppers. Fill each jalapeno pepper with a dollop of cream cheese and wrap with bacon strip. Secure with toothpick. Place on baking sheet and broil for 5-7 minutes or until cheese is melted and bacon is crisp. Serve warm or cold. Makes 12 bacon wrapped jalapenos.

Combine flour, baking powder, sugar and salt in a bowl. Blend in egg and orange juice until well mixed. Gradually add water and blend until smooth. Heat a large skillet over medium heat. Coat pan with cooking spray. Drop batter by spoonfuls onto hot skillet. Flip pancakes over when bubbles appear on top. Cook for 2 minutes on each side or until done. Makes 12 servings.

Cut the mushrooms in half or into 1/4 inch slices. Heat the olive oil in a frying pan over medium-high heat. Add the mushrooms. Stir the mushrooms for about 4 minutes or until they are lightly browned. Add the garlic granules and the red wine. Stir to combine. Continue to stir for 2 more minutes or until the mushrooms are coated in the red wine mixture and are just tender. Serve warm on toast or over pasta.

Heat the oven to 350 degrees F. Melt the butter in an 8-inch square baking pan over medium heat. Stir the bread cubes into the hot butter and distribute evenly over the bottom of the pan.Beat the eggs with the milk in a large bowl until well blended. Add the salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste. Pour the egg mixture over the bread cubes in the pan. Bake for 15 minutes or until the edges are lightly browned and the egg mixture is set.Remove from the oven and top with the cheddar cheese. Bake until the cheese is melted. Serve with the toast for dipping. Serves 3 to 4.
Combine eggs, milk, hot dogs and bread crumbs. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Place rhubarb in pie crust and sprinkle with the brown sugar. Cover with the raspberries. In a small saucepan over medium heat, combine the flour and water. Cook until the mixture comes to a boil. Boil for 1 minute and then remove from heat. Add the orange zest and the jelly and stir until the mixture is smooth. Pour over the fruit. Bake for 10 minutes then reduce oven heat to 375 degrees and bake for 35 minutes. Let cool completely before serving. Dust with powdered sugar. Makes 8 servings.

In a small pot heat the water until boiling. Add the dried apples, sage, cinnamon stick, whisky & honey. Allow the mixture to steep for about 15 minutes. Serve in a coffee mug. Add a dash of nutmeg for a special touch.

Remove ends from zucchini and slice in half lengthwise. Remove seeds with spoon. Combine zucchini and corn with pimiento, garlic, oil, salt and pepper. Stir in cheese. Arrange zucchini in shallow baking dish. Spoon filling mixture evenly in zucchini halves. Bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes or until tender. Makes 4 servings.
Boil potatoes until tender. Drain. Melt butter in a skillet. Add garlic and onions. Sauté until tender. Add green beans and potatoes. Toss with creole seasoning. Cook until heated through.

Preheat the broiler. Combine the coriander seeds, cumin seeds, caraway seeds, hot red pepper flakes and coarse salt in a small skillet. Place the skillet over medium heat. Stir the seeds frequently until they darken in color and become aromatic. This will take 5 to 10 minutes. Remove from the heat.

Heat the oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add the onions and cook for 4 minutes. Add the beans and cook for 2 minutes. Add the water and bring to a boil. Add the curry powder and the oxtail soup mix. Season with salt and pepper. Cover the pot and simmer for 20 minutes. Makes 4 servings.

Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F. Grease 12 muffin cups or line a standard 12 cup muffin pan with paper muffin cups. Combine the quinoa flour, quinoa flakes, baking powder, baking soda, and salt in a medium bowl. In a separate bowl combine the eggs, honey, melted butter or margarine, and vanilla. Combine the two mixtures well. Fold in the banana. Fill each muffin cup 2/3 full. Bake the muffins for 20 to 25 minutes or until they are golden brown.

Blend eggs with oil, add vanilla, sugar, salt and flour. Mix well. Roll out to 1/4 inch thick. Cut into circles with a cookie cutter. Spoon a teaspoon of preserves onto one circle. Place another circle on top of preserves. Press edges together with a fork or knife. Bake at 325 degrees for 20 minutes or until done.

Place vanilla wafers in a blender or food processor and process until fine crumbs are formed. Add nuts and pulse to combine. In a small bowl, combine wafer crumbs, butter, vanilla extract, orange juice concentrate, and powdered sugar until combined. Refrigerate 30 minutes or until firm. Form into 1-inch balls. Roll in coconut. Store in an airtight container in refrigerator. Makes approximately 5 dozen balls.

Put the salt cod fish to boil and cook until tender. Remove from broth. Put the salt pork into the broth and cook until brown and tender. Remove pork and slice into strips. Chop fish into small pieces. Cook the onion, raw potatoes and raw carrot together until tender. Add the salt cod fish and pork with broth and boil together until potatoes are tender. Add the canned corn niblets and milk and boil for 15 minutes longer. Remove from heat and add the salt and pepper to taste. Serve with crackers or oyster crackers.

Preheat oven to 325f degrees. In a medium saucepan over medium low heat combine the eggs, cream, sugar and egg yolks and cook, stirring constantly until the mixture thickens and coats the back of a spoon, about five minutes. Remove from heat and add the kahlua and grand marnier and stir until well blended. Pour mixture into six greased ramekins or custard cups and place on a baking sheet. Bake for fifteen minutes or until the top is set. Cool for ten minutes and remove from the ramekins. Sprinkle with chocolate chips and serve warm with whipped cream on the side.

Combine coconut, corn flakes and macadamia nuts in a bowl and set aside. Beat eggs and milk in a shallow bowl until blended. Dip bread in egg mixture. Place in coconut mixture and coat evenly. Heat a fry pan over medium heat and add vegetable oil. Place bread into fry pan and cook until golden brown on one side 2 to 3 minutes. Turn and cook other side until golden brown. Top with maple syrup and whipped cream.
Cook the noodles in boiling water until tender. Drain and toss with sour cream. Melt the butter and pot cheese together. Spread on top of the noodles. Serve.

Heat bacon grease in large skillet over medium heat. Add onion and saute until soft. Stir in flour and cook until it is light brown stirring constantly. Stir in salt and pepper and bay leaf and stir for about 2 minutes. Add tomatoes with their juices and cook over medium heat for about 10 minutes or until mixture thickens. Add sugar and cook for another 10 minutes or until mixture thickens. Add celery leaves and serve over buttered biscuits or toast.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper. In a bowl, whisk together buttermilk, egg, mustard powder, 1/4 tsp each salt and black pepper. In a shallow dish combine breadcrumbs and parsley. Dip fish in buttermilk mixture. Coat with crumb mixture. Place fish on baking sheet. Bake until fish flakes easily with a fork, 25 to 30 minutes. Sprinkle with almonds. Makes 4 servings.
Pour the rum into a warmed glass. Add the milk and cinnamon and sugar. Stir gently. Enjoy while snuggled in your favorite quilt.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees.In a small bowl mix together broccoli, roasted red pepper and cheese. Set aside.In a small bowl whisk together the egg and milk. Set aside.In a medium bowl combine the flour and onion powder. Set aside.Heat a small skillet over medium heat and add the butter. When butter is melted add the flour mixture and stir constantly until a paste forms. Add the egg mixture and continue stirring. Add the broccoli cheese mixture and stir to combine. Remove from heat.Place wonton skins in a shallow bowl and fill with mixture. Fold in half and press edges together to seal.Place on ungreased baking sheet. Bake for 15 minutes or until golden brown. Makes about 35 tarts.

Cut potatoes in half. Place in an 11x7-inch baking dish sprayed with cooking spray. Combine butter, onion and flour in a saucepan over low heat. Stir until flour is smooth. Remove from heatgradually stir in milk. Cook over low heat until thickened and bubblystir constantly. Remove from heatstir in cheese until melted. Pour over potatoes. Bake uncovered at 350 degrees F for 45 minutes or until potatoes are tender. Makes 6 servings.

Peel and slice potatoes 1/4-inch thick. Heat oil in skillet over medium-high heat until hot. Add potatoes and onions and cook for 10 minutes or until potatoes are tender and browned, stirring often. Remove from heat. Stir in butter, sour cream, salt, and fresh ground black pepper. Makes about 4 servings.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f (175 degrees c).In a medium bowl, mix together the macaroni, tomatoes and seasonings.Pour into a greased casserole dish.Melt the butter in a small saucepan over medium heat.Pour over the macaroni.Bake for 35 minutes in the preheated oven.

In a small bowl combine honey and soy sauce. In a large skillet cook broccoli and mushrooms in oil over high heat for 1 minute. Stir in peanuts and red pepper flakes. Add soy sauce mixture and stir-fry sauce. Cook and stir until heated through. Add onions and carrots. Cook and stir until crisp-tender. Serve over hot rice.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).In a 13x9x2-inch baking dish, combine fish with olive oil, lemon juice and sea salt and pepper to taste. Arrange fish in a single layer. Bake for 10 minutes or until the fish is opaque and flakes easily with a fork. In a bowl, combine remaining olive oil with lemon juice and capers and toss with arugula to coat. Divide the fish and arugula between two plates and serve immediately.

Boil noodles until done. Drain. In a 9x13 casserole dish, layer noodles, mushroom soup and tuna. Sprinkle with shredded cheese. Bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes or until cheese is melted and bubbly. Serves 6.

In a large pot bring broth to boil. Add pasta and cook 5 minutes. Drain and set aside. Heat the oil and garlic in a large frying pan over medium high heat. Add the spinach and saute until wilted. Season with the salt and pepper. Add the beans and pasta to the pan. Add the parmesan cheese. Toss until cheese is melted. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Roll out crust and place in pie plate. Brush edge with milk and sprinkle with cheese. Bake for about 5 minutes. In a large skillet saute bacon until crisp. Drain off all but 2 tablespoons bacon fat. Add onion and cook until tender. Add mushrooms and cook until they are tender. Add asparagus and cook until bright green. Cool mixture. In a small bowl beat together eggs and italian seasoning. Beat in milk. Add mushroom mixture and bacon. Pour into crust. Bake for about 35 minutes or until center is set. Let quiche stand for about 5 minutes before serving.

Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Rinse the turkey legs under cold running water and pat dry with paper towels. In a medium bowl combine the sea salt, black pepper, and molasses. Place the turkey legs in the bowl and rub in the seasoning until completely coated. Place the turkey legs in a single layer in a 9×13 inch baking pan. Bake for 40 minutes in the preheated oven, or until the meat is starting to brown and pull away from the bone. While the turkey legs are in the oven, combine the ketchup, red wine vinegar, and Worcestershire sauce in a medium bowl. Remove the turkey legs from the oven and brush with half the ketchup mixture. Return the turkey legs to the oven and continue baking for an additional 30 minutes or until the meat is cooked through. While the turkey legs are cooking, combine the onion and coconut oil in a small saucepan over medium-low heat. Cook the onion until it begins to car

Wash the mixed greens well and dry them thoroughly on paper towels. Cut the radishes into slices, the strawberries into pieces, the spring onion into slices, the red pepper into strips and the coriander into pieces. Arrange them on a plate and dress with the vinaigrette just before serving.

Mix cake mix with diet sprite until smooth. Pour into greased and floured cake pans and bake as directed on cake mix box. While cake is cooking mix together cool whip and gelatin, then spread over cake when it comes out of the oven. Sprinkle with coconut and serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Season the chicken with the ranch dressing mix. Spread the breadcrumbs on a plate. Coat the chicken with the low-fat sour cream and then with the bread crumbs. Place the chicken in a lightly greased casserole dish. Bake uncovered for 40-50 minutes or until cooked through. Serve hot. Makes 4 servings. Serve with your favorite green salad.

Preheat a large nonstick skillet over medium heat. Add the oil and eggs. Stir with a fork until the eggs are cooked through. Remove from the heat and stir in the ranch dressing. Season with the mustard and parsley. Stir in the cheese and garlic powder. Serve immediately.

Peel and grate the carrots. Boil them in a small amount of water for 15 minutes or until soft. Drain and place in a large bowl. Add the remaining ingredients and mix well. Pour into a greased 8 x 8-inch pan. Bake at 350F for 30 minutes or until golden brown. Cool and cut into squares. Serve with whipped cream or ice cream.

In a large mixing bowl, mash the avocado. Add the peas, nonfat sour cream, green onion, cilantro, lime juice, green chili, garlic clove, and salt and black pepper. Mix well. Chill 1 hour. Serve with tortilla chips.

Heat 1 Tbsp of vegetable oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Season chicken breasts with cinnamon and 1/4 tsp of each dried parsley and thyme. Add to skillet and cook about 3 minutes per side, until cooked through. Remove from pan and set aside. Meanwhile, in a small bowl stir together remaining 2 Tbsp of vegetable oil, orange juice, onion and ginger. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Add cooked rice and stir to combine. Add cooked chicken and stir to combine. Garnish with remaining parsley and serve.

In a small bowl, combine honey, mustard and wine and mix well. In a shallow dish, combine the salt and pepper with the olive oil and mix well. Add the pork chops and coat both sides well with the mixture. Heat a large skillet over medium high heat and add the pork chops and cook for about 4 minutes on each side until golden brown and cooked through. Add the honey mustard mixture to the pan and cook until thickened. Serve hot or warm with your choice of starch and a vegetable of your choice. Serves 4.

Mix together butter, mustard and honey until smooth. Toss bread crumbs with pecans. Coat fish with mustard mixture. Sprinkle with bread crumb mixture. Bake in a preheated oven at 400 degrees for 15 minutes. Top with parsley, cheese and bake another 5 minutes.

Peel and mince 2 cloves of garlic and 1 inch of ginger. Add minced ginger and garlic to a bowl of flour and mix well. Add a pinch of salt and pepper to the flour mixture and set aside. In a bowl combine 1 tbsp of vegetable oil and 1 tbsp of orange juice with 1/4 tsp of orange zest and a pinch of salt and pepper. Place 1/4 cup of oil in a skillet and bring to 350 degrees f. Add tilapia fillets and dredge them in flour mixture until they are coated well. Shake off excess flour and then dunk each fillet in orange juice mixture and place in skillet. Cook until the fish is golden brown and cooked through (about 3 minutes on each side). Garnish with green onions and serve with rice or noodles.

In a large bowl, stir together heavy cream, sweetened condensed milk and instant espresso powder until well blended. Place in the refrigerator for at least 2 hours or overnight. Remove from refrigerator and add yogurt and cinnamon. Churn according to manufacturer’s instructions. Spoon into a freezer-proof container and place in freezer for at least 12 hours before serving. If desired, garnish with a whole fig and a sprinkle of cinnamon before serving. Serve with shortbread cookies or biscotti.

Prepare 1 ripe avocado. Peel and slice in half. Remove pit. Mash avocado with a fork. Add a little water, if desired. Add 1 Tablespoon of chopped onion. Add 1/4 teaspoon of salt. Mix well. Serve immediately.

Pour boiling water over sugar-free raspberry gelatin and stir until dissolved. Add cold water and stir until fully dissolved and mixture is slightly cool to touch. Fold in sugar-free cool whip. Refrigerate for several hours or overnight. Serve immediately or store in refrigerator for up to two days. Makes about 2 cups.

In a large skillet, saute frankfurters in butter until browned, stirring occasionally. Remove and keep warm. In the same skillet, saute onions in butter until tender. Stir in the cream of celery soup and milk. Heat through. Stir in the tomato and noodles. Sprinkle with parsley. Serve with frankfurters.

Mix the mayonnaise, cream cheese and salsa until blended. Stir in mustard and bacon. Spread mixture evenly over the tortillas. Top with lettuce and tomatoes. Cut each tortilla in half lengthwise to make 4 sandwiches. Wrap each sandwich in plastic wrap or place in plastic bag. Refrigerate until ready to serve. Makes 4 sandwiches.

Bring a pot of water to a boil. Salt the water. Cook the pasta according to package directions until al dente. Drain the pasta and place it into a serving bowl. Add the beans. In a frying pan over medium heat, saute the turkey sausage until brown. Add the tomatoes and cook for another 30 seconds or so. Add the cooked pasta mixture to the sausage/tomato mixture and toss well. Add the basil and asiago cheese and toss well again. Serve hot.

Cook the asparagus in boiling water for 4 minutes or until crisp-tenderdrain, and run under cold water. Drain, then place in a medium bowladd lemon juice, mustard, oil, salt, and pepper to taste. Toss to coat. Serve at room temperature. Serves 2.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees F. Combine the garlic and rosemary in a small bowl. Place the chicken breasts in a large shallow baking dish. Stir the olive oil and the rosemary garlic mixture together. Pour the mixture over the chicken breasts. Sprinkle the lemon over the top of the chicken breasts. Season the chicken breasts with the grill seasoning. Drizzle the wine over the top of the chicken breasts and cover the dish with foil. Bake in the oven for 20 minutes. Uncover the dish and continue baking until the chicken breasts are cooked through and the chicken breasts are browned. Serve immediately. Serves 4 to 6 people.

Place brussels sprouts and green beans in a large bowl. In a large skillet melt butter. Add garlic. Saute for 1 minute. Add brussels sprouts and green beans. Stir. Cover and cook over low heat for 5 minutes. Stir in balsamic vinegar. Season with salt and pepper. Serve immediately. Makes 6 servings.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. In a large bowl, combine the breadcrumbs, parmesan cheese, paprika, dried thyme, garlic salt, and ground red pepper. In another large bowl, combine the buttermilk and margarine. Dip chicken in buttermilk mixturedrain. Dip into the breadcrumb mixture to coatplace in a single layer in a shallow baking dish. Bake for 30 minutes. Remove from oventurn chicken over. Bake for an additional 15 minutes. Makes 4 servings.

In a saute pan over medium heat, melt butter. Add shallots and saute until tender. Add mushrooms and saute until tender. Add dry white wine. Add artichoke hearts and simmer until tender. Add lemon juice. Season with parsley, pimiento, salt and pepper. Add shrimp and cook until done. Serve immediately. Serves 4.

In a small bowl combine the yeast with the water and sugar. Stir well and let it set for about 10 minutes. In another bowl combine the egg, milk, butter, salt and 3 cups of flour. Stir well. Stir in the yeast mixture. Add the remaining flour one cup at a time. Knead until the dough is smooth. Place in a greased bowl. Let rise until doubled. Punch down and form into 8 rolls. Place in a greased 9x13 pan. Cover with plastic wrap and let rise in a warm place for about an hour. Bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes. Serve warm.

In a medium bowl combine the chicken and the eggs. Stir in the celery and the green onions. In a small bowl combine the sweet pickle relish with the mayonnaise. Add salt and pepper to taste. Pour over the chicken mixture. Sprinkle with the fresh curly-leaf parsley. Serves 4.

Place all of the above ingredients into a large pot and bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat to simmer over medium low heat. Add more butter if it gets too thick. Cook for 5 minutes or so to get all of the flavors to combine. Let cool before use. Great with BBQ sandwiches.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In large bowl combine flour, sugar and baking powder. Blend in salt. In another bowl combine milk, egg and butter. Add to flour mixture. Add plums. Spoon into greased muffin cups. Bake 350 degrees for 25 minutes. Makes 12 muffins.

Place potatoes in a large pot of boiling salted water. Cook until tender. Drain well. Transfer to a large bowl. Add broth and kale and mash until smooth. Season with garlic powder and pepper. Makes 4 servings.

Cut the beef into 1 1/2-inch cubes. Heat oil in a large stockpot. Add beef and cook over medium heat until no longer pink. Add garlic, green pepper and onion. Cook and stir until onion is softened. Add potatoes and cook 3 minutes. Add water, beef broth and Italian sausage. Bring to boil. Reduce heat and simmer until potatoes are tender, about 15 minutes. Add beans and basil. Simmer 10 minutes longer or until flavors blend. Serve with the biscuits.

Bring 6 quarts water to boil in large pot. Add green beans. Boil 2 minutes. Drain and run under cold water. Add asparagus. Boil 1 minute. Drain and run under cold water. Boil cherry tomatoes 15 secondsdrain. Cut chicken into bite-sized pieces. Combine all salad ingredients. Whisk together oil and vinegar. Add mustard and whisk again. Toss salad with dressing.

Preheat oven to 350*F. Grease a baking dish. In a bowl beat together eggs and milk. Mix in ham and onion. Sprinkle in Ortega Chile pepper and season to taste with salt and pepper. Pour into baking dish and bake for 40-45 minutes or until firm. Sprinkle with chives and serve with sour cream and grated Cheddar Cheese. Makes 8 servings.

Melt butter in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add onion and saute for 2-3 minutes. Add tomato paste and garlic. Stir for 3 minutes. Add the water and bring to a boil. Add the grits and stir. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 1 hour, stirring occasionally. Stir in bacon. Season with salt and pepper. Serve immediately.
In a small bowl mix the tomato sauce, brown sugar, apple cider vinegar, lemon juice, dijon mustard, black pepper, garlic powder, red pepper flakes.

Preheat the oven to 180 C/350 F/Gas 4. Line a 20cm/8in loose-bottomed tart tin with the pastry. Line the pastry with baking parchment and fill with dried fruit and nuts, then blind-bake for 10 minutes. Remove the beans and parchment and return the pastry case to the oven for a further 5 minutes to dry out the base. Melt the butter with the sugar, cherries and walnuts and spread over the base. Bake for 10 minutes until golden brown. Remove from the oven and leave to cool slightly. Whisk the egg with a splash of lemon juice and brush over the base. Sprinkle with icing sugar and leave until the egg is set before serving. Serve with double cream or ice cream. Makes 10 servings.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees. Peel and slice potatoes. Toss in a large bowl with dried thyme, cumin powder and sumac. Combine flour and salt in a small bowl. Dredge each slice of potato in flour mixture. Spray a cookie sheet with cooking spray. Arrange the potato slices on the cookie sheet. Dot each slice with a small pat of butter. Bake for 15-20 minutes or until browned and tender. Makes about 12 servings.

Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Brown the hamburger with the onions. Drain grease. Add the taco seasoning and water and cook for 1-2 minutes. Pour into 2-quart casserole dish. Spread the tomato paste over the top. Sprinkle the cheese over the top. Bake until cheese is melted, about 10 minutes. Sprinkle with taco chips. Serve.

Sift the flour into a bowl. Add salt and pepper. In a separate bowl beat together water and tomatoes. Add tomato mixture to flour and stir well. Heat the olive oil and 1 tablespoon of the water in a large skillet over medium high heat. Add the onions and bell peppers. Sauté 5 minutes or until they are soft. Add the garlic and cook 1 minute. Add the tomato mixture and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat and simmer for 10 minutes. Add the fresh basil and stir. Cook 5 minutes longer. Serve with a hearty pasta.

In a large saucepan combine rhubarb and water. Cook over medium heat until rhubarb is tender and mixture is thickened, about 10 minutes. Remove from heat and add sugar. Stir in gelatin and milk. Divide among 6 bowls and chill for 1 hour or overnight. Serve with whipped cream and mint sprigs.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Butter a 9 x 13 inch baking pan. In a medium saucepan combine the macaroni with enough water to cover. Bring to a boil and cook until tender. Drain and return to the pan. In a large bowl combine the eggs and milk. Stir in the soup. Add the macaroni mixture and stir. Stir in the cheese and paprika. Pour into the baking pan. Bake for 1 hour or until golden brown.

Combine all ingredients in a blender or food processor and puree until smooth. Serve chilled as a dip with raw vegetables or crackers, or as a spread on a sandwich or wrap. Makes about 2 cups. Serves 4-6.

Heat oil in pan. Add chickencook for 5-8 minutes or until golden. Stir in broth, milk, mustard, leek soup mix and broccoli. Bring to a boil. Cover and simmer for 5 minutes. Stir in roasted pepper. Serve with cooked rice and sprinkle with cheese.

Place the shallot in the bowl of a food processor. Add the tomatoes and olives. Pulse until you have a chunky paste. Add the capers and the oregano and pulse a few times. With the machine running, pour the oil in a thin stream until it is thoroughly blended. Season with the black pepper. Spread the mixture on a plate and chill in the refrigerator for 2 hours. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F. Rinse the fish in cold water. Pat it dry and sprinkle it with salt and pepper. Place the fish on a baking sheet. Brush the fish with the olive oil. Bake the fish in the oven for 15 to 20 minutes, or until it flakes easily with a fork. Serve the fish on a bed of the tomato-olive tapenade.

In a small bowl stir together yogurt, mustard and garlic. In another bowl stir together ginger and seasonings. Sprinkle chicken with seasonings and coat evenly. Spread yogurt mixture over chicken. Place in a lightly greased 9 x 13 baking pan. Bake uncovered at 350 degrees for 40 to 45 minutes or until chicken juice runs clear when cut near bone. Makes 4 servings. Serve over rice, noodles or potato wedges.

Heat the oil in a large saute pan over mediumhigh heat. Add the onions and cook until translucent and lightly browned about 10 minutes. Add the thyme leaves and cook for 1 minute. Add the sweet potatoes and cook for 2-3 minutes. Add the water, cover and cook until potatoes are tender about 15 minutes. Remove from the heat. Mash the potatoes with a potato masher. Stir in the butter and sour cream. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Garnish with fresh thyme leaves. Serves 4-6.
Mix together the first six ingredients. Stir in tuna. Spread on crackers. Sprinkle with paprika. Serves 12.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a 9x13x2 inch pan, combine crushed pineapple, frozen blackberries, and peach slices. In a medium bowl, combine cake mix, pecans and sugar. Cut in butter until mixture resembles fine crumbs. Sprinkle over fruit. Bake 50 minutes or until golden brown. Serve warm with whipped cream or vanilla ice cream.

Heat oven to 400°F. Spray 6 muffin cups with cooking spray. Cut each muffin in half. Arrange muffin halves in cups. Top with Canadian bacon and Swiss cheese. Beat eggs with milk in a small bowl. Pour over bacon and cheese in each cup. Bake 13-15 minutes or until eggs are set. Remove from oven. Sprinkle with black pepper and a bit of cayenne pepper. Serve with Hollandaise Sauce.

In a large skillet saute the butter and oil over medium heat until the butter is melted. Add the garlic and saute until golden brown. Sprinkle in the sage and cook for 1 minute. Add the chicken and potatoes and season with salt & pepper. Cook for 4 minutes on each side until golden brown. Deglaze with the chicken broth. Add the parsley & serve over hot cooked rice.

Place potatoes in a pot and cover with water. Bring water to a boil and cook until potatoes are tender. Drain the potatoes and return them to the pot. Add the butter and mash the potatoes. Add the flour and milk and mash the potatoes again. Season with salt and pepper. Add the paprika. Pour the potatoes into a baking dish. Combine the chicken bouillon with the water and pour the mixture over the potatoes. Top with the cheese and bake at 350 for approximately 20 minutes. Serve immediately.

Melt butter in a large saucepan over medium heat. Whisk in flour. Cook for 1 minute. Add onion. Cook and stir for 2 minutes. Stir in sugar and milk. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 5 minutes or until thickened. Stir in green beans and sour cream. Cook for 10 minutes or until heated through. Pour into a 2-quart casserole dish and sprinkle with swiss cheese. Bake at 350 for 20 minutes or until heated through and top is golden brown. Garnish with corn flakes. Serve hot.

Slice the bread into four equal pieces. Spread hot pepper jelly on top of each slice of bread. Top with honey-baked ham. Sprinkle with Monterey Jack pepper cheese. Top with sliced smoked turkey. Cook the eggs. Dip the egg slices into the hot sauce and then into the unsalted butter. Place on top of the sandwiches. Serve with french fries or baked potato wedges.

Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Add the celery and bell peppers and cook for 2-3 minutes or until the vegetables are tender. Drain the vegetables. Place the chicken breasts in a zip-lock bag and add the dressing mix and mayonnaise. Place the vegetables in a separate zip-lock bag and add the dried dill weed. Shake both bags until the meat and vegetables are fully coated with the dressing mixes. Refrigerate for several hours. Drain the vegetables and cut into bite size pieces. Chop the chicken into small pieces. Combine the vegetables and the chicken and mix well. Chill. Serve cold.

Preheat broiler. Remove stems from mushroom caps. Wash caps well. In a small skillet over medium heat, combine sausage, garlic and scallion. Cook until browned. Drain sausage mixture. Remove pan from heat. In a large skillet over medium-high heat, combine sausage mixture with egg, bread crumbs, soy sauce and water. Cook until egg is set. Stuff caps with sausage mixture. Place caps on ungreased pan. Broil until golden. Sprinkle with parsley. Serves 4.

In a medium saucepan, heat 1/2 cup water to boiling. Whisk in 1/2 cup sugar until dissolvedcook 3 minutes or until syrupy. Remove from heatstir in peanut butter and vanilla until smooth. Spoon peanut butter mixture evenly over ice cream in dishes. Top with peanuts and whipped cream.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Lightly spray a 9x13 inch baking dish with non-stick spray. Set aside. In a large mixing bowl add the mashed sweet potatoes, sugar, evaporated milk, eggs and vanilla extract and mix well. In a small bowl combine the flour, baking powder and saltstir well. Stir the flour mixture into the potato mixture until combined. Spread evenly in the prepared baking dish. In a small bowl add the coconut and nutsmix well. Sprinkle evenly on top of the potato mixture. Bake at 350 degrees F for 45 minutes or until lightly browned. Serve warm.
In a large bowl, combine couscous, milk, honey, vanilla extract, sugar and ground cinnamon. Let stand for 5 minutes. Add fruit, nuts and heavy cream.
Bring milk and pastina to boil in a small saucepan. Add eggs and stir until just set. Add Parmigiano-Reggiano Cheese and season with salt and pepper. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Lightly grease a 13 x 9 inch baking pan with cooking spray. Place potatoes into the prepared baking pan. Bake in preheated oven for 30 minutes, or until tender, turning once. Meanwhile, combine ginger and steak in a food processor. Blend until fine. Heat a large nonstick skillet coated with cooking spray over medium high heat. Sprinkle the steak mixture evenly into the skillet. Cook and stir until steak mixture is browned. Stir in sweet potatoes. Stir in the sweet chili sauce and lemon juice. Serve immediately.

Slice the rolls lengthwise. Layer ham, gruyere and cream cheese on the rolls. Butter the rolls. Place in a large skillet over medium heat. Add butter and Worcestershire. Melt and mix well. Pour over the rolls. Sprinkle with the parmesan cheese and onion flakes. Bake until the cheese is melted and the rolls are hot. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Place biscuits on baking sheet. Bake in the preheated oven until golden brown and crisp, about 10 minutes. Slice each biscuit in half horizontally. Spread about 2 tablespoons of pasta sauce on each biscuit half. Sprinkle evenly with mozzarella cheese and pepperoni. Sprinkle with green pepper, onion, black olives, and mushrooms. Bake in the preheated oven until cheese is melted and heated through, about 10 minutes. Sprinkle each pizza with Parmesan cheese before serving. Makes 4 servings.

Cut the top off the bell peppers and remove the seeds. Cook the rice in the water in a saucepan over medium heat until tender. Meanwhile, brown the ground round in a large skillet over medium heat until no longer pink. Add onions and garlic salt and cook until onions are tender. Stir in the tomato sauce, rice, salt and pepper. Stuff the mixture into the bell pepper halves. Bake at 350 degrees for 1 hour or until peppers are tender.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease and flour a bundt pan. In a bowl combine cocoa and cake mix. In another bowl combine eggs, vegetable oil and pudding mix. Beat well. Add coffee and liqueur. Stir in cocoa mixture. Pour into prepared pan. Bake for 1 hour. Remove from oven. Cool in pan on wire rack for 10 minutes. Invert onto serving plate. Dust with powdered sugar. Garnish with whipped cream.

In a Dutch oven or stockpot, combine beans and water and bring to a boil. Cook 2 minutes. Add onion and garlic cloves. Reduce heat. Cover and simmer until beans are tender, 1 1/2 to 2 hours. Add ham hocks and cook 10 minutes. Remove ham hocks and discard. Season with salt and pepper. Stir in parsley. Serve hot with cornbread.

Heat the oil in a large pan over medium heat and add onions. Cook until onions are soft but not browned. Add tomatillos and tomatoes and continue to cook until tomatillos are soft and tomatoes are very soft and slightly mushy. Add garlic and cook for a few minutes more. Cool slightly and then process in a food processor until almost smooth. Stir in the lime juice and season with pepper to taste and a small amount of hot pepper sauce if desired. Serve immediately or refrigerate.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. Line cookie sheets with parchment paper or grease lightly. In a large mixing bowl combine all-purpose flour, baking soda and salt. Beat in butter until mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Stir in nutmeg. Mix in bananas, eggs and vanilla. Stir in sugar. Fold in chocolate chips. Drop by rounded teaspoonfuls on prepared baking sheets. Bake for 10-12 minutes or until golden brown. Cool on wire racks. Store in airtight container. Makes about 3 dozen bars.

Unroll crescent rollsseparate into triangles and press triangles together. Cut each triangle in half. Place on ungreased cookie sheetsbake at 375 degrees for 12 minutes or until golden brown. Combine cream cheese with Miracle Whip, lemon juice, pepper and green onions. Spread about 2 tablespoons cheese mixture onto each triangle. Top with imitation crabmeat. Bake at 375 degrees for 12 minutes or until cheese is melted. Sprinkle with parsley. Makes 3 dozen hors d'oeuvres or 6 main dish servings.
Mix together the breadcrumbs, parmesan cheese, butter, salt and pepper. Sprinkle over the fillets. Bake for 10 minutes or until cooked through.

In a large bowl whisk together the egg yolks, brown sugar, flour and salt. In a medium pan over low heat stir the milk. When it starts to boil pour the milk into the egg mixture whisking constantly. Add the vanilla extract. Pour into a 2 quart casserole dish. Bake at 350 degrees F for about an hour or until the center is set. Cool. Serves 6.

Heat olive oil in large frying pan over medium heat. Add garlic and saute for 5 minutes. Add chili peppers to pan. Cook for 2 more minutes. Stir in spaghetti. Cook spaghetti until it is al dente. Add parsley. Mix well. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Combine the salt, fresh ground black pepper and the rosemary in a small bowl and mix well. Sprinkle the seasoning blend evenly over both sides of the chicken breasts. Place the chicken breasts in a baking dish. Spoon half of the marmalade over the breasts. Spoon the sherry vinegar over the top of the breasts. Spoon the remaining marmalade over the top of the breasts. Spoon the olive oil over the top of the breasts and cover the dish with foil. Bake for 35 minutes. Remove from the oven. Remove the foil cover the baking dish. Bake for an additional 5 minutes. Remove from the oven. Serve immediately. Serves 4.
Peel potatoes. Boil them for 15 minutes until they are soft. Cut into cubes. Add watercress and boil again for 15 minutes. Add corn, peas and butter. Serve with salt and pepper. Serves 4.

In a large bowl combine the potatoes, cheese and garlic powder. Stir in enough broth to make a spreadable consistency. Mash with a potato masher. In a medium-size skillet over medium heat, saute the spinach in the butter until just wilted. Add the soup mixture to the skillet. Cook, stirring constantly, until the mixture comes to a boil. Add the milk. Bring to a boil again. Serve immediately. Serves 4.
Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Combine mayonnaise with cornbread mix. Stir in beaten eggs and oil. Bake in a greased loaf pan or muffin tins for about 30 minutes or until golden brown.

Heat oil in a saucepan over medium-high heat. Sauté onion and carrot until tender. Stir in garlic and cook for one minute. Stir in split peas. Add ham and stir well. Add enough water or stock to cover. Stir in marjoram and season with pepper and salt. Simmer uncovered for 1 hour until peas are tender. Remove and discard ham. Puree soup in a blender or food processor. Return the soup to the pot. Reheat gently. Serve immediately.

Heat a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Season the beef with the salt and pepper and cook in 2 batches until cooked through. Assemble the burgers with the mozzarella and french fries. Add a dollop of gravy and top with the caramelized onions. Makes 6 burgers.

Combine all ingredients except peaches in a slow cooker. Cook on low for 7 hours or until desired consistency. Stir in peaches and cook for another hour. Transfer to an airtight container and store in the refrigerator. Makes approximately one pint.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease and flour a 10-inch tube pan. In a large bowl, sift together flour and sugar. In a medium bowl beat egg yolks and milk until smooth. Add to dry ingredients and beat until smooth. Beat egg whites in a clean, dry bowl until soft peaks form. Gradually add 1/4 cup sugar and beat until stiff peaks form. Fold egg whites into batter. Spoon into prepared pan. Bake for 1 hour and 15 minutes or until cake tests done. Cool for 10 minutes. Turn out onto a wire rack and cool completely.

In a salad bowl toss together the spinach, strawberries, kiwi, almonds, onion rings, and cheese. Divide evenly among four plates. Grill chicken breasts for approximately three minutes on each side or until cooked through. Top each salad with chicken breasts, then sprinkle with poppy seeds. Serve immediately.

In a shallow bowl combine the onion powder, garlic powder, dried chipotle powder, salt and brown sugar. Mix well. Place the pork tenderloins in the bowl. Coat both sides of the pork tenderloins with the spice mixture. In a skillet over medium heat, sear the pork tenderloins in oil for 2 minutes on each side. Serve with your favorite vegetable.

Heat 1 tablespoon oil in 12 inch heavy skillet over high heat. Add brats and cook, turning once, until browned on all sides. Remove from heat. Add remaining oil. Add onions and peppers and cook until softened. Add brats back to skillet. Add caraway seed and paprika. Cook 1 minute. Serve on toasted rolls with mustard. Serves 4.

Brown the chicken breasts in the oil. Remove the breasts from the pan and set aside. Add the onion to the pan and saute until tender. Add the carrots and cauliflower. Add the broth and herbs. Cover and simmer until the vegetables are tender. Add the pasta and cook according to package directions. Season with salt and pepper. Add the chicken breasts and heat through. Serve with the parmesan cheese.

Heat oil in a saucepan over medium heat. Add cumin seed. Add garlic cloves. Saute until fragrant. Add onion. Cook for 3-4 minutes or until lightly browned. Add green lentils. Stir to combine. Add water. Bring to a boil. Cover. Reduce heat to low. Cook for 20-25 minutes or until lentils are tender but not broken up. Stir in salt to taste. Add cayenne pepper to taste. Remove from heat. Serve.

Cook pasta according to package directions. Cool 5 minutes. Drain and rinse with cold water. Transfer to a large bowl. Add ham, celery and onion. In a small bowl combine mayonnaise, lime juice and honey. Add to pasta mixture. Stir in cilantro and melon. Serve immediately. Serves 8-10.

Preheat oven to 400. Combine chicken with 1 tablespoon of mustard, ham, spinach, 1 cup bread crumbs, 2 tablespoons parsley, goat cheese and 1/2 teaspoon pepper. Mix well. Stuff chicken halves. Lay on baking sheet. Combine remaining bread crumbs with oil, 1 tablespoon parsley, 1/4 teaspoon pepper and remaining 2 tablespoons mustard. Sprinkle evenly over chicken. Bake for 15 minutes. Turn chicken over and bake for 10 minutes more or until juices run clear when center of chicken is cut to bone. Sprinkle with remaining parsley before serving.

In a shallow dish combine flour and salt and pepper. Dip chicken breast in the flour mixture coat well on all sides. Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Add chicken breaststirring frequently, brown chicken on both sides for 5 minutes or until done. Remove from skillet. In a small bowl combine green olives, sherry wine, and thyme. Stir in chicken broth. Pour sauce over chicken in skillet. Simmer for 1 minute or until heated through. Makes 2 servings.

Boil gnocchi in salted water until tender. Drain and set aside. Melt 1 tablespoon of olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the garlic and basil and saute until garlic is fragrant and basil is wilted. Add the gnocchi and stir to combine. Sprinkle on the cheese and toss to coat. Divide among serving plates and top each portion with the prosciutto and drizzle the remaining tablespoon of olive oil over top.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. Pound pork chops between sheets of wax paper to tenderize. Place pork chops in a shallow roasting pan or baking dish. Mix together margarine and cinnamon in a bowl until smooth. Spoon mixture over pork chops. Cut apples into wedges and arrange around pork chops. Bake for 45 minutes to 1 hour until juices run clear when a chop is pierced with a knife. Serve on rice or noodles.
Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add garlic and cook for 30 seconds. Add peas and cook for 1 minute. Stir in rice and cook for 2 minutes. Stir in cilantro.

Mix sugar, butter and milk in saucepan. Cook over low heat. In a separate bowl mix together flour and cocoa powder. Add flour mixture to milk mixture and stir constantly until thick. Add vanilla extract. Serve warm over pancakes.

Combine 1 1/2 cups sugar and 2 cups water in a medium saucepan. Bring to a boil over medium heat and stir until sugar is dissolved. Remove from heat and allow to cool completely. Stir in vanilla extract and ground cinnamon.Pour into 2 glasses and cover. Freeze overnight.Serve with vanilla-flavored soymilk and slivered almonds. Garnish with mint sprig. Serve immediately.

Combine all dry ingredients. Make a well in the middle and add egg yolks and creamed corn. Mix well. Add egg whites and yogurt. Stir well. Heat oil in fry pan over medium heat. Spoon batter into pan. Cook for about 15-18 minutes on each side until lightly browned. Remove from pan. Serve with honey. Makes 12 small cornbread.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease two loaf pans.In a large bowl, mix together the flour, baking powder, baking soda, cinnamon, and salt.In a medium bowl, mix together the applesauce, granulated sugar, egg whites, vanilla extract, and bananas. Beat until smooth. Stir the banana mixture into the flour mixture until just combined. Pour the batter into the prepared pans.Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center of the loaves comes out clean, about 45 minutes. Cool in the pans for 10 minutes before removing to wire racks to cool completely.

Melt baking chocolate with butter and stir in eggs. Add sugar and vanilla. Stir in cake flour and nuts. Roll into small balls. Roll in coconut. Place on wax paper and refrigerate until firm. Makes about 6 dozen.

In crock pot place dried italian seasoning, salt and pepper. Layer pork chops on top of seasonings. In another layer place potatoes cut in quarters, then tart apples cut in chunks. In another layer place sauerkraut and kielbasa. Add white wine and frozen peas on top. Cook on low for 8 hours or high for 4 hours. Serves 6-8.
Combine all of the above together. Refrigerate overnight. Serve with graham cracker sticks.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Combine sweet potatoes and apple pie filling in a large bowl. Combine the apple pie spice and sugar. Sprinkle over the sweet potato mixture and stir gently to combine. Spoon into a greased 1 1/2-quart baking dish. Sprinkle with pecans and drizzle with the melted butter. Bake, uncovered, 40 to 45 minutes or until sweet potatoes are tender and topping is lightly browned. Cool slightly. Serve.

Combine the garlic, salt and pepper and mash together with the back of a knife to make a paste. Slowly add the olive oil and stir to combine. Add the vinegar and stir well. Add the green onions and jalapenos and stir well. Let sit at room temperature for 10 minutes before adding the cilantro and water. Stir well and serve immediately.

In a bowl, combine fish sauce, fresh cracked pepper and crushed red pepper flakes. Add shallots. Set aside. In another bowl, add egg. In a third bowl, mix together the cornflour and the corn kernels. Heat 2 inches of vegetable oil in deep fryer or large skillet. Add corn mixture to egg bowl. Add egg mixture to corn mixture. Make patties with your hands. Drop into hot oil. Fry until golden brown. Drain on paper towels. Serve with dipping sauce. Makes 4 servings.

In 12-inch skillet cook turkey until no longer pink. Drain. In same skillet over medium-low heat combine turkey, spaghetti sauce, corn, onion and italian seasoning. Simmer uncovered for 5 minutes. Combine turkey mixture and macaroni in 1 1/2 quart casserole sprayed with cooking spray. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Bake uncovered at 350 degrees for 30 minutes or until macaroni is tender. Makes 8 servings.

Fill large punch bowl or pitcher with water. Bring to a boil. Remove from heat and add tea bags. Let steep for 10 minutes. Remove tea bags and stir in unsweetened cranberry juice, apple cider and brown sugar. Let cool. Serve warm or over ice with orange slices. Garnish with cloves and cinnamon sticks.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). Wash and scrub the sweet potatoes and remove any blemishes from the skin. Pat the potatoes dry and brush them with vegetable oil. Place them on a baking sheet and bake for 1 hour or until the potatoes are soft when pierced with a knife. In a small bowl, combine the pecans with the maple syrup and bake for 5 minutes or until the nuts are coated and slightly toasted. Remove the pecans from the oven and set them aside to cool. Meanwhile, peel the sweet potatoes and cut them into chunks. Place them in a mixing bowl with the pineapple and marmalade and toss to combine. In a small bowl combine the orange juice, lemon juice and dijon and whisk together well. Add the mixture to the sweet potatoes and pineapple and toss to coat the vegetables. Taste and add more salt and pepper if desired. Sprinkle the pecans over the top of the sweet potatoes and serve.

Heat olive oil in a Dutch oven over medium heat. Add the onions and cook until soft and beginning to brown. Add the garlic and cook until lightly colored. Add the carrots and celery and cook 5 minutes. Stir in the chicken broth and rice. Bring to a boil over high heat. Add the chicken and any accumulated juices. Reduce the heat to medium-low. Simmer the soup until the chicken is cooked through and the rice is tender. Season to taste and serve.

Mix honey, soy sauce, vinegar, garlic and ginger. Brush pork chops with half of the marinade and marinate for 30 minutes. Grill pork chops on medium-high heat for 4 minutes on each side or to desired doneness. Brush remaining marinade over pork chops while grilling. Yield: 4 servings.

Combine 4 packages of lime jell-o with 1/2 cup hot water in a large bowl. Stir well and let cool for 30 seconds. Add 1/2 cup of sour cream. Mix well. Pour mixture into a 9 x 13 inch pan. Refrigerate until firm. Cut into squares and serve. Makes 12 servings.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees F. Lightly grease 2 baking sheets. In large bowl, combine flour, 1 teaspoon of the salt and baking powder. Add the green chile pepper, garlic and buttermix well. Stir in the cream just until the dough comes together. Turn out onto floured surface. Knead gently 5 times. Pat the dough out into 1-inch thickness. Using 3-inch biscuit cutter, cut 12 rounds from dough. Place on baking sheets. Brush with cream. Sprinkle with the remaining 1/4 teaspoon of salt. Bake 10 to 15 minutes or until golden brown. Cool on wire rack. Yield: 12 scones.

Remove the tops and the stems from the beets. Rinse the beets under running water. Wrap each beet individually in aluminum foil and place on a baking sheet. Place beets in the oven for 45 minutes. Remove the beets from the oven and unwrap them. Add the sugar and balsamic vinegar to the beets. Stir well. Return to oven and heat for 5 minutes. Serve over salad greens.

Soak brown lentils for at least 2 hours or overnight. Bring broth and lentils to a boil. Cover and simmer until tender. Drain lentils. In a large bowl combine diced onion and peppers.
