Add cooked lentils and mix well. Stir in cheese and red pepper flakes. Serve with celery sticks or chips. This is great for potlucks and parties.

Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F. In a large pan of boiling salted water, blanch the onions for 5 minutes. Drain well and set aside to cool. Melt the butter in another pan. Add the garlic cloves and bay leaf. Cook for 1 minute. Add the peppercorns and cloves. Add the cooled onions and cook gently for 10 minutes. Stir in the salt and pepper. Roll the puff pastry out and place in a pie pan. Spread the onions over the pastry. Grate the Jarlsberg cheese over the top and sprinkle with the thyme. Bake in the oven until the pastry is golden. Serves 6.

In a 13x9x2 baking dish, mix stuffing mix and hot water until moistened. Stir in chicken and soupsprinkle with cheese and vegetables. Bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes or until browned and bubbly. Serves 6 to 8.

Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the soba noodles to the pan. Stir in the soy sauce. Add the molasses, sesame oil, tahini, brown sugar and chili oil. Stir to mix. Remove the pan from the heat. Stir in the balsamic vinegar. Serve in a bowl topped with the green onion. Makes 2 servings.
In a bowl combine cottage cheese, cucumber and dill until blended. Garnish with diced cucumber and green onion sprigs and serve at room temperature.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Line baking sheet with parchment paper or spray with cooking spray.In a large bowl cream together the butter, applesauce, sugar, eggs, vanilla, flour, baking soda, oats, and salt until well combined. Fold in chocolate chips.Using a cookie scoop (or a spoon) drop dough onto the baking sheet about 2 inches apart. Bake for 8-10 minutes until golden brown around the edges.Remove cookies from the oven and let cool on the baking sheet for a couple of minutes. Transfer cookies to a wire rack to cool completely.

Heat the olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add the onions and saute them until they are lightly browned. Add the halibut steaks and cook them for 1 minute on each side. Add the tomato sauce and cook for 1 minute more. Season the halibut with salt and pepper. Serve the halibut with the parsley.

Cook pasta in a large pot of boiling water according to package instructions. Drain and rinse with cold water to stop the cooking. Meanwhile, in a large pot of boiling water cook broccoli until tender about 5 minutes. Drain and rinse with cold water to stop the cooking. In a large skillet combine the pasta, broccoli, flour, salt and pepper. In a large pot melt the butter over medium heat. Add the milk and dijon mustard. Bring to a boil. Pour over the pasta mixture. Reduce heat to low. Simmer until heated through about 3 minutes. Stir in the cheese. Makes 4 servings.

Heat vegetable oil in a wok over medium heat. Add garlic and onion. Stir-fry about 2 minutes. Add shrimp. Stir-fry about 2 minutes more. Add fish sauce. Stir-fry for about 2 minutes. Add rice. Stir-fry until heated through. Stir in pineapple. Stir-fry for about a minute. Garnish with green onions.

Place the wings in a large bowl. Add the hot sauce. Add the butter and vinegar. Mix well. Add the ranch dressing mix. Add the paprika. Toss. Spread evenly on a foil lined baking sheet. Bake for 30 minutes or until the wings are golden brown. Makes 4 servings.

In large microwaveable bowl, melt margarine and sugar. Stir until smooth. Cool slightly. Add the Cream Cheese and beat until smooth. In small bowl mix Jell-O and boiling water until dissolved. Add to Cream Cheese mixture and beat until well blended. Chill until slightly thickened. Beat with mixer until fluffy. Fold in the Cool Whip. Fold in frozen raspberries. Spoon into 13x9-inch baking pan or individual serving dishes and refrigerate 8 hours or overnight to set. Decorate top of salad with pretzel sticks and serve.

Prepare jello as directed on box, using boiling water and cranberry sauce. Chill until partially set. Stir in raspberries and lemon juice. Chill until ready to serve. Serve in small dishes garnished with raspberries and mint sprigs.

Preheat oven to 375f. In a large bowl, combine ravioli and spaghetti sauce. Pour into 13 x 9-inch baking dish. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake for 10 minutes or until cheese melts. Meanwhile, in a skillet over medium-low heat, cook beef until no longer pink. Drain. Stir in spinach and heat through. Spoon evenly over ravioli mixture. Serve immediately.

Combine the tuna, cream cheese, mayonnaise, mustard, onion powder and lemon juice in a bowl. Spread onto the pita. Top with the cheddar cheese slices. Broil for 2 minutes until the cheese melts. Serve on a plate. Top with vegetables.

Wash the spinach well, drain in a colander, and transfer it to a large bowl. Add the sesame seeds to the spinach. Add the dashi, soy sauce, mirin, sugar, and salt to taste to the spinach mixture. Toss well to combine.

Brown ground turkey. Mix in carrots. Add egg. Mix breadcrumbs, worcestershire sauce and garlic powder. Add to meat mixture. Pat down to desired thickness. Sprinkle hash browns on top. Melt butter over hash browns. Sprinkle cheese over top. Bake at 350 for 30 minutes.

In a large mixing bowl, beat egg yolks lightly add sugar, vanilla and walnuts. Fold in 1/4 cup of flour. Dissolve remaining 1/4 cup of flour in the water. Stir into mixture. Drop from a teaspoon on to a greased baking sheet. Bake at 350 degrees for 10 to 15 minutes. Cool on racks. Makes about 4 dozen cookies.

Prepare the stuffing by placing the bread cubes in a bowl and pouring the half and half over it. Soak it for a few minutes to soften the bread. Combine the ground turkey with the stuffing, egg, salt and pepper. Make the crumbing by crumbling the breadcrumbs in a bowl. Dip the turkey into the egg then into the breadcrumb mixture and place in the hot oil until cooked. Remove and drain on paper towels. Serve with lemon slices.

In a small bowl, combine the mayonnaise, honey, and rice wine vinegar until smooth. Stir in the poppy seeds, the apple, the onion, the celery, and the chicken. Cover and refrigerate until ready to serve.Serve the mixture on bread or crackers, or over lettuce leaves. Serves 4 to 6.

Mix together the butter and powdered sugar and beat well. Add vanilla extract and mix well. Add flour and mix well. Stir in nuts. Roll into balls and place on wax paper. Chill until firm. Roll balls in powdered sugar and place on wax paper. Chill again. Makes about 20 cookies.

In a large saute pan melt butter over medium heat. Add the onions and cook for 30 minutes. Stir occasionally. Add the garlic and cook for 1 minute. Stir in the brown sugar and cook for 1 minute. Add the salt and pepper and cook for 1 minute. Add the balsamic vinegar and stir. Slice the steaks to fit into the pan and cover. Cook for 6 minutes on each side. Remove the steak and serve with the onions on top.

In a medium bowl stir together ground beef, bread crumbs, egg, garlic powder, onion powder and ground pepper. Add tomato paste and stir to combine. Mix in tomato sauce. Divide into 12 meatballs. In a large skillet cook meatballs in olive oil over medium-high heat until browned, 5 to 7 minutes per side. Remove from pan and set aside. In the same pan cook the remaining sauce over medium-high heat until slightly thickened. Return meatballs to pan and cook for 5 minutes or until heated through. Serve over cooked pasta or rice. Serves 4.

Heat a griddle over medium heat. Coat with nonstick spray and let heat for a minute or two. Combine the egg, honey and vanilla in a shallow dish. Whisk in the milk and set aside. Spread the bread with softened butter and dip in the egg mixture. Transfer the bread to the griddle and cook until the bread is golden brown on each side. Transfer the french toast to a plate and top with a slice of brie cheese and a few whole cranberries. Serve immediately.
Roll out pie dough and put it in pie pan. Put in mushrooms and butter. Cover with spinach souffle. Dot with cheese. Bake 350 degrees until crust is golden and cheese is melted.
Soak the mustard seeds for 4-6 hours. Add the vinegar and bring to a boil. Add the mustard powder and the salt. Mix well. Let cool. Add the beer. Serve.

Preheat oven to 350. Line mini muffin tins with paper liners. In a microwave safe bowl combine brownie mix, water and applesauce. Stir until smooth. Spoon into prepared pan. Bake 12 minutes. Cool completely. In a small bowl combine candy corn and whipped topping. Spread onto cupcake tops.

Preheat oven to 350F. Place cornflour in a medium bowl. Whisk in eggs one at a time. Add sugar, salt, and vanilla. Beat until smooth. Add baking powder. Spray a 9-inch pie dish with cooking spray. Pour batter into pie dish. Bake in preheated oven for 20-30 minutes or until a skewer inserted in the center comes out clean. Remove from oven and let cool for a few minutes. Turn out onto wire rack. Cool completely. Serve with fruit.

Grease and line a cake tin. Whisk the eggs, sugar, flour and salt in a bowl until light and creamy. Beat in the orange juice and rind. Pour into the cake tin and bake in a preheated oven at 170 C / Gas 3 for about an hour until golden brown and well risen. Leave to cool.

Heat the oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add the onions and saute until soft and translucent. Add the garlic and saute for an additional minute. Add the potatoes and cauliflower and saute until they begin to soften, about 5 minutes. Add the chicken broth and water. Bring the soup to a boil and then reduce the heat and simmer for 15-20 minutes or until the vegetables are tender. Season with the salt and pepper and garnish with the chives.
In a 4-quart pot, bring broth to a boil. Add celery ribs, carrot, onion, and cooked chicken. Cook until vegetables are crisp-tender. Stir in corn, tomato, and seasonings. Heat through. Serve warm.

In a large bowl combine soy sauce, rice wine, brown sugar, cornstarch, vegetable oil and garlic. Add beef strips to marinade. Cover and refrigerate for 2 hours. Meanwhile, prepare snow peas. Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Add snow peas. Cook for 1 minute. Drain, rinse with cold water and drain again. Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a wok or large skillet over high heat until smoking. Remove beef strips from marinade. Add beef to hot pan. Stir-fry beef until browned. Add remaining 2 tablespoons oil. Add gingerroot. Stir-fry 1 minute. Add snow peas. Stir-fry 2 minutes or until peas are tender-crisp. Dish up. Serve over hot rice. Serves 4.

Heat butter in frying pan over medium heat. Add onions and saute. Add curry powder. Add chicken broth. Simmer for 15 minutes. Add aroma seasoning. Stir in cooked chicken. Heat through. Serve over rice. Sprinkle with corn flake crumbs.

Cook ground beef with onion until done. Drain off fat. Stir in spaghetti sauce and tomato sauce. Add macaroni. Cook until al dente. Stir in pepperoni slices. Top with mozzarella cheese. Bake at 350f for 20 minutes or until bubbly. Serve hot.

In a large skillet over medium heat, heat 2 tablespoons of the oil. Add the garlic and cook for 1 minute. Add the chicken and cook for about 1 minute on each side or until cooked through and no longer pink in the middle. Remove from the pan and set aside to cool slightly. In the same pan, heat the remaining oil and add the eggplant and cook for about 4 minutes on each side or until cooked through and golden brown on the outside. Remove and set aside with the chicken. In a large saucepan over medium-high heat, heat the marinara sauce and bring to a simmer. Add the mozzarella and Romano cheeses and cook for about 2 minutes or until the cheese has melted and the sauce has thickened slightly. Add the cooked chicken and eggplant and cook for about 2 minutes or until warmed through and combined with the sauce and pasta. Serve hot.
Combine margarine and powdered sugar. Add vanilla and mix well. Add flour and mix until smooth. Chill until firm. Form into balls and roll in walnuts. Makes 3 dozen.

Preheat broiler. Cut sausage into 1/2 inch pieces. Spray a baking pan with cooking spray. Place sausage on pan and spray with cooking spray. Place in broiler and broil for about 7 minutes. Spread about a teaspoon of barbecue sauce on each Hawaiian roll. Place a piece of sausage on each roll. Sprinkle with cheese. Broil until cheese is melted. Serve immediately.

In a small saucepan over medium heat, combine molasses with chipotle chiles and orange juice concentrate. Bring to a simmer, reduce heat to low and simmer until reduced by half, about 30 minutes. Season with salt. Transfer sauce to a bowl or jar, cover and refrigerate until ready to use. Heat grill to medium heat. In a small saucepan over medium heat, combine butter with lime juice, honey and chipotle chiles. Bring to a simmer, reduce heat to low and simmer until reduced by half, about 30 minutes. Season with salt. Transfer sauce to a bowl or jar, cover and refrigerate until ready to use. Preheat a gas or charcoal grill for high heat. Cut kernels from corn cobs and transfer to a large bowl. Add butter sauce, cilantro, lime juice, cayenne and 1 tablespoon of salt. Gently toss. When ready to grill, brush grates with oil and grill corn kernels, cut-side down for 5 minutes.

mix lard and flour together. add in the salt and sugar. then add the egg and vinegar. cut into a ball with your hand and place in fridge for 15 minutes. take out and roll into a ball and place in pie pans. then bake at 400 degrees for 10 minutes. then let cool. you can eat it by itself or add in your favorite pie filling.
Prepare bread pudding as directed. Pour into a greased 8-inch square pan. Sprinkle with crushed pineapple. Bake at 350 degrees until set. Serve warm.

Remove the shells from the mussels and set aside. Melt the butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the shrimp, scallops and mushrooms and saute until the shrimp is opaque and the scallops are cooked through. Add the shallots and cook for one minute. Add the wine and the lemon wedge. Cook until the liquid is reduced by half. Add the mussels and cook for one minute. Remove the lemon wedge and stir in the basil. Divide the seafood mixture among the pouches. Serve immediately. Serves four.

Preheat grill to medium high heat. Cut tomatoes in half lengthwise. Arrange tomato halves cut side up in a single layer in a 13x9-inch baking dish. Place pesto in a small bowl. Stir in green onion. Spoon pesto mixture over tomato halves. Sprinkle evenly with mozzarella. Sprinkle with parsley. Cover with a grill pan. Grill for 10 minutes or until tomatoes are tender and cheese is melted. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Heat a nonstick skillet over medium high heat. Coat with cooking spray and add chickencook 5 minutes per side or until browned and cooked through. Place salsa, Miracle Whip and chili powder into a bowl and mix until combined. Place tortilla into skillet and spread with chicken mixture and cheesesprinkle with more chili powder and bake for about 3 minutes or until cheese is melted and tortilla is golden brown.

Combine apples and cranberries in an 8x8x2 inch glass baking dish. Combine oats, sugar and flour. Add butter and combine. Sprinkle over top of apple mixture. Bake at 350 degrees for 40 minutes or until golden brown. Serve with ice cream or whipped cream.

Cut the tomatoes into thin slices. Halve the halloumi cheese. Heat the olive oil and pesto sauce together in a frying pan over medium-low heat and add the tomatoes and cheese. Cook for 5 minutes and then add the lemon juice. Serves two.

Brown sausage in a frying pan. Remove sausage from pan with slotted spoon. Place frozen hash browns in pan and brown well on both sides. Break eggs into pan and cook eggs until done. Place sausage in center of hash browns, top with cheese and place eggs on top. Serve immediately with toast or biscuits.

Prepare cube steaks according to package directions. Melt butter in large foil roaster. Drain celery, carrots, potatoes. Add to roaster. Pour half the soup over the meat and vegetables. Add onion mix. Pour the remaining soup over the top. Fold up the sides of the foil to create a packet. Place on a baking sheet. Bake in a 350f oven for about 45 minutes. Serve with potatoes.
Wash cantaloupe and cut into chunks. Wash and hull the strawberries. In a small bowl combine the rose water and icing sugar. Drizzle over the melon and strawberries. Serve immediately. Serves 2.

Saute celery and onion in butter until tender. Add broccoli and stock and simmer until vegetables are tender. Combine mashed potatoes and half-and-half and add to vegetable mixture. Stir in thyme and season with salt and pepper. Add shredded cheese and stir until melted. Serve warm. Makes 4 servings.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Cook ground beef in skillet with onion until beef is no longer pink. Drain fat. Add soup mixes, soup, milk, mushrooms, and biscuit mix until blended. Pour in a casserole dish. Bake for 20-25 minutes or until biscuit mix is golden brown. Serves 6-8.

Beat cream cheese until soft. Add sugar and mix well. Add baking cocoa. Beat until mixture is light. Stir in milk and vanilla. Spread into graham cracker crust. Chill for at least 4 hours. Garnish with whipped topping and maraschino cherries. Serves 10.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Wash potatoes in water and dry well. Toss with olive oil, salt and pepper. Place potatoes in a single layer in a small casserole dish or baking pan. Bake for 30 minutes or until tender but not mushy. Drain picante sauce, saving the liquid for the salad dressing. In a large bowl, combine potatoes with picante sauce, lime juice, olive oil, salt and pepper to taste. Fold in tomatoes, olives, green onions and cilantro. Serve immediately or refrigerate until chilled. Sprinkle with cheese before serving if desired. Serves 6-8.

Place all the ingredients except for the water in a blender or food processor, then blend on low speed for 2 minutes or until smooth. With the blender or food processor still running slowly add the water, until desired consistency is reached. Serve with cut up vegies or crackers.

In a deep non-stick pan heat ghee. Add rava and saute. Cook until light brown. Add milk. Cook till mixture leaves the sides of the pan. Add sugar and green cardamom. Mix well. Cook till mixture leaves the sides of the pan. Transfer mixture on a plate. Cool for 10 minutes. Knead the mixture like soft dough. Divide into small balls. Roll each ball in ghee. Roll the balls in coconut flakes.

Heat 2 tablespoons olive oil in large skillet over high heat. Add shallot and saute for 2 minutes or until softened. Add chicken and saute for 3 minutes or until browned. Add broth, wine and tarragon. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 15 minutes or until chicken is no longer pink. In large saucepan, heat remaining 2 tablespoons olive oil over medium-high heat. Add potatoes and saute for 5 minutes or until potatoes begin to brown. Add chicken mixture, broth and tarragon to potatoes in saucepan. Season with salt and pepper. Simmer for 10 minutes or until potatoes are tender. Serve with fresh flat-leaf parsley if desired. Makes 4 servings.

Sauté sausage in 1 tablespoon oil until cooked through. Drain off fat and discard. In large bowl mix together sausage, rice, onions, and stock. Transfer to 9-inch by 13-inch baking dish. In separate bowl mix together tomatoes, chili powder, garlic powder, pepper, and remaining oil. Spread mixture over sausage mixture. Bake in preheated oven for 20 to 25 minutes until rice is tender. Serve hot.
Toss the pears with the lemon juice in a small bowl. Add the hazelnut oil, arugula and parmesan cheese. Toss to combine. Sprinkle with the walnuts. Serve.

In a medium saucepan, combine apricots, water, sugar, almond extract, and almonds. Bring to a boil over high heat, reduce heat to medium low, and simmer for 10 minutes or until apricots are tender and mixture has thickened slightly. Serve warm or cold. Serves 4.
Prepare cake mix according to package directions. Substitute lemon pudding for the water. Bake in 9 x 13 pan. Sprinkle with poppy seed. Bake an additional 25 minutes. Cool. Makes 12 servings.

Melt 4 tablespoons butter in a medium skillet over medium heat. Add 1/2 cup flour and cook 1 minute. Gradually stir in 1/2 cup chicken stock. Bring to boil, stirring constantly. Boil and stir until mixture thickens. Remove from heat and stir in 1/4 teaspoon vinegar and 1/4 teaspoon sugar. Cool slightly. Beat in 1 egg yolk. Stir in 1 teaspoon fresh dill. Stir in remaining flour. Add enough milk to thin to desired consistency. Stir in remaining 2 tablespoons vinegar and 2 tablespoons sugar. Season to taste with salt. Serve warm or cold. Makes 1 cup.

Combine ground beef, seasoned stuffing mix, eggs, onion and next 4 ingredients in medium bowl. Shape mixture into meatballs. Place meatballs in greased baking dish. Combine remaining ingredients. Pour over meatballs. Bake at 350 degrees F for 45 minutes or until meatballs are done. Makes 4 servings.

Cook bacon in a frying pan until crisp. In the meantime, spread mayonnaise on each croissant slice. In a large skillet, add bacon drippings with the garlic clove. Add the lettuce and cook for a minute or two until wilted. Place lettuce on each croissant slice and top with tomato slices. Top the tomatoes with the bacon. Serve immediately.

Blend cream cheese and ranch salad dressing in a small bowl. Spread cream cheese mixture evenly over the bottom of the 9-inch pie plate. Spread imitation crabmeat evenly over the top of the cream cheese mixture. Sprinkle the cheddar cheese evenly over the crabmeat. Arrange the seafood on top of the cheese. In a small bowl mix the seafood cocktail sauce and the remaining 1/4 cup of ranch dressing. Pour sauce over the seafood. Sprinkle the remaining 2 tablespoons of cheese on top of the seafood and sauce. Chill until ready to serve. Garnish with green onions and tomatoes if desired. Makes 6 servings.

In a small bowl combine the cucumber, red onion and radishes. In a small bowl combine oil, vinegar and sugar. Pour dressing over cucumber mixture and toss gently. Sprinkle with dry crushed red pepper. Refrigerate until ready to serve.

In medium pot over medium heat, add oil and onion. Saute until tender. Add carrot and cook 5 minutes. Add green beans and cook for 2 minutes. Add vegetable stock, almond milk and herbs. Cover and simmer for 20 minutes. Remove from heat. Purée with blender or food processor. Stir in parsley. Season to taste. Serves 2.

In a 5 to 6 quart slow cooker combine the potatoes, onion, apple, corned beef brisket, cabbage, apple cider, brown sugar, dijon mustard and the cloves and pepper. Cook on high until the brisket is tender about 6 to 8 hours. Add the carrots during the last hour of cooking. Makes 4 to 6 servings.

Peel the onion and cut it into pieces. Heat oil in a pot. Fry the onion for 3 minutes. Add the flour and stir for 2 more minutes. Add the mint and continue to stir for another minute. Add water gradually and keep stirring until you achieve a thick batter. Season with salt and black pepper. Serve the fritters hot with tomato sauce.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 9×13 inch baking dish. Unfold crescent rolls and place in bottom of pan. Press into pan. Spread with 2/3 of the cream cheese. Sprinkle with 1/3 of the bell pepper and 1/2 of the tomatoes. Sprinkle with 1/2 of the bacon and 1/2 of the mozzarella. Repeat layers. Sprinkle with remaining bell pepper and tomatoes. Sprinkle with remaining mozzarella and bacon. Bake for 20 minutes in the preheated oven. Makes 12 servings.

Preheat oven to 350f. Grease 6 individual ramekins or one large rectangular baking dish. Melt the butter in a large saucepan over low heat. Add the caster sugar and stir well. Add the eggs one at a time, stirring well after each addition. Add the self-raising flour and mix until smooth. Stir in the gingerroot and mix well. Divide the mixture among the ramekins or baking dish. Bake for about 1 hour or until the puddings are set. Cool completely before serving. Whisk together the orange juice, ginger root and zest and spoon over each pudding. Scatter the dried cranberries over the top. Serve with whipped cream.

In a medium bowl stir together the chicken, tomatoes with green chilies and onion. Add the green pepper and red pepper and mix well. Season with chili powder, cumin, and salt. Heat canola oil in large skillet over medium heat. Add the chicken mixture. Cook until chicken is no longer pink. Serve with warmed tortillas, shredded lettuce, sliced avocados, salsa and sour cream.

Wash the beans. Soak the beans in cold water overnight. Drain the beans. In a soup pot heat the oil over medium-high heat. Add the onion and garlic and saut for 4 minutes. Stir in the bay leaf and the thyme and continue to saute for 1 minute. Add the chicken stock. Stir in the beans. Bring to a boil. Lower the heat to medium-low. Cook for 1 1/2 hours until the beans are tender. Add the salt and pepper to taste. Serve warm.

Mix chocolate and oil in double boiler. Add apricots and cranberries and stir until well blended. Remove from heat. Quickly form mixture into 1-inch balls. Roll in orange zest. Store in covered container in refrigerator.

Heat oil in skillet. Add chicken and brown. Add onions and saute until translucent. Add garlic and saute another minute. Stir in peanut butter, ground coriander and red pepper flakes. Simmer 2 minutes. Add tomato sauce, bring to a boil. Simmer for 10 minutes. Serve over rice.

Finely dice the leeks and celery and sweat in a pot with a little butter until softened. Add the curly-leaf parsley and continue to cook for a couple more minutes before adding the floury potatoes and stirring for a few minutes. Add the chicken stock and bring to the boil, then simmer until the potatoes are cooked through and the soup is thick enough to coat the back of a spoon.Stir in the double cream and season with salt and freshly ground black pepper.Ladle into bowls and sprinkle over the chives and serve.

In a large Dutch oven over medium heat, saute the beef with the onions, jalapenos and tomato paste until the beef is browned. Add the tomatoes and broth. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 1 1/2 hours. Cut off the tops of the bell peppers. Remove seeds and stem. Stuff with the rice. Pour beef mixture into the bell peppers. Sprinkle with the onion soup mix. Cover and bake for 1 hour. Makes 4 servings.

Dissolve gelatin in orange juice. Cool in the refrigerator for a few hours. Whisk in the sugar and lemon juice. Freeze in an ice cream maker according to manufacturer’s directions. Transfer to a plastic container and freeze for 8 hours. Whisk in the heavy cream and freeze for an additional hour. Serve immediately.

Melt butter in a small saucepan over medium heat. Stir in chili powder, onion powder, garlic powder, cayenne pepper, and lemon pepper. Bring to a simmer. Remove from heat and stir in popped popcorn. Toss to coat well. Season with salt to taste.

Preheat oven to 375f. Beat peanut butter with egg and vanilla until smooth. Drop by spoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheets. Bake for 8 to 10 minutes or until edges are lightly browned. Cool on wire rack. Makes about 3 dozen cookies.

Combine cornstarch and brown sugar in a small bowl. Stir in apple juice. Combine with apple juice mixture. Cook and stir until thickened. Stir in orange zest. Serve with kielbasa kabobs. In a large bowl combine kielbasa, green bell pepper, onion, and pineapple. Thread onto skewers. Cook on grill over medium heat for 6 to 8 minutes or until meat is no longer pink. Serve with sweet and sour sauce.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).Prepare pie shell as directed on package. Pour pudding mix into prepared pie shell.Mix milk, protein powder and vanilla together until smooth. Pour over pudding mixture. Bake in preheated oven for 40 minutes or until set.Cool. Top with Cool Whip just before serving.

Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil over high heat. Add potatoes to boiling water. Cook 12 to 15 minutes or until tender. Drain potatoes. Place potatoes in a large bowl. Add butter. Mash potatoes. Stir in cream. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Sprinkle with fresh parsley. Makes 6 servings.

Slice mushrooms. Heat butter and garlic in a skillet over medium heat until garlic is golden brown. Stir mushrooms into skillet. Cook 5 minutes or until tender, stirring frequently. Stir in wine, soy sauce, and parsley. Heat through. Stir in cheese. Spoon into a shallow baking dish. Top with cracker crumbs. Bake at 350 degrees for 5 minutes or until top is lightly browned. Serve with salad or vegetable. Serves 4.

Grill jalapenos until lightly charred. Slice in half lengthwise. Grill the bacon until crispy. Lay out the wraps. Layer wraps with turkey bacon, cream cheese and cheddar cheese. Top with jalapenos. Roll up. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 400°. Pierce squash with a sharp knife and place on a baking pan. Bake for 45 minutes or until tender. Drain and reserve 1/2 cup of liquid. Remove seeds from bell peppers and cut into 1/4-inch strips. Peel onion halves and slice thinly. In a large saucepan heat oil over medium heat. Add garlic and cook for 1 minute. Add rice and stir. Add liquid from squash pan. Stir in black eyed peas and bell peppers. Cover and cook over medium heat until tender about 30 minutes. Sprinkle with onion and hot pepper sauce before serving. Makes 4 servings.

In a large saucepan over medium heat, whisk together 1/3 cup vegetable broth and 1/2 cup cold water. Bring to a boil. In a large bowl, whisk together the cornstarch and 1/2 cup cold water until smooth. Stir the cornstarch mixture into the broth mixture and cook until thickened, about 1 minute. Remove from the heat and set aside to cool slightly. Transfer the sauce to a blender. Blend until smooth. Add the roasted garlic cloves and mustard and blend until smooth. Add the honey, 1/3 cup vegetable broth, peanut oil, salt, and pepper. Blend until smooth. Chill the sauce for 1 hour or longer before serving. Serve the sauce with vegetables or chicken strips.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add chicken to pan. Season with salt and pepper. Cook until no longer pink in center. Remove from heat. Add wine to pan and flambe. Add fresh lemon rind. Stir in cream and parmesan cheese. Spoon mixture over chicken. Bake in oven until chicken is heated through. Makes 4 servings.

Bring 1 cup of sugar with 1 cup of water to a boil in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Reduce heat to lowadd frozen raspberries and cook for 15 minutes, mashing with a potato masher until juices thicken and mixture resembles a thick paste. Let cool completely. Place mixture in a glass jar. Add the juice from 1 lemon and 1/2 cup of boiling watershake to combine. Let stand at room temperature for 1 hour or refrigerate for at least 8 hours. Serve with sparkling water or seltzer water.

Combine beans and tofu hot dogs and place in a slow cooker. Add ketchup, brown sugar, water and molasses. Stir well. Add mustard powder and garlic powder to taste. Cook on low for 5 hours or high for 2 hours or until hot dogs are heated through and beans are tender. Serve with toothpicks or on a hamburger roll.

Heat oven to 350 degrees F. Mix brown sugar and butter in a 9x13 inch baking dish. Sprinkle with walnuts. Bake for 10 minutes. Remove from oven and spread with 1/2 of the semi-sweet chocolate chips. Bake for 3 more minutes. Remove from oven and spread with remaining chocolate chips. Let cool in dish. Cut into squares.

In a large stockpot over medium heat, heat olive oil. Add diced onion, celery and garlic. Sweat until vegetables are tender. Add the canned crushed tomatoes. Add the chicken stock. Bring to a boil. Lower the heat to a simmer. Add the smoked paprika, cayenne and herbs. Simmer for 15 minutes. Remove from heat. Using an immersion blender or in batches in a blender puree the soup until smooth. Stir in the sour cream. Heat through. Ladle soup into bowls and garnish with fresh herbs and a drizzle of olive oil.

Heat milk in saucepan until boiling. Strain milk through colander into large bowl. Add sweet butter and whisk until melted. Add tortellini and cook over medium heat until tortellini are heated through. Stir in ham and heavy cream. Add parmesan cheese and peas and stir until melted. Stir in fresh chives and season with salt and pepper. Serve immediately. Makes 4 servings.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. On a lightly floured surface roll pastry into a 15-inch square. Transfer to a large baking sheet coated with nonstick cooking spray. In a medium bowl combine brown sugar, cinnamon and salt. Arrange apples in the center of the pastry. Sprinkle with brown sugar mixture. Fold pastry up and over apples, pleating as you go. Bake until pastry is golden brown and apples are tender, about 35 minutes. Drizzle with caramel topping. Top with whipped cream and sprinkle with powdered sugar. Serve with vanilla ice cream.

Spread mayonnaise on inside of each slice of white bread. Arrange lettuce and tomato on bottom slice. Top with bacon and chicken breasts. Sprinkle on paprika. Place top slice of bread on sandwich and press down firmly to make sandwiches. Cut each sandwich into quarters and serve on sticks. Serves 4.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease loaf pan. Combine sugar, butter, and eggnog in a bowl. Beat at medium speed with an electric mixer until creamy. Beat in rum extract and vanilla. Combine flour, baking powder, and saltgradually beat into eggnog mixture. Stir in nutmeg. Pour into prepared loaf pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 1 hour or until a toothpick inserted near the center comes out clean. Cool in pan for 10 minutes before removing to a wire rack. Serve warm.

Marinate salmon in coconut milk, curry paste and fish sauce for about 30 minutes. Drain and grill for 5-6 minutes on each side or until cooked through. Serve with rice and garnish with lime wedge and basil.

Warm a small fry pan over medium heat. Add a couple of knobs of butter and allow to melt. Crack the egg into the pan and season with salt and pepper. Add the dill sprigs and a grind of black pepper. Fry the egg until the white is set and the yolk is still runny. Toast the miniature party rounds and top with smoked salmon and the fried egg. Sprinkle with a little black pepper and serve with a salad.

In a large bowl, combine the graham cracker crumbs and the melted butter. Press into the bottom of a 13x9 inch pan. In a medium bowl, combine the sweetened condensed milk and jam. Spread over the graham cracker crust. Sprinkle with the flaked coconut and the cashews. Bake for 20 to 25 minutes or until lightly browned. Sprinkle with the white chocolate chips. Cool and cut into bars.

Line 9x13 baking dish with aluminum foil and grease lightly. Spread crackers on bottom of dish and top with chips and peanut butter. In a saucepan combine milk and butter and bring to a boil. Remove from heat and add sugar, brown sugar and vanilla. Stir until sugar is dissolved. Pour over peanut butter and chocolate mixture and spread evenly. Top with graham crackers and press down slightly. Bake at 350 for 25 minutes or until golden brown. Cool 5-10 minutes and cut into bars. Makes 12 bars.

Place chuck in 3-1/2 to 4-quart slow cooker. Add carrot and potatoesarrange evenly in slow cooker. Combine soup mix and Guinness in medium bowlpour over meat mixture in slow cooker. Cover and cook on HIGH 4 to 4-1/2 hours or until meat is tender. Remove chuck from slow cookercut across grain into thin slices and return to slow cooker. Sprinkle with parsley just before serving. Serves 6-8.
Cut cantaloupe into 1 inch cubes. Chop spinach leaves. Combine in a bowl. Add dressing and nuts.

Peel and cube potatoesboil in water for 15-20 minutes or until tender. Drain potatoesmash with cream cheese, butter, sour cream, cream, eggs, salt & garlic salt. Pour into greased 13 x 9 pan. Bake @ 350 for 45 minutes or until golden brown & set. Cool slightly & cut in squares. Top with cheddar cheese. Bake @ 350 for 5 minutes or until cheese melts. Serves 12-16.

In blender combine oats, milk, flour, sugar, baking powder, cinnamon, and salt. Add egg whites and process until smooth. Heat griddle over medium heat. Melt butter in skillet. Spoon batter onto griddle and spread to form pancakes. Cook for 1 minute per side. Serve pancakes with butter, honey or syrup. Makes 6 servings.

In a large skillet brown chicken halves in oil. Place in a greased 9x13 inch baking dish. In a medium bowl combine dressing and breadcrumbspress onto chicken. Bake uncovered at 350 degrees for 40 minutes or until a thermometer reads 160 degrees. Meanwhile in a small skillet cook bacon until crisp. Drain and crumbleset aside. In a small bowl combine the egg and waterbeat well. Place American cheese slices between 2 layers of waxed papertop with another layer of paperfold in half to form a packet. Microwave on High for 30 secondsunfold and let stand for 1 minute. Carefully cut 6 slits into top of cheese and spoon egg mixture into slits. Bake 5 minutes longer or until cheese is melted. Spoon bacon over cheese slicessprinkle with green onions. Serve with hot rolls.

Preheat oven to 350°F. Scrub potatoes well, then pierce each potato with a fork about four times and bake for one hour or until the potatoes are tender when pierced with a fork. Scoop out pulp of the potatoes into a large bowl. Add sour cream and stir until potatoes are lightly coated with cream. Mix in chives. Mound potato mixture into each potato skin, top with cheddar cheese and bacon bits. Bake for about ten minutes or until cheese is melted. Serve warm.

Place pomegranate seeds in a small bowl. Add sugar and stir to coat. Add grenadine. Stir well. Add water and stir to combine. Pour mixture into a large bowl. Add tapioca. Stir until tapioca is well combined. Pour mixture into four 4-ounce glasses or dessert cups. Refrigerate overnight. Serve with whipped cream.

Cut beef into small bite sized pieces. In a medium skillet over medium heat, add olive oil and seasoning and cook until beef is brown and seasoning is crisp. Add bell peppers and onions and stir-fry until crisp tender. Stir hoisin sauce and water into mixture and stir until well blended. Serves 4.

Combine the first 3 ingredients in a small bowl and set aside. Combine the remaining ingredients in a gallon plastic bag. Add the chicken and coat well. Refrigerate for at least 4 hours or overnight. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the chicken to the skillet and cook for about 3-4 minutes per side or until cooked through. Drain on paper towels.

Peel and cut the potatoes into 1/4-inch slices. Heat the butter in a large skillet and add the potatoes. Cook for about 4 minutes then sprinkle with the salt and pepper and turn them once or twice to cook evenly on all sides. Add the cheese and sprinkle on the onions and parsley and stir for just a few seconds so that the cheese will melt and the onions will be slightly wilted. Serve at once. Makes about 4 servings.

In a food processor, combine the first five ingredients until smooth. Transfer to a jar with a tight-fitting lid. Refrigerate for up to 3 weeks. Remove from the refrigerator 20 minutes before using. In a large skillet over medium heat, heat the oil. Add the onion and garlic and cook until tender. Stir in the baste mixture and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to low and simmer for 15 minutes. Remove from the heat. Let cool and stir in the lime juice. Serve with meat or poultry.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. Lightly grease two baking sheets. Combine molasses and water in saucepan. Heat until hot. Add sugar. Stir constantly until mixture comes to boil. Remove from heat. Combine molasses mixture with egg. Beat until well blended. Add Crisco. Beat until smooth. Add flour, baking soda, salt, spices. Blend well. Stir in oats. Drop by teaspoons onto greased baking sheets. Bake 8 minutes. Cool 1 minute. Remove from pans. Makes 120 cookies.

In a large skillet, cook bacon over medium heat until crisp. Remove bacon from pan, reserving bacon drippings. In a large stockpot over high heat, bring beer to a boil. Add clams. Covercook 5 minutes. Stir in onions. Serve in bowls with bacon. Serves 4.

In a medium bowl stir together all ingredient except for parsley. Transfer to a small baking dish. Sprinkle with parsley. Bake in a 375 degree oven for 30 minutes or until hot. Serve with crackers. Makes about 4 cups.

Mix the sugar-free black cherry gelatin and boiling water according to package directions. Stir in the red bull energy drink and vodka until the gelatin dissolves completely. Pour into individual shot glasses or other small serving dishes and chill for 2-4 hours. Garnish with lime slices and serve chilled. Makes 4 servings.

Combine 1/2 cup flour, 1/4 cup milk, 2 tbsp butter and 1/4 tsp salt in a medium bowl. Whisk until smooth and set aside. In a small bowl combine 1 cup frozen spinach thawed and squeezed dry, 1/4 cup milk and 1 tbsp butter. Set aside. Lightly coat a large skillet or crepe pan with cooking spray and heat over medium-high heat. Using a pastry brush or spatula, lightly coat the pan with cooking spray and ladle 1/4 cup of the batter into the pan and quickly swirl the pan to evenly distribute the batter over the bottom of the pan. Cook for 1 minute until the crepe is set and the edges are beginning to curl upward and the bottom is brown. Flip the crepe and cook for 1 minute more until golden brown and the crepe is set and the edges are beginning to curl upward. Remove the crepe and set aside on a plate. Repeat for the remaining crepes. In the center of each crepe place 1/2 cup of

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Line two baking sheets with parchment paper or spray with nonstick cooking spray. In the bowl of an electric mixer, beat the butter until light and fluffy. Beat in the vanilla. Add the egg, beating well after each addition. In a medium bowl, sift together the flour, salt, and baking powder. Gradually add to the creamed butter mixture, beating after each addition. Beat in the cream cheese. Stir in the cake mix. Drop by rounded teaspoonfuls onto prepared baking sheets. Bake for 10 to 12 minutes in the preheated oven, or until the edges are golden brown. Remove from the oven, and allow to stand for 5 minutes before removing to wire racks to cool completely. In a small bowl, stir together the confectioners' sugar and milk until smooth. Drizzle over the cookies. Allow to stand until the glaze is set. Makes about 5 dozen.

Heat olive oil in a heavy pot over medium-high heat. Add onion, garlic and pimiento. Cook 3 to 5 minutes or until onion is golden. Stir in potatoes, parsley and salt. Add chicken broth. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat. Cover and simmer 10 minutes or until potatoes are tender. Stir in parsley. Sprinkle with cheese. Serve immediately. Makes 4 servings.

Cut bread slices into small pieces. Lightly grease an 8 inch square baking dish. Layer bread pieces in dish. Beat eggs in large bowl. Add milk. Stir in bread. Let stand 10 minutes. Stir in cheese. Pour into dish. Bake at 350 degrees for 25 minutes. Meanwhile, cook bacon in skillet over medium heat 5 minutes or till crisp. Remove from pandrain on paper towels. Crumble. Sprinkle over casserole. Bake 5 minutes longer. Cool 5 minutes. Serve immediately. 8 servings.

Microwave the milk in a microwave safe bowl for 30 seconds. Stir in pudding mix. Microwave for another 2 minutes or until mixture is thick. Beat in 1 1/2 cups of the whipped topping. Fold in the graham crackers. Divide into 2 equal portions. Fill each portion into a 9 inch pie plate. Spread frosting over top. Refrigerate for at least one hour.

Place bread in shallow bowl and pour milk over top. Let soak for 5 minutes or so. Meanwhile combine the eggs, cinnamon, ginger and allspice in a small bowl. Heat butter in large skillet over medium heat. Dip the bread into the egg mixture and fry in the skillet until golden brown on each side. Serve with syrup and whipped cream.

In a bowl, combine teriyaki sauce and onions. Heat the grill to medium-high heat. Thread 3 dove breasts on each skewer and alternate with onions and bell peppers. Place skewers on grill and grill for about 5 minutes per side. When finished, add the tomatoes and mushrooms and cook until the tomatoes are warmed through. Serve on a bed of brown rice.
Season pork with salt, dry mustard, garlic powder. Heat oil in skillet. Dust with flour. Brown on both sides. Add soup. Simmer for 30 minutes. Serve with rice.

Heat olive oil in a large saute pan over medium high heat. Add yellow onions and saute until tender. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Sprinkle steak seasoning over both sides of steaks and season with garlic salt and black pepper. Add to saute pan and cook for 4 minutes per side. Top each sandwich with provolone and sauteed onions. Serve hot. Serves 4.

Heat vegetable oil over medium-high heat. Add bell pepper and onion. Cook and stir until tender. Add mushrooms and garliccook and stir 5-7 minutes longer. Add rice and Cajun seasoningcook and stir 1 minute. Stir in broth and bring to boilingcook on medium-low heat 10-12 minutes or until liquid is absorbed. Stir in pecans and cook 1 minute longer. Stir before serving. Makes 3-4 servings.

Heat olive oil in a frying pan and add the garlic. Cook for a minute or so until the garlic is just starting to brown. Add the courgettes and a good grinding of black pepper. Cook for a further five minutes or until the courgettes are tender and have released their juices. Add the lemon juice and fresh basil and stir. Cook for a further minute. Add the pasta and a good grating of parmesan. Toss to mix through and serve immediately.

Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat. Mix pancake mix, egg, water, sugar, cinnamon in a bowl. Fill a piping bag with pancake mixture. Pipe 1" round donut holes into oil. Fry for 2 minutes until golden. Turn and fry for another 1 minute. Serve with maple syrup.

Place potatoes in a pot of cold water. Bring to a boil and cook until tender. Drain and allow to cool. Peel and quarter the eggs. Add the potatoes and eggs to a bowl. Add the red onion and parsley. In a separate bowl mix together the sour cream, lemon juice and mustard. Pour over the potato mixture and toss. Refrigerate for 1 hour before serving.

Mix cheese and butter together until creamy. Spread on one slice of bread. Top with cream cheese. Add the other slice of bread. Spread the mayonnaise on the outside of the sandwich. Cut the sandwich into 4 triangles.

Line a 9x13 pan with parchment paper and set aside.In a small saucepan over medium heat, combine caramels and condensed milk and whisk until melted and smooth. Add the butter and whisk until the butter is melted and combined. Remove from heat and cool for a few minutes.In a large bowl, combine the butter mixture, marshmallows and vanilla until smooth and fluffy. Fold in the rice cereal and sea salt.Spread the mixture into the prepared pan and chill for an hour or until set.Use a sharp knife or pizza cutter and cut into desired sizes and store in an air-tight container.

Spray a 9 x 13 inch baking pan with cooking spray. Combine tomato sauce with italian seasoning, garlic powder, eggs, corn flake crumbs, and 1/2 cup of the parmesan cheese in a bowl. Spread mixture in baking pan. Arrange chicken breasts in sauce mixture. Sprinkle with remaining 1/4 cup of parmesan cheese. Bake at 350 degrees F for 30 minutes or until chicken is no longer pink. Sprinkle with dried parsley. Makes 4 servings.

Mix the ground round, pizza sauce, and seasonings together in a large bowl. Form into meatballs. Heat a non-stick skillet over medium-high heat. Cook meatballs until browned on all sides. Drain excess fat. Cook pasta in boiling water until al dente. Drain. Stir cheese into pasta. Serve meatballs on top. Sprinkle with more cheese. Serve immediately.

Heat butter in saucepan over low heat. Add garlic cloves and cayenne pepper. Cook for a few minutes until garlic is softened. Add cream cheese and stir until melted. Add milk and stir until smooth. Add parmesan cheese and stir until melted. Season with fresh ground black pepper. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees Fahrenheit. Line a 12-cup muffin pan with paper liners. In a large bowl, combine the sugar and butter. Beat until well blended. Beat in the buttermilk and eggs. Beat in the vanilla. Stir in the bananas. In a small bowl, combine the flour, baking soda and salt. Stir into the banana mixture. Fold in the blueberries. Fill the prepared muffin cups 3/4 full. Bake for 20-25 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Cool in the pan for 5 minutes before removing to wire racks to cool completely. Makes 12 muffins.

Boil potatoes in salted water until just cooked through. Drain and cool. In a large bowl combine potatoes with vinegar and oil. Add dill and season with salt and pepper. Stir in peppers, onions and feta cheese. Serves 4 as a side dish.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). Rub the pork with 1 teaspoon salt and the garlic cloves. Place in a large roasting pan. Combine the herbs and remaining 1/2 teaspoon salt and sprinkle over the pork. Drizzle with the olive oil. Roast in the preheated oven for 1 hour or until the meat thermometer registers 160 degrees F (70 degrees C). Let stand for 10 minutes before slicing. Serves 8.

Heat olive oil in crock pot on high until hot. Add leek and saute until golden. Add squash and cook until tender. Add salt, pepper and herbes de provence. Add beans and rotel tomatoes and heat through. Add mozzarella cheese and stir until melted. Serve on tortillas with avocado and bacon if desired.

Preheat oven to 350f. Line two large baking sheets with parchment paper. In the work bowl of your food processor, process the butter and flour until well combined. Add the caster sugar and custard powder and pulse until well combined. Add the vanilla and process just until the dough is combined. Add the chocolate chips and pulse until theyre just combined. On a clean work surface, use your hands to form the dough into a ball. Wrap the dough in plastic wrap and place in the fridge for 1 hour. Remove the dough from the fridge and roll it into 1-inch balls. Place the balls about 2 inches apart on the baking sheets. Bake for 10 minutes. Let the cookies cool on the baking sheet for 10 minutes and then move them to a wire rack to cool completely. Serves 24-30.
Mix all filling ingredients together. Pour into pie crust. Bake at 350 for 50 minutes. Cool for 1 hour.

In a medium bowl combine spinach with strawberries and toss with 1/3 cup white sugar and 1/8 teaspoon salt. Let stand for 5 minutes. In a small bowl combine red wine vinegar and remaining 1/4 cup white sugar. Stir in 1/4 cup oil and poppy seeds. Toss spinach mixture with vinegar mixture. Divide among individual salad plates and top with feta cheese, red onion and candied pecans.
Cut hot dog buns lengthwise. Spread each half of a bun generously with butter. Sprinkle bun halves with cheese. Sprinkle with sesame seeds. Broil until cheese is melted. Serve immediately.

In a slow cooker, combine onion and garlic cloves, water, barbecue sauce and salt and pepper to taste. Place pork roast in mixture. Cover and cook on high for 4 hours or on low for 7 hours. Remove pork from slow cooker and remove to a platter. Pour remaining liquid into a bowl. Skim fat from surface and stir to combine with pulled pork. Serve on buns or with rolls.

Grease and flour a tube pan. In a bowl beat together the butter and sugar. Add the eggs and vanilla. Beat well. Sift together the flour and baking powder. Add flour mixture alternately with milk to egg mixture. Beat just until combined. Pour into prepared pan. Bake at 325 degrees for one hour. Remove cake from pan and cool on a rack. Sprinkle with powdered sugar or dust with confectioners sugar.

Mix together sugar, cornstarch and water in saucepan. Cook over medium heat until mixture boils and thickens. Remove from heat. Stir in butter and lemon juice. Stir in lemon rind.Cover and cool. Serve with strawberries and shortbread cookies. Makes 1 1/2 quarts.

Mix red cabbage, apple juice, salt, and 1/4 cup water in a large bowllet stand 30 minutes to wilt. Stir in apples and raisins. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Whisk oil, vinegar, honey, mustard, and pepper in a small bowldrizzle dressing over salad. Bake 15 minutes. Serves 8.
Peel and slice the turnips. Heat the butter and oil in a pan and saute the turnips until tender. Add the milk and cook until the turnips are tender. Add salt and pepper. Serve with the French bread.

Mix together cream cheese and cheddar cheese. Blend in pineapple preserves until well combined. Place mixture into a pumpkin-shaped mold. Refrigerate 1 hour. Roll in chopped pecans. Serve with pretzel sticks and crackers. Makes 3 servings.

Cut fennel bulbs into 1/2 inch thick slices. Melt butter in large pot over medium high heat. Add garlic and saute for 1 minute. Add fennel and saute for 5 minutes until fennel is lightly browned and fragrant. Add thyme and season with salt and pepper. Cook 5 minutes longer. Add white wine and cook for 5 minutes. Add stock and bring to a boil. Cover and simmer for 15 minutes or until fennel is tender. Remove from heat and serve.

Boil potatoes until tender. Drain and cool. Cube or cut into bite-sized pieces and place in bowl with eggs and dressing. Add sweet gherkins and onion and mix well. Season with salt and pepper. May be served warm or cold.

Beat eggs until well-blended. Beat in milk. Add salt and pepper. Melt butter in a 6-inch skillet over medium heat. Add egg mixture. Cook slowly for 5 minutes or until the eggs are firm but not brown. Fold in cheese. Serves 1.

Pound the pork chops to 1/4 inch thickness. In a bowl combine the soy sauce, sugar and white wine. Pour over the pork and set aside for 30 minutes. In another bowl combine the five spice powder, cornstarch and the flour. Dip the pork into the flour mixture. Heat the oil in a large skillet. Add the pork and cook for 3 minutes over medium high heat. Turn the pork over and cook for 2 minutes. Add the remaining soy sauce mixture and turn the pork over. Cook for 1 minute or until the meat is cooked through. Serve with rice.
Peel parsnips. Cut into sticks. Heat the oil in a wok or frying pan. Add the parsnips. Fry for 8 to 10 minutes or until golden. Remove from the pan. Sprinkle with herbs.

Beat cottage cheese and eggs until smooth. Add lemon juice and powdered milk and mix well. Add honey and vanilla and stir. Pour into a 9x13 pan lined with wax paper and sprinkle with almond essence. Bake at 350 for 15 to 20 minutes or until firm. Let cool and remove from pan. Cut into bars. Serve and enjoy.

Beat whipping cream in medium bowl with electric mixer until stiff. Add sugar and vanillabeat until stiff peaks form. Chill 1 hour. Spoon into 6 glassestop with 1/2 cup ricotta cheese mixture and 1/2 cup mini chips. Garnish with a cherry and pecans.

Place the cranberries, port, cinnamon stick, water and sugar in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil, reduce heat to medium-low and simmer until reduced by half, about 40 minutes. Remove from heat and discard cinnamon stick. Let cool. Remove cranberries with a slotted spoon before serving sauce over roasted meats or game. Can be stored for up to one week in refrigerator.

Grease and flour muffin tins. In a bowl combine cornmeal, flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda and salt. Stir in egg and margarine until smooth. Pour into prepared tins and bake at 400F for 15-18 minutes. Cool for a few minutes and remove from tins. Spread with jam. Makes about 1 dozen.

In large bowl combine cereal, nuts, butterscotch chips and chocolate chips. In small saucepan melt 2 tablespoons of butterdrizzle over cereal mixture. Stir to mix well. Press into a 13" x 9" baking panrefrigerate. In small bowl mix powdered sugar, vanilla and enough milk to make icing of spreading consistency. Spread icing over cereal mixture. Chill before cutting into squares. Makes about 20 servings.
Place chicken in crock pot. Add sauerkraut and swiss cheese. Pour in thousand island dressing. Cook on low setting for 4 hours. Serve in pumpernickel bread with mayonnaise if desired.

In a large stockpot heat the oil over medium heat. Add the onion and cook until soft, about 2 to 3 minutes. Add the kielbasa and cook for 1 minute. Add the black-eyed peas and navy beans and cook for 1 minute. Stir in the brown rice and broth and bring to a boil. Add the garlic powder and cayenne pepper and reduce heat to low. Cook for 30 minutes. Add the thyme and cook for another 2 minutes. Serve hot.

To make pastry shells, combine flour, salt and shortening with a pastry blender or your fingers until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs with some lumps of shortening remaining. Stir in milk and knead into dough with your hands until mixture forms a ball. Divide into four equal portions and roll out on lightly floured surface with a floured rolling pin into four thin rounds. Line nine-inch pie plate with one of the rounds. Refrigerate remaining rounds.To make filling, combine pumpkin, milk, egg yolks, sugar, cloves and cinnamon in a large saucepan and cook over medium heat until thick and smooth, stirring constantly. Remove from heat and cool completely. Beat egg whites until stiff peaks form and fold into pumpkin mixture. Pour into pastry shells and bake in preheated oven for one hour. Cool completely on racks before serving. Makes four pies.

Bring large pot of salted water to a boil over high heat. Cook rotini pasta according to package directions. Drain pasta and return to pot. Add buttertoss to coat. Stir in onion, zucchini, tomatoes, lemon juice, basil leaves and 1/4 cup Parmesan cheesetoss to coat. Serve sprinkled with remaining 1/4 cup Parmesan cheese.

Melt the butter in a large heavy-bottomed pan and saute the onion until soft. Add the macaroni and saute a few more minutes. Add the water and bring to a boil. Add the tomatoes and cook for a few more minutes. Season with salt and pepper. Transfer to a baking dish. Top with breadcrumbs and bake for 20 minutes. Serves 4.

Sift all purpose flour and salt into a bowl. With a pastry blender or two knives, cut the shortening into the flour mixture. Add water and form into a ball. Divide into four parts. Roll out each part into a circle. Use a glass to cut the circles into circles. Wrap around the filling and pinch the edges together. Boil in water.

Whisk eggs and cream cheese together until smooth. Add milk, salt and pepper. In a large nonstick skillet over medium heat, melt butter. Add egg mixture. Cook and stir until eggs are almost set. Remove from heat. Stir in chives. Serve immediately.

Cut the apples into quarters. Melt butter in a baking dish. Add sugar and cinnamon to butter. Stir to combine. Add apples. Cover apples with the cinnamon sugar mixture. In a separate bowl combine flour, sugar, milk, vanilla, cinnamon, and nutmeg. Stir to combine. Pour flour mixture over apples. Cover dish with foil. Bake at 350 degrees for one hour. Remove from oven. Serve with whipped cream or ice cream.

In a medium bowl, whisk together the lemon juice and water. Add the sugar, cornstarch, and salt and stir to dissolve. In a medium saucepan over medium heat, whisk together the soymilk and margarine. Add the cornstarch mixture and cook and stir until thickened and smooth. Remove from the heat and stir in the lemon zest. Cool to room temperature and pour into a glass jar. Cover and refrigerate for 1 week. Makes about 2 cups. Per serving: 100 calories, 1.5 g fat (0 saturated), 0 mg cholesterol, 20 mg sodium, 25 g carbohydrates, 1 g protein.

Place the pineapple, mango and cucumber in a large mixing bowl. Dice and toss with the red bell pepper and cilantro. Add the lime juice. Mix well. Taste and adjust seasoning with salt and pepper. Arrange the sea scallops in a large glass serving bowl or on a serving platter. Spoon the salsa over the scallops. Serve immediately. Makes 8 servings.

Preheat the oven to 350f degrees. Grease an 8×12 inch baking dish or line it with parchment paper or foil sprayed with baking spray. Beat together the butter and cocoa in the bowl of an electric mixer fitted with the paddle attachment until smooth. Beat in the sugar until well blended. Beat in the eggs until smooth. Sift together the flour, baking soda, and salt. Beat into the chocolate mixture alternately with the milk until just combined. Pour into the baking dish and bake for 30 minutes or until the edges are firm to the touch and the center is still soft. Cool completely before cutting into squares. Serves 24.

Heat olive oil over medium high heat. Add pork steaks. Cook for 2-3 minutes on each side or until done to taste. Remove from heat. Sprinkle with salt, hot paprika, sage and garlic. Serve with baked potato or rice.

Bring water to a boil in a large saucepan. Add eggs and stir well. Reduce heat and simmer until eggs are cooked through. Add onion, celery and green bell pepper. Cook until vegetables are crisp-tender. Add ramen noodles. Cook until noodles are tender and soup is heated through. Makes 4 servings.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Lightly spray a 9 by 13 inch baking dish with cooking spray. Combine the corn muffin mix, diced green chiles, egg, water, and cheddar cheese in the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with the dough hook attachment. Knead until the dough comes together in a ball. Press the dough evenly into the prepared baking dish. Bake for 20 minutes. Meanwhile, combine the refried beans, enchilada sauce, onion powder, and garlic powder in a saucepan over low heatbring to a simmer, then simmer for 3 minutes. Remove from the heat, stir in the eggs, then set aside. Remove the baked crust from the oven. Spread the bean mixture evenly over the crust. Sprinkle with the cilantro and four-cheese Mexican blend cheese. Bake for an additional 15 minutes or until the crust is golden brown and the eggs are set. Let stand for 10 minutes before serving.

Split heads of garlic in half lengthwise. Wrap each half in foil. Bake at 325f for 1 hour or until cloves are soft and juicy. Cool slightly. Squeeze garlic from skins into food processor. Add 2 tablespoons water and process until smooth. Transfer to bowl. Heat canola oil and extra virgin olive oil in skillet over medium heat. Cook garlic cloves until golden brown about 5 minutes. Drain and cool slightly. Puree garlic in food processor until smooth. Stir in lemon juice. Stir puree into garlic puree and pour into small jar with tight-fitting lid. Store in refrigerator for up to 2 weeks.

Mix the coleslaw mix with mayonnaise in a bowl until thoroughly coated. Add chicken and toss to coat. Divide among tortillas. Roll up and secure with toothpicks. Refrigerate until ready to serve. Serve with light ranch dressing for dipping.

Boil noodles in salted water until al dente. Drain and set aside. In a small saucepan over medium heat, combine garlic, gingerroot and soy sauce. Cook until fragrant and slightly thickened. Remove from heat. In a large skillet over medium heat, combine tahini, sesame oil and onions. Cook until fragrant and slightly softened. Stir in soy sauce mixture. Stir in cilantro. Add noodles and toss to coat. Serve at once.

Place fish in an 18- by 12- by 2-inch baking dish. Sprinkle with lemon juice and 1/2 teaspoon each of pepper. Cover with tomatoes, green peppers, onions and basil. Drizzle with oil. Cover dish and bake in a 400 degree F oven for 25 minutes. Uncoversprinkle with breadcrumbs. Bake 10 minutes longer or until fish flakes easily when tested with a fork. Serve with pasta.

To make the syrup, squeeze the lemons into a large jug. Add the caster sugar and water. Whisk until the sugar has dissolved and the mixture is frothy. Set aside to cool.To make the lemonade, place the mint leaves in the bottom of 4 tall glasses. Divide the syrup between the glasses, then add a splash of mineral water and top each glass with 2 ice cubes. Stir gently.

Boil ravioli for 3 to 5 minutes. Remove ravioli from boiling water with a slotted spoon. Drain excess liquid. Combine spinach and chicken stock. Add to ravioli. Add parsley, salt and pepper. Cook for about 1 minute. Serve on Italian bread topped with parmesan cheese.

In a large skillet over medium heat saute sausage with onion and green bell peppers. Drain sausage mixture. Add ketchup, diced tomatoes and italian stewed tomatoes. Mix together and cook for about 10 minutes. Add ziti pasta, mix well. Transfer pasta to a greased 13 x 9 baking dish. Bake at 350 for 30 minutes. Remove from oven. Top with mozzarella cheese. Bake an additional 10 minutes. Serve warm.

Sauté the sausage in the olive oil until lightly browned. Add the tomato sauce. Add the oregano and the wine and reduce the heat to low. Simmer the sauce for 2 hours or until the sauce is thickened, stirring occasionally. Add the mushrooms and heat for 10 more minutes. Serve on toasted ciabatta bread or over pasta. Serve with green salad.

Preheat oven to 350f. Season steak with salt and pepper on both sides. Heat oil in skillet over medium heat for 30 seconds. Add steak and cook for about 3-5 minutes per side or until desired doneness. Transfer steak to baking sheet. Mix remaining sauce ingredients together. Pour over steak and bake for about 5 minutes until sauce thickens slightly. Serve steak sliced over a bed of spinach or with rice or noodles.

Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the onion, carrot, and celery and cook for 3 to 5 minutes. Add the salmon and stir until the fish flakes easily. Add the rice and barley and stir until the grains are coated. Add the water, the bay leaves and the thyme and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to low and cover. Cook for 20 minutes. Add the cilantro and the salt and pepper. Taste and adjust the seasonings as needed. Serve hot. Serves 4.

Place the raspberries in the bottom of a small saucepan. Add the sugar, port and chipotle and bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce the heat to low and simmer for 10 minutes until thick and jammy. Remove from the heat and let cool to room temperature. Chill for 2 hours or up to 1 week. Serves 8.

Grease an 11 x 15 baking pan with cooking spray or butter. In a large saucepan over medium heat, melt butter and sugar together. Stir occasionally. Remove from heat and stir in peanut butter until melted. Pour mixture into baking pan and spread evenly to form a thin layer. Bake for 5 minutes or just until the mixture starts to bubble around the edges. Remove from oven and sprinkle chocolate chips evenly over mixture. Let cool for about 10 minutes or until chocolate is set. Break into pieces and enjoy!

Melt butter over medium heat in a large heavy pot. Saute onion until translucent. Add flour and stir until lightly browned. Add milk and whisk constantly until thickened and bubbly. Add sherry, paprika and salt to taste. Add lobster meat and chives. Serve hot or chilled. Garnish with chives if desired.

Cook rice in boiling water until tender. Drain well. Combine rice with celery, onions, orange juice and rind. Butter a casserole dish. Add the rice mixture. Dot with butter. Bake in a 350f oven for 20 minutes. Top with almonds and parsley. Makes 4 servings.

In a large skillet over medium heat, combine sauerkraut and water. Cook and stir until heated through. Add sugar and caraway seeds. Continue cooking and stirring until sugar dissolves. Add applescook and stir until heated through. Stir in frankfurters and parsley. Serve immediately. Makes 4 main-dish servings.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).Combine the balsamic vinegar, honey, soy sauce, brown sugar, rosemary, and 1 teaspoon of the garlic in a small saucepan over medium heat. Cook and stir until the mixture comes to a boil, then remove from the heat.Place the drumsticks in a shallow baking dish. Pour the vinegar mixture over the chicken.Bake for 30 minutes in the preheated oven. Sprinkle the drumsticks with the sesame seeds and parsley. Makes 4 servings.
In small bowl combine brown sugar, orange juice and mustard. Pour over hambake at 325 degrees for 25 minutes per pound or until heated through.
Combine vinegar, mustard, thyme, oil, honey in a blender and blend until smooth. Pour over greens in a large serving dish and toss well. Add remaining ingredients.

In a bowl mix the whole wheat flour, white flour, salt, baking soda, white sugar and lemon juice. Add the skim milk and mix just until the dough forms a ball. Turn the dough out onto a lightly floured surface and knead until smooth. Place the dough into a greased loaf pan or bread pan. Bake at 400 degrees for 40 minutes or until golden brown. Cool on wire rack before slicing.

In a small skillet saute onion in butter until tender. In a large pot boil potatoes until tender. Drain and mash. Stir in sour cream. Add orange juice and zest. Stir until well blended. Add salt to taste. Serve immediately. Makes about 4 servings.

In medium bowl combine all dry ingredients. In large bowl cream together margarine, brown sugar and applesauce. Beat in eggs and vanilla. Gradually add dry ingredients, beating well after each addition. Stir in nuts. Shape into balls. Place about 1-inch apart on ungreased cookie sheet. Bake for 8-10 minutes. Let cool.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Remove pork shoulder from pork roast. Cut into large chunks. In a small bowl mix together the brown sugar, tequila, molasses, salt and pepper. Add the pork to a heavy bottomed oven safe pan. Rub the pork with the brown sugar mixture. Add the garlic cloves to the pan. Add water until pork is halfway submerged. Cover pan tightly with foil. Place the pan in the oven. Bake until pork is tender, about 2 hours. Remove pan from oven. Stir in the green onion. Serve in tortillas with a dollop of sour cream.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease a 9-inch square baking pan or an 8x8x2 inch baking pan. In a bowl, cream together shortening and sugar. Add eggs and beat well. Add flour and baking powder and beat until smooth. Add milk and vanilla and beat again. Add cinnamon and beat again. Spread in prepared pan and bake for 30 to 35 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.

Cook macaroni in salted boiling water for 12 minutes or until tenderdrain and rinse with cold water. In a large bowl combine macaroni with mayonnaise, baby shrimp, bouillon powder and season saltadd garlic powder and onion if desired. Cover and refrigerate at least 1 hour before serving. Add sweet pickles and pickle juice just before serving.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Cook pork chops in skillet for 3 minutes on each side or until light brown and cooked through. In a small bowl mix together mayonnaise and parmesan cheese. Spoon mixture over each chop. Top each chop with 1/2 of the onions and 1/4 of the soup mix. Bake uncovered for 10 minutes or until golden brown and bubbly. Serve with mashed potatoes and vegetables.

Heat oven to 350 degrees F. Place butter in 8-ounce microwave-safe coffee mug. Microwave on high for 1 to 2 minutes or until butter is melted. Add sugar, brown sugar, vanilla and salt. Stir until well blended. Add egg yolk. Stir well. Add flour. Stir until well blended. Stir in chocolate chips. Spoon batter into a 9-inch square baking dish. Bake 12 to 15 minutes or until set. Cool 2 minutes. Remove from pan. Cut into bars. Serve warm. Makes about 8 servings.

In a saucepan bring cider vinegar, sugar and mustard seeds to boil. Reduce heat. Add garlic, cucumbers, onions, chilies and pepper. Cover. Simmer for 5 minutes. Remove from heat. Allow cucumbers to cool in mixture. Arrange tomato slices on a platter. Spoon cucumbers over tomatoes. Chill at least 1 hour before serving. Serve with crackers.

Marinade can be made a day ahead. In a blender or food processor, process hoisin sauce, sambal oelek and scallions until smooth. Set aside. Place chicken in a large zip-top plastic bagadd red wine and hoisin marinade. Seal bag and turn to coat. Refrigerate 8 hours or overnight, turning the bag occasionally. Heat a large nonstick skillet coated with cooking spray over medium-high heat. Remove chicken from marinade. Add gingerroot and garlicsaute 1 minute. Add chicken and hoisin marinadecook 5 minutes. Add pepper and toss to coat. Cook 3 to 4 minutes longer or until no longer pink in center. Remove from heat. Serve immediately. Serves 6 to 8.
In a small saucepan combine all the ingredients. Heat until warm. Serve over steamed shrimp or scallops.

Heat the oil in a saut pan or small skillet over medium high heat. Saute the onion until soft. Add the cardamom, smooth peanut butter, brown sugar, soy sauce, lemon juice and liquid red pepper seasoning. Stir until well blended. Reduce heat to low. Simmer for 3-4 minutes. Serve warm.
Mix together the cake mix and pumpkin. Add the water and vanilla. Pour into paper cupcake holders. Bake at 350 degrees f for 10 minutes or until done. Cool. Frost with Cool Whip. Makes 12 cupcakes.

Place flour in a food processor and pulse for one minute, then add salt and honey and pulse for another minute. Add oil and egg yolk and pulse until mixture comes together in clumps. Turn dough out onto a floured surface and knead until smooth and elastic, adding more flour if dough is too sticky. Divide dough into two balls and place in two separate bowls, cover and let stand for an hour. Flatten each ball into an 8 inch circle and roll up like a jelly roll, pinch edges together and twist. Place in greased loaf pans and brush with milk. Bake for an hour at 400F / Gas 6. Cool on racks before serving.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Place chicken in a shallow baking pan. In a small bowl whisk together the vinegar, oil, garlic, rosemary, salt and pepper. Pour half of the mixture over the chicken. Bake the chicken for 30 minutes. Remove the chicken from the oven and pour the remaining sauce over the chicken. Bake for an additional 15 minutes or until cooked through. Serve the chicken warm or cold.

Season snapper with salt and pepper. Dip into buttermilk and then dredge in potato flakes. Place in a baking dish. Melt butter and pour over fish. Bake uncovered at 400 for 15 minutes or until fish flakes easily. Serve with lemon wedges.

In a large pot of boiling salted water, cook lamb until just cooked through, about 6 minutes. Drain lamb and set aside. In a small saucepan over low heat, simmer broth with split peas until softened, about 15 minutes. Mash split peas with a fork. In a large skillet, heat oil over medium heat. Add onions and cook until softened, about 5 minutes. Add lamb and cook until browned, about 5 minutes. Add broth and split peas. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer until peas are tender, about 10 minutes. Stir in almonds and apricots. Season with salt and pepper. Serve over basmati rice.

Combine garlic, rosemary, and salt in small bowl and set aside. Heat oil in large skillet over medium-high heat. Add green beans, and stir-fry until bright green about 3 minutes. Add rosemary mixture to skilletstir-fry 3 minutes longer or until beans are crisp-tender. Drain off excess oil. Serve immediately.

Heat oil in a large pot over medium heat. Saute onions for 5 minutes. Add okra, tomatoes, garlic and ginger. Cook for 5 minutes. Add cardamom and jalapenos. Cook for another 10 minutes. Transfer to a blender or food processor and puree. Return to the pot and heat through. Serve hot.

In a large pot over medium heat, saute onion and garlic in olive oil until onion is soft. Add flour and stir for 2 minutes to cook. Add yogurt and water and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 2 minutes. Add mint and parsley and stir well. Season with salt and pepper. Serve immediately with whole wheat toast.

In a large pot over medium heat, saute the white onion, the chiles guajillos, the garlic and the avocado until soft. Stir in the beans and the cream and cook until heated through. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve warm in deep bowls with tortilla chips on the side and crumbled white cheese sprinkled over the soup..

Combine cranberries, sugar, tapioca, and water in a medium saucepan. Cook over medium heat until mixture comes to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 1 minute. Stir in orange zest. Remove from heat. Let cool. Combine apples with flour, sugar, cinnamon and nutmeg. Add the cooled cranberry mixture. Pour into crust. Combine egg and milk. Brush over top of pie. Top with second crust. Cut several slits in crust to vent. Bake at 350 for 45 minutes or until crust is golden brown. Serve warm.

Mix together flour, salt and pepper to coat chicken breasts evenly. Heat oil in a non-stick pan over medium heat. Cook chicken in hot oil until golden on both sides, about 4-5 minutes per side. Add broth and wine to pan. Bring to boiling, reduce heat, cover and simmer for 3-5 minutes until chicken is no longer pink inside. Stir in mustard. In a small saucepan over medium heat, melt butter. Add sage leaves and saute until crisp (about 1 minute). Top chicken with sage butter sauce. Serve with rice or noodles.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Peel sweet potatoes and cut into bite size pieces. Combine sweet potatoes, brown sugar, orange juice, orange zest, nutmeg and salt in a large bowl. Pour into a baking dish that has been sprayed with cooking spray or greased with butter. Bake for approximately 1 hour or until sweet potatoes are tender. Combine coconut, granulated sugar, cinnamon and marshmallows in a large bowl. Spread the coconut mixture over the warm sweet potatoes. Return sweet potatoes to the oven for another hour or so or until the coconut is golden brown. Makes about 10 servings.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 1 1/2 to 2-quart casserole dish with butter or margarine. In a medium bowl, combine the sour cream and mayonnaise until smooth. Beat in the eggs and season with salt and pepper. Stir in the cheddar cheese and mix well. Add the broccoli and mushrooms and mix until combined. Pour into the prepared pan and spread evenly. Bake in the preheated oven for 30 minutes, or until bubbly and golden brown. Meanwhile, in a saucepan over medium heat, combine the chicken-flavored ramen noodles and the water and cook according to package instructions, or until the noodles are soft and cooked through. Stir the noodles into the casserole and bake for an additional 10 minutes or until the cheese is melted and bubbly. Serve hot.

Core pears and slice lengthwise into thin wedges. Combine blue cheese, vinegar, sugar, salt, pepper and tabasco sauce in small bowl. Mix well. Toss pears with dressing and arrange in a glass salad bowl. Garnish with walnuts and serve immediately. Makes 4 servings.

Heat the olive oil in a large saucepan. Add the onion and saute over medium heat until soft. Add the tomatoes and kalamata olives. Simmer for 10 minutes. Add the fresh spinach, cook until wilted. Season with parsley and salt and pepper to taste. Toss the penne with the spinach mixture and serve immediately.

Clean mushrooms, cut stems off, slice & set aside. Heat butter in pan. Add mushrooms & saute until brown. Add garlic cloves, nutmeg, lemon juice & salt & white pepper to taste. Let simmer for 5 minutes. Add cream & let simmer for 5 minutes. Remove from heat & cool to room temperature. Spread on toast & sprinkle parsley on top. Serve hot or cold.

Prepare batter in shallow dish by stirring together flour, salt and pepper. Beat together egg and milk in shallow bowl. Dip each piece of chicken first in flour and then in egg mixture and finally in flour again. Fry in 350-degree oil until golden and crisp. Drain on paper towels. Serve with favorite dipping sauce.
