In a small pot combine the water, sugar, dried apricots and lemon juice. Bring to a boil and then reduce to a simmer. Cook for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally. Remove from heat. Cool. Puree with an immersion blender. Pour into an ice cream machine and process according to the manufacturers instructions. When sorbet is almost frozen pour in the chopped apricots and almond extract and continue to process. Makes about 1 cup. Serves 1.
Mix all together. Cook on cookie sheet for 15 minutes at 350 degrees. Let cool for 5 minutes and eat. Makes 2 cookies.

Place brisket in a Dutch oven. Add sweet onions and garlic cloves. Cover and cook over low heat until meat is very tender and pulls apart easily, 3 to 4 hours.Add chili powder. Add beef base and Worcestershire sauce. Add cumin and hickory liquid smoke. Cover and continue cooking until brisket is tender enough to shred easily, 2 to 3 hours more.Meanwhile, cook onions and bell peppers in the remaining 3 tablespoons of olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Cook until vegetables are soft and beginning to brown, about 10 minutes. Add tomatoes and beer. Cook until vegetables are tender and the mixture is thickened, about 5 minutes. Remove from heat. Add chili sauce and stir well.Let brisket stand for about 10 minutes. Shred using two forks. Mix shredded brisket with vegetables. Makes 10 to 12 servings.

In a medium bowl combine water, flour and salt and stir until smooth. Melt butter in a large saucepan and add the flour mixture and stir with a whisk until smooth and bubbly. Remove from heat and add the eggs one at a time, stirring well after each addition. Return to the heat and cook over medium heat until the mixture thickens and forms a ball, about 5 minutes. Remove from heat and let cool for 5 minutes. Cut into 1-inch pieces and shape into balls. Roll each ball in flour and place on a baking sheet lined with waxed paper or parchment paper. Bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) until golden brown and crisp, about 10 minutes. Serve hot or cold with melted butter. Makes about 24 pieces.

In a medium bowl combine red potatoes and green onion tops. Add vegetable oil, vinegar and onions. Toss lightly and set aside in refrigerator for at least one hour. In a small bowl combine mayonnaise and yogurt. Fold in celery. Stir into potatoes. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Serve cold or at room temperature. Makes 4 servings.

In a large skillet, cook bacon until crisp. Remove bacon from skillet and set aside. In a large bowl, combine sausage meat with eggs and sour cream. Stir in bacon and cheese. Pour into unbaked pie crust and bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes or until set. Garnish with parsley.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Unfold pie crust. Place 1/2 of the spaghetti sauce on the crust. Top with 1/2 of the cheese, mushrooms, and chicken. Fold crust over and press edges. Place on ungreased baking sheet. Bake for 10-12 minutes until lightly browned. Cool slightly before serving. Makes 4 servings.

Beat butter until smooth. Add the sugar gradually. Blend well. Beat egg with lemon juice. Add to butter mixture. Blend well. Blend in flour. Beat until well mixed. Cover. Chill at least one hour. Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Roll into 1-inch balls. Place 2 inches apart on an ungreased cookie sheet. Bake for 8-10 minutes. Makes 4 dozen.

Drain tuna and place in mixing bowl. Add celery, onion and mayonnaise. Mix well. Spread on each bun halve. Top with mozzarella cheese and tomatoes. Broil until cheese melts and bun is toasted. Yields 2 servings. Serve on a bed of lettuce leaves.

Boil water in a pot and add coffee and cardamom pods. Stir. Cover pot and remove from heat. Let sit for a few minutes. Strain coffee and add a pinch of saffron and rose water. Serve in small coffee cups.
Cook macaroni and cheese mix according to package directions. Add broccoli cheese soup and milk. Add meat. Stir until meat is heated through. Serve with a side of crackers.

Prepare a hot grill. Place a shrimp on each skewer and place on the grill. Baste shrimp with olive oil and cook for about 3 minutes per side. In a blender combine parsley, lemon juice and garlic. Puree and add olive oil to form a thick paste. Place shrimp on a serving dish and drizzle puree over the top.

Bring milk to a simmer in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Add rice and vanilla. Cook until rice is tender and milk is absorbed, about 35 minutes. Add butter and saltremove from heat. Beat with an electric mixer at medium speed until smooth and creamy. Stir in egg. Beat at high speed until creamy. Fold in cream. Stir in vanilla. Pour into 10-inch pie plate. Sprinkle with cinnamon. Bake at 350F for 30 minutes. Let stand for 10 minutes. Serve warm.

In a heavy saucepan, heat oil over medium-high heat. Add onion, celery, and carrot. Cook until tender. Stir in stewed tomatoes, broth, thyme, salt and pepper. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat. Simmer for 10 minutes. Arrange chicken breasts in a casserole dish. Pour sauce over the top. Cover. Bake at 350 for 20 minutes. Serve hot.

Cut the tomatoes into thick slices. Mix together the lemon juice, sugar, olive oil and garlic and pour over the tomatoes. Season with the savory and red pepper. Marinate for at least 2 hours before serving. Serve at room temperature.

In a large mixing bowl, combine the pineapple, apricot and mango chutney. Add the apricot brandy and ground ginger. Mix well and chill for at least two hours. In a separate small bowl, combine the reduced-fat cheddar cheese and the fat free cream cheese. Add the margarine and stir well. Spread the mixture between two slices of whole wheat bread. Top with the pineapple apricot mixture. Slice and serve.

Mix together the sour cream, flour, sugar and the Mexican-style corn. In a large skillet over medium-high heat, add the ground beef and onions until no longer pink. Drain the fat. Add the Mexican-style corn mixture to the ground beef mixture along with the seasoning packet from the corn. Stir well and cook until the sauce thickens. Pour the mixture into a 9x13 inch casserole pan. Sprinkle the cheddar cheese evenly over the top of the casserole. Bake at 350 degrees for 20 to 25 minutes or until the cheese is melted. Serves 6 to 8.

In a large bowl combine broccoli florets with onion, sweetener, vinegar, mayonnaise, and salt. Mix well. Serve at room temperature or chilled. Store in refrigerator if not eating within 2 hours of preparing.

Combine 1 1/2 cups warm water and honey in a large mixing bowl. Sprinkle in the yeast and let sit for 5 minutes. In the meantime, add the oil to another bowl and heat it to 120 degrees F. Add the maple syrup to the yeast mixture and mix in the salt. Add the flour and 1/2 cup oatmeal and stir well. Add 1/2 of the raisins. Mix well. Stir in the remaining 1/2 cup of the flour and enough of the remaining 1/2 cup of the warm water to make a soft dough. Turn the dough out onto a lightly floured surface and knead until smooth and elastic, about 5-7 minutes. Place the dough in the oiled bowl, turn once to coat the surface and cover with plastic wrap. Let the dough rise in a warm place until doubled in bulk, about 1 hour. Punch down the dough. Divide it into 16 equal portions. Shape the portions into balls and place them in the wells of two greased 8-cup

Brown italian sausage in a large pot. Add zucchini, summer squash and onion. Cook 5 minutes. Add water. Bring to a boil. Add pasta sauce and pasta. Simmer 8 minutes. Add garbanzo beans and beef bouillon cube. Simmer 5 minutes. Serve.

Combine vital wheat gluten, nutritional yeast, cumin, onion powder, garlic powder, salt, and black pepper in a food processor. Pulse until combined. Add mushroom stock and soy sauce. Process until mixture is smooth. Add worcestershire sauce and process for 30 seconds. Divide mixture into 6 equal portions. Roll each portion into a log shape. Place logs on a baking sheet and bake until brown (approximately 20 minutes). Cut logs into slices. Serve immediately. Makes 6 logs.

Heat oil in skillet over medium heat. Add garlic and cook 1 minute or until garlic is lightly browned. Stir in broth. Cook over low heat 10 minutes. Season with salt and pepper. Ladle soup into individual soup bowls. Sprinkle with bread cubes. Dot top with egg. Serve immediately.

Place potatoes in a 9"x13" baking dish. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Pour sour cream over potatoes. Combine cream and parmesan cheeses. Sprinkle over potatoes. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes. Remove from oven. Sprinkle with cheddar cheese and chives. Bake an additional 5 minutes or until cheese is melted. Serves 6-8.
Combine chicken, celery, onion in bowl. Mix in lemon juice and salt. Stir in grapes and oranges. Blend in mayonnaise. Serve over romaine lettuce garnished with almonds.

Preheat oven to 180 degrees Celcius. Lightly grease and line 2 baking trays. Sift flour into a large bowl. Cream together the butter and brown sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in the eggs one at a time, followed by the vanilla. Stir in the flour until combined. Add the chocolate chips and Milo. Stir until well combined. Drop by teaspoonsful onto prepared trays, allowing 2 inches between each cookie. Bake for 10 minutes or until golden. Cool on trays for 5 minutes then transfer to wire racks to cool completely.
Combine all the ingredients in a blender. Mix until smooth. Chill and serve.
Mix powdered sugar with marshmallow cream and vanilla. Fold in caramels and pecans. Roll in pecan halves to form logs. Refrigerate until firm. Dust with powdered sugar. Makes 16 logs.

Bring a pot of water to boil and cook frozen spinach for 1 minute. Drain and cool for 10 minutes. Mix spinach, onion, and garlic in a large bowl. Add butter and stir to combine. Add eggs and mix. Add flour and mix well. Add cottage cheese and stir until just mixed. Add cheddar and stir until just mixed. Pour into a greased 9x13 inch baking dish. Bake for 25 minutes or until golden brown and cooked through.

Heat olive oil in large skillet over medium heat. Add garlic and saut until fragrant. Add spinach and cook until wilted, about 5 minutes. Add cannellini beans and season to taste with lemon juice and balsamic vinegar. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Serve with crackers or vegetables. Makes 4 servings.

Bring 4 cups water to a boil in a medium saucepan. Add salt cod. Cook for 10 minutes or until fish flakes easily with a fork. Drain fish. Crumble bacon into a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add cod and green pepper. Cook and stir until heated through. Make well in center of skillet. Add eggs. Cook and stir until scrambled. Add tomatoes. Season with pepper. Serve cod and eggs with toast.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Toss eggplant slices in a bowl with oil. Spread evenly on a baking sheet in a single layer. Roast for 15 minutes. Toss to turn eggplant slices over. Continue roasting for another 15 minutes or until eggplant is golden brown on both sides. Transfer slices to a medium bowl. Pour soy sauce over eggplant slices to completely coat them. Set aside for 10 minutes to allow flavors to marry. Add palm sugar, chili paste and lime juice to eggplant. Stir to combine. Taste and add salt as necessary. Fold in cilantro leaf and green onions. Serve immediately or refrigerate for up to 1 week. Serve with carrot sticks, celery sticks or chips as a dip or use in sandwiches or salads in place of mayo. Serves 4 as a dip or 2 as a sandwich spread.

Trim asparagus tips and cut stalks into 2-inch lengths. Cut shiitakes into 2-inch lengths. Heat oil in large saute pan over medium heat. Add mushrooms and asparagus and saute until asparagus is crisp-tender and mushrooms are golden, about 8-10 minutes. Season with salt and pepper. Toss with vinegar and serve immediately. Serves 2.

In a medium saucepan combine water, quick cooking oats, flaked coconut, morton lite salt and coconut extract. Cook and stir over medium heat until thickened about 10 to 15 minutes. Pour into a serving bowl and serve warm or cold with fat free sweetened condensed milk. Top with additional coconut flakes if desired.

In a large saucepan bring 6 cups of chicken stock to a boil. In a medium skillet cook chicken breasts in 2 tablespoons of oil until brown. Remove from heat. Cut into cubes. In a Dutch oven heat 2 tablespoons of oil over medium heat. Add the rice and cook until lightly browned. Add 1/2 cup of chicken stock. Stir until stock is absorbed. Continue adding 1/2 cup of stock at a time, stirring constantly until rice is cooked. Add chicken stock to pan. Cook until rice is tender. Stir in chicken. Add saffron strands. Cook until chicken is heated through. Stir in leeks. Stir in lemon zest. Cook for 2 minutes. Remove from heat. Add frozen peas. Stir until heated through. Serve immediately. Makes 4 servings.

Cook rice as directed. Cut up cooked chicken breasts into bite-size pieces. Mix cooked rice, cream of chicken soup and milk together. Add the chicken pieces and stir. Mix together with 1 cup of shredded cheddar cheese. Add salt and pepper to taste. Bake at 350F degrees for 20 minutes or until cheese is bubbly. Remove from oven. Add remaining 1/2 cup of shredded cheese. Bake another 5 minutes or until cheese is golden brown.

Cream the butter and sugar together until very light and fluffy. Beat in the eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition. Stir together the flour and baking powder. Gradually add to the butter mixture and beat until combined. Stir in the lemon juice and rind. Pour the mixture into a greased and lined loaf tin and bake at 350 for one hour or until a skewer inserted in the centre comes out clean. Remove from the oven and leave to cool slightly on a rack. Dust with icing sugar and garnish with lemon slices or rind strips to serve.
Sauté ground beef and vegetables. Add tomato paste and crushed tomatoes. Bring to boil. Reduce heat. Add noodles and simmer for 15 minutes. Top with shredded cheese. Makes 6 servings.

Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Cook the noodles according to the package directions. Drain. In a skillet heat the butter over medium heat. Add the noodles and herbs. Toss to combine. Season with salt and pepper. Serve immediately.

In a large bowl combine all the ingredients. Stir to combine. The mixture should stick together. Press into a pie plate to a thickness of about 1/4 inch. Bake for 20 minutes. Remove from the oven and allow to cool. Cut into strips. Store tightly covered in refrigerator. They can be stored up to 1 week.

Preheat oven to 375 Fahrenheit. Season chicken with salt and pepper. Heat oil in large ovenproof skillet over medium high heat. Cook chicken until browned on both sides. Remove chicken from skillet. Stir together honey, garlic, ginger, soy sauce, vinegar, red pepper flakes and lemon juice in skillet until well blended. Pour over chicken. Return chicken to skillet. Bake 30 minutes in the preheated oven, or until chicken is done. Makes 2 servings.

Season chicken with garlic salt and pepper. Brown in oil in skillet. Add onion and broccoli and saute until tender. Remove chicken and set aside. Add rice, soup and milk to skillet. Heat and stir until rice is tender. Return chicken to skillet and heat through. Top with cheese and serve. Makes 4 servings.

Cut potatoes into thin slices and place in a bowl of water with 1 teaspoon of vinegar to prevent browning. Drain on paper towels and refrigerate until chilled. To prepare dressing combine mayonnaise, sour cream, vinegar, garlic, pepper and salt. Whisk well. Arrange potatoes on salad plates. Sprinkle with onion and celery. Drizzle dressing over potatoes and serve immediately.

In a large pot over medium-low heat, saute shallots and garlic in butter until shallots are translucent. Add beans, broth, parsley, vinegar, mustard and olive oil. Season with salt and pepper. Heat through. Serve hot or chill to serve cold. Garnish with parsley if desired. Serve over a bed of greens for a complete meal.

To prepare the ginger slice the ends from the root and then cut the root into 2-inch pieces. Add to a saucepan with 1 cup of water and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and cook for 15 minutes or so. Remove ginger and set aside to cool. Cut the shiitake mushroom stems from the caps and slice the stems into thin rounds and the caps into thin strips. Heat olive oil and saute ginger and shiitake stems over medium heat for three or four minutes. Add shiitake caps and stir-fry for a few minutes more. Add chicken stock and water and bring to a boil. Add ginger and continue to boil for ten or fifteen minutes or so. Remove from heat and set aside for a few minutes to cool a bit. Put noodles into a pot of boiling water and cook for five or six minutes or so. Drain and set aside. Add soy sauce to soup and stir to mix. Add spinach and lime juice to soup and stir to mix. Add noodles to soup and stir to mix. Serve hot.

In a large skillet cook sausage over medium heatuntil brown. Add squash and cook for about 3 minutes longer. Meanwhile, combine salad dressing, garlic and oregano in a small bowl. Drain sausage mixture on paper towels to remove grease. Add squash mixture to dressing mixturetoss gently to coat. Spoon mixture onto bread roundssprinkle with cheese. Makes 4 appetizers.

In a large saucepan cook the rice in the water. Cook the rice according to directions. Meanwhile in a large skillet saute the onions in the butter. Add the rice along with the bay leaf, salt, pepper and hot pepper sauce. Simmer for 5 minutes. Add the peas. Remove the bay leaf. Sprinkle with parsley. Makes 4 servings.

Spray 2 baking sheets with cooking spray. Cut squash in half lengthwisescrape out seeds. Place squash halves face down on baking sheetsbake at 425 for 45 minutes or until tender when pierced with knife. Cut into 1/2-inch piecesset aside. In a large skillet, heat oil over medium heat. Add onion and rosemarycook 3 minutes or until softened. Stir in rice and garliccook 2 minutes, stirring constantly. Stir in stock and 1 cup watercook 15 minutes or until liquid is absorbed and rice is tender. Stir in squash and remaining 1 cup watercook 5 minutes or until liquid is absorbed and rice is tender. Stir in cheesecook 1 minute or until melted. Stir in vinegar and saltcook 1 minute or until blended. Serve immediately.

To make crust combine 2 cups graham cracker crumbs and 1/4 cup butter in a bowl. Press mixture firmly onto bottom and sides of a pie plate. Bake at 375 for 5 minutes or until crust is set. Let cool completely on a wire rack. For filling, combine sweetened condensed milk and eggs in a large bowlstir well with a whisk. Pour filling into crust. Bake at 400 for 10 minutes or until filling is set. Cool completely on a wire rack. For topping, combine the chocolate chips and shortening in a microwave-safe bowl. Microwave at HIGH for 1 minutestir. Microwave at HIGH for an additional minute or until chocolate is meltedstir until smooth. Spread chocolate over cooled fillingsprinkle with pecans and caramel ice cream topping. Chill for at least 2 hours or until set.

Place lentils into a saucepan and cover with water about 3 inches above lentils. Bring to a boil over high heat then reduce heat to medium low and simmer uncovered for 30 minutes or until lentils are tender. Heat oil over medium heat in a large nonstick skillet. Add ground beefcook 10-15 minutes or until browned and crumbled, stirring to break up beef into small pieces. Drain. Stir soup mix into lentilscover. Simmer uncovered over medium heat for 10 minutes or until heated through. Add beef and remaining ingredients except parsleystir well. Cook over low heat 10 minutes or until hot. Garnish with parsley, if desired. Makes 8 servings.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f (175 degrees c).In a large pot of boiling water cook potatoes until tender. Drain and return to pot. Add butter and condensed cream of chicken soup. Mash until smooth. Add sour cream and cheese and beat to combine. Season with salt and pepper.Pour into a greased 8x8x2 baking dish. Bake at 350 degrees f (175 degrees c) for 45 minutes or until golden brown.

Place tuna in a resealable plastic bag. Add lime juice and oil. Add jerk spice. Shake until well blended. Refrigerate for 2 hours or longer. Remove from bag and pat dry. Grill over medium heat for 5-6 minutes per side. Serve on salad or rice.
Soak beans overnight in water. Drain beans and place in crockpot. Combine remaining ingredients and pour over beans. Cook on low heat for about 8 hours or high heat for about 3 hours. Serves 6-8.
Peel oranges. Slice oranges into thin slices. Chop lettuce. In a large bowl combine all of the salad ingredients. Serve immediately.

In a skillet saute the ham in the butter until cooked and set aside. Dip each breast into the soup mixture. Lay a piece of ham on each breast and roll up. Place in crock pot and cover with cream of mushroom soup. Sprinkle with the remaining ingredients and cook on low for 6 hours or until done. Serve with rice and green beans.
